title: People & Culture Data Analyst
description: <strong>Organizational Summary:</strong> <p><br></p>After School Matters is a Chicago-based nonprofit organization that annually offers after-school and summer programs to nearly 19,000 Chicago high school teens to explore and develop their talents while gaining critical skills that will set them up for success in college and beyond.<p><br></p>Thirty years later, now known as After School Matters, our program has engaged more than 400,000 Chicago teens and is the nation’s largest and most successful provider of after-school and summer programs for high school teens. No other organization offers programs to high school students at the scale and quality that we do.<p><br></p>We offer paid apprenticeships led by professionals in the fields of arts, communications and leadership, sports, and STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, and Math). Our nationally respected youth development model has been replicated in cities across the country and earned us the City Livability Award from the U.S. Conference of Mayors.<p><br></p>Programs take place at community locations throughout the city, including three ASM buildings: downtown at Gallery 37 Center for the Arts, the Michael and Karyn Lutz Center in Belmont Cragin, and the Pullman community at Gately Park.<p><br></p>Currently, After School Matters' annual operating budget is approximately $35M and employs approximately 500 staff across the organization.<p><br></p>For more information, visit<p><br></p><strong>Summary of Position:</strong><p><br></p>After School Matters is looking for a data guru to join our People and Culture team to help drive people analytics to the next level. You’ll be the main point of contact for our P&amp;C team for all things data, serving as an HRIS expert with ADP, and elevate our analysis of data through PowerBI.<p><br></p>Reporting to the Director of People and Culture, the P&amp;C Data Analyst is an integral part of the team and will be involved with developing and maintaining the tools that allow the company to have the best analytics and insights on all matters that impact our employees and employee instructors.<p><br></p>This role will be involved in creating and administering reports, dashboards, and analytics utilizing workforce demographic and transactional data from multiple sources. While reporting and data analytics will be the primary focus of the role, this position will also support other areas of ASM’s People and Culture Department, which includes Recruiting, On/Offboarding, Learning, Performance Management, Benefits and Compensation. The ideal candidate should be passionate about using data to positively influence business decisions.<p><br></p><strong>Major Duties and Responsibilities:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Manage and maintain the pre-employment and offer process for all employees and seasonal instructors as well as teen interns.</li><li>Build and maintain People and Culture dashboards and tools to provide consistent reporting on key analytics that include: ASM People Dashboard, IDEA scorecard, Recruiting Dashboard.</li><li>Manage, maintain, and make necessary improvements to processes supported by Jotform.</li><li>Support annual compensation, benefit, audit, and regulatory compliance processes.</li><li>Complete ad-hoc reporting requests in support of People and Culture and business initiatives</li><li>Identify trends to existing People and Culture processes by reviewing and analyzing data.</li><li>Demonstrate and promote reporting best practices.</li><li>Ensure data quality of all reporting deliverables.</li><li>Coordinate with various ASM functions and departments to collect data and/or general information regarding the organization for reporting purposes.</li><li>Partner with various ASM functions and departments to ensure data integrity, to identify potential issues and troubleshoot to resolution.</li><li>Support maintenance and improvements to existing reports and Power BI dashboards.</li><li>Identify process efficiencies and look to implement solutions through technology.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Skills &amp; Abilities:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Advanced Microsoft Excel skills and proficiency in MS Office applications required.</li><li>Excellent organizational, conceptual, and analytical skills; strong process orientation, problem solving and trouble-shooting skills; a firm commitment to quality.</li><li>Skilled in developing and facilitating collaborative relationships and interacting with people at all levels in the organization.</li><li>Demonstrated experience in managing multiple projects at one time, able to respond to requests quickly, willingness to be flexible, and able to work in a fast paced, high-energy environment.</li><li>Detail oriented and capable of meeting deadlines.</li><li>Ability to exercise discretion and sound judgment.</li><li>Strong oral and written communication skills.</li><li>Strong orientation to customer service (i.e., ASM staff and teens)</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's degree or equivalent required; Computer science, data science, engineering, or related fields preferred.</li><li>1-3 years related work experience.</li><li>Experience with a data visualization platform (Tableau, Power BI, etc), experience with Microsoft Power BI preferred.</li><li>Experience using SQL, R, Python, or other similar languages.</li><li>Experience with ADP is a plus.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Physical Demands:</strong><p><br></p>The physical demands here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.<p><br></p><ul><li>Must be able to sit for long periods of time.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Work Environment:</strong><p><br></p>The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.<p><br></p><ul><li>While performing the duties of this job, the employee is not exposed to weather conditions</li><li>The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate.</li><li>Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:</li><li>Strong ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, agile environment and manage multiple projects/activities simultaneously</li><li>Strong analytical mindset with a problem-solving aptitude</li><li>Ability to identify trends in data and develop analyses to communicate them</li><li>Proven ability to take initiative, be innovative and work independently</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Additional Requirements:</strong><p><br></p>Staff are required to provide proof of COVID-19 Vaccination or have an approved medical or sincerely held religious beliefs exemption prior to starting employment. If a medical or sincerely held religious belief exemption is approved, weekly Polymerase Chain Reaction (PCR) testing is required part of any reasonable accommodation.<p><br></p><strong>How to Apply:</strong><p><br></p>Submit a cover letter and resume at http://afterschoolmatters.applytojob.com/apply<p><br></p> <em>EEO:</em> <p><br></p><em>After School Matters is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, protected veteran status, military discharge status, age, marital status, parental status, or source of income.</em><p><br></p>Powered by JazzHR<p><br></p>J8nQ1DXQYs

title: Market Data Analyst
company: Center for Research in Security Prices, LLC (CRSP)
description: <p><strong>PRINCIPAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES: </strong></p><ol><li>Responsible for the execution of update tasks for assigned databases.</li><li>Responsible for the research and correction of data outliers, as identified in update procedures and historical research. </li><li>Effectively collaborate and coordinate with the Managers, Project Leaders, Client Services and other Staff during the update process, historical research projects and/or client inquiries. </li><li>Assist with historical projects to verify existing CRSP data. </li><li>Assist with insuring data and database integrity.</li><li>Use of the Internet for company and securities research. </li><li>Moderate data entry with accuracy and the use of various internal computer systems and Microsoft Office products. </li><li>Other duties as assigned. </li></ol><p><br></p><p><strong>REPORTING RELATIONSHIPS: </strong> Assistant/Associate Director, Research Operations</p><p><br></p><p><strong>KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE: </strong></p><ol><li>A Bachelor's degree in Finance, Economics or Accounting OR a Bachelor's degree with a passing score on the CFA Level 1 exam is required.</li><li>One (1) year industry experience is required. Banking, Brokerage or other Securities Industry back office experience is preferred.</li><li>Proficiency in financial theory and terminology is required.</li><li>Ability to perform multiple, complex assignments under limited direction required. </li><li>Ability to plan and accomplish assignments, either as an individual contributor or as a member of a team, based on their experience and technical knowledge of systems and subsystems required. </li><li>Ability to provide training to other employees required. </li><li>Ability to effectively communicate and achieve positive results, share information, provide data, furnish guidance and discuss assignment status within the immediate work unit required.</li><li>Ability to develop basic SQL queries required.</li><li>Ability to use MS Office tools (including Word, Access and Excel) at least at an intermediate level required.</li><li>Ability to satisfactorily perform at least two (2) CRSP update processes (e.g. Stock, Bond, Compustat, Mutual Fund, REIT ) with minimal supervision or assistance OR experienced in performing similar functions while working for another financial database product provider required. </li><li>Ability to satisfactorily perform at least two (2) CRSP support functions (e.g. Distributions, Bulletins, Returns, etc.) <strong>or </strong>experienced in performing similar functions while working for another financial database product provider.</li><li>Experience answering client data inquiries and performing data edits as directed by coordinators or supervisors required.</li><li>Experience collaborating with programmers and other analysts on projects and activities required.</li><li>Excellent written and verbal communication skills required.</li><li>Ability to meet deadlines and work as part of a team required.</li><li>Careful attention to detailed data entry required.</li><li>Experience with data quality assurance and quality control preferred.</li><li>Experience with market data preferred.</li><li>Experience with Agile development process a plus.</li><li>A commitment to product quality, the ability to multi-task, organizational skills and positive energy are also valued. </li></ol><p><br></p><p><strong>QUALIFICATIONS</strong></p><p><br></p><p><strong>Behaviors </strong></p><p><br></p><p><strong>Required</strong></p><p><br></p><p><strong>Detail Oriented:</strong> Capable of carrying out a given task with all details necessary to get the task done well.</p><p><strong>Dedicated: </strong>Devoted to a task or purpose with loyalty or integrity. </p><p><br></p><p><strong>EDUCATION</strong></p><p><br></p><p><strong>Required</strong></p><p><br></p><p>Bachelor's Degree or better in Accounting</p><p>Bachelor's Degree or better in Economics</p><p>Bachelor's Degree or better in Finance</p><p><br></p><p><strong>EXPERIENCE</strong></p><p><br></p><p><strong>Required</strong></p><p><br></p><p><strong>One (1) year industry experience is required. </strong></p><p><strong>One (1) year Banking, Brokerage or other Securities Industry back office experience is preferred.</strong></p>

title: Data Analyst (19-22/hr)
description: NO SPONSORSHIP<p><br></p><strong> Data Quality Test Engineer</strong><p><br></p>LOCATION: CHICAGO, IL<p><br></p>The ideal candidate will be local and possibly open to contract-to-hire down the road.<p><br></p><strong>Second choice is fully remote</strong><p><br></p>Duration: Minimum one year<p><br></p>SELLING POINTS: Must be solid in SQL Database implementation new features improvement of existing functionality for data architecture projects. Integration testing, customer data quality, testing data verification, regression testing.<p><br></p>The Test Engineer will be responsible for ensuring the successful implementation of new features as well as improvement of existing functionality for data architecture projects. This includes Integration testing, Customer Data Quality testing, Data verification testing, Regression testing etc.<p><br></p>This is a hands-on testing position which requires deep knowledge and understanding of all aspects of developing and executing Back End testing. The Test Engineer must be an advocate for all things Testing and Quality Assurance while driving and implementing best practices. The ideal candidate must possess strong analytical and critical thinking abilities. Data testing skills are required.<p><br></p><strong><u>Position Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's degree</li><li>Hands-on experience using SQL queries for results validation and data mining.</li><li>Hands-on experience in Planning and Manual test execution.</li><li>Experience in Regression Test Strategies, Regression suite maintenance and execution.</li><li>At least 3-5 years of professional experience on a variety of projects in Test Strategy, Test Design, Test Execution analysis &amp; reporting.</li><li>Hands-on experience with Jira, ALM, TFS/ADO or similar systems of record.</li><li>Understanding of Development and Test cycles, including respective best practices.</li><li>Hands-on experience in Agile and Waterfall methodologies.</li><li>Ability to troubleshoot issues, identifying root causes and support development team in development of resolutions.</li><li>Strong communication and Client/Business interfacing and interpersonal skills are a must.</li></ul>

title: Application Support Analyst
description: Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, gt.school. Have you got what it takes?<p><br></p>Do you take pleasure in looking at and interpreting data? Are you passionate about education and want a role in a startup that wants to revolutionize how technology is used to learn? If yes, keep on reading…<p><br></p>We’re looking for individuals who:<p><br></p><ul><li>Are strategic problem solvers who can quickly devise and implement solutions to address ad-hoc issues facing our students</li><li>Are excellent communicators; able to concisely and effectively describe processes in written playbooks, design engaging student communication, and keep other team members consistently updated with progress on projects. </li><li>Consider themselves to be consistent, high performers who rarely have ‘off-days’.</li><li>Understand the importance of revolutionizing the education space with cutting-edge technology.</li></ul><p><br></p>In this role, you’ll work directly with our EdTech company, gt.school. You’ll develop an expert understanding of the data we collect on students and become familiar with all the apps and systems we use to collect and store this information. You will build new edtech tools and operational processes, and restructure existing processes to be more efficient.<p><br></p>Not only will you gain valuable experience, but you’ll also receive regular coaching and training from a team of global tech experts and operations professionals. You’ll get constructive feedback on all of your work to help you develop and get a chance to meet daily with other team members to work collaboratively on projects.<p><br></p>Interested in a role that involves research, strategy, product development, and data science in the cutting-edge field of education and technology? Apply below.<p><br></p><strong><u>What You Will Be Doing</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Participating in daily stand-up calls to solve the most critical issues facing students in our program, other staff members such as Motivational Coaches, Academic Coaches, Program Directors, or the leadership team.</li><li>Converting important decisions made by leadership into work units that a junior Operations team can perform.</li><li>Creating robust processes that stand the test of time and capture all of the edge-cases to ensure maximum probability of success the first time around. </li><li>Troubleshooting issues facing our students due to data issues, human error, or automation error; quickly strategizing a bulletproof solution that solves the issue and prevents further recurrence in the future.</li><li>Working as a team to ensure progress is being made on key tasks by communicating with other operations analysts and managers to ensure no lapse in service for internal or external stakeholders.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>What You Won’t Be Doing</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Collecting data or performing administrative tasks - we have a junior operations analyst team to do this type of work.</li><li>Providing loose or generalized solutions that don’t actually get implemented.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Analyst Key Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p>Same as “What you will be doing”, above.<p><br></p><strong><u>Basic Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Excellent written and verbal English communication skills</li><li>Proficient in Python or R (we will test this)</li><li>2+ years of work experience working in a technical field (science, technology, financial services, data science)</li><li>Bachelor’s degree from a top 20 US university or a top 100 global university.</li><li>Consistently able to work 8 hours per day, Monday through Friday, between 6AM and 6PM CST</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Nice-to-have Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Advanced in Python and Apps Script</li><li>Familiarity with Canvas (LMS)</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>About Gt.school</u></strong><p><br></p>gt.school is a stealth EdTech startup in Austin, Texas, the center of educational innovation in the US. Our unique approach leverages 50+ years of learning science, cutting-edge data analytics and high-performance life skills coaching. In doing so, we can help students learn 5x faster and unlock their full potential in both academics and in life. We are a remote-first company that hires globally via Crossover.<p><br></p>There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!<p><br></p><strong>Working with Crossover</strong><p><br></p>This is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $30 USD/hour, which equates to $60,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.<p><br></p><strong>What to expect next:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.</li><li>Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Important!</strong> If you do not receive an email from us:<p><br></p><ul><li>First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.</li><li>Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.</li><li>Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.</li><li>If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.</li></ul> Crossover Job Code: LJ-4880-US-Chicago-Analyst.017<p><br></p>

description_json: Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, gt.school. Have you got what it takes?<p><br></p>Do you take pleasure in looking at and interpreting data? Are you passionate about education and want a role in a startup that wants to revolutionize how technology is used to learn? If yes, keep on reading…<p><br></p>We’re looking for individuals who:<p><br></p><ul><li>Are strategic problem solvers who can quickly devise and implement solutions to address ad-hoc issues facing our students</li><li>Are excellent communicators; able to concisely and effectively describe processes in written playbooks, design engaging student communication, and keep other team members consistently updated with progress on projects. </li><li>Consider themselves to be consistent, high performers who rarely have ‘off-days’.</li><li>Understand the importance of revolutionizing the education space with cutting-edge technology.</li></ul><p><br></p>In this role, you’ll work directly with our EdTech company, gt.school. You’ll develop an expert understanding of the data we collect on students and become familiar with all the apps and systems we use to collect and store this information. You will build new edtech tools and operational processes, and restructure existing processes to be more efficient.<p><br></p>Not only will you gain valuable experience, but you’ll also receive regular coaching and training from a team of global tech experts and operations professionals. You’ll get constructive feedback on all of your work to help you develop and get a chance to meet daily with other team members to work collaboratively on projects.<p><br></p>Interested in a role that involves research, strategy, product development, and data science in the cutting-edge field of education and technology? Apply below.<p><br></p><strong><u>What You Will Be Doing</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Participating in daily stand-up calls to solve the most critical issues facing students in our program, other staff members such as Motivational Coaches, Academic Coaches, Program Directors, or the leadership team.</li><li>Converting important decisions made by leadership into work units that a junior Operations team can perform.</li><li>Creating robust processes that stand the test of time and capture all of the edge-cases to ensure maximum probability of success the first time around. </li><li>Troubleshooting issues facing our students due to data issues, human error, or automation error; quickly strategizing a bulletproof solution that solves the issue and prevents further recurrence in the future.</li><li>Working as a team to ensure progress is being made on key tasks by communicating with other operations analysts and managers to ensure no lapse in service for internal or external stakeholders.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>What You Won’t Be Doing</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Collecting data or performing administrative tasks - we have a junior operations analyst team to do this type of work.</li><li>Providing loose or generalized solutions that don’t actually get implemented.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Analyst Key Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p>Same as “What you will be doing”, above.<p><br></p><strong><u>Basic Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Excellent written and verbal English communication skills</li><li>Proficient in Python or R (we will test this)</li><li>2+ years of work experience working in a technical field (science, technology, financial services, data science)</li><li>Bachelor’s degree from a top 20 US university or a top 100 global university.</li><li>Consistently able to work 8 hours per day, Monday through Friday, between 6AM and 6PM CST</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Nice-to-have Requirements</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Advanced in Python and Apps Script</li><li>Familiarity with Canvas (LMS)</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>About Gt.school</u></strong><p><br></p>gt.school is a stealth EdTech startup in Austin, Texas, the center of educational innovation in the US. Our unique approach leverages 50+ years of learning science, cutting-edge data analytics and high-performance life skills coaching. In doing so, we can help students learn 5x faster and unlock their full potential in both academics and in life. We are a remote-first company that hires globally via Crossover.<p><br></p>There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!<p><br></p><strong>Working with Crossover</strong><p><br></p>This is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $30 USD/hour, which equates to $60,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.<p><br></p><strong>What to expect next:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.</li><li>Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Important!</strong> If you do not receive an email from us:<p><br></p><ul><li>First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.</li><li>Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.</li><li>Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.</li><li>If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.</li></ul> Crossover Job Code: LJ-4880-US-Chicago-Analyst.017<p><br></p>

title: Associate Analyst, Connected Services
description: Invenergy drives innovation in energy. Powered by decades of entrepreneurial experience and unparalleled execution, we solve the energy challenges facing our customers and communities. We provide power generation and storage solutions at scale around the world to create a cleaner energy future. We develop. We build. We own. We operate. We are Invenergy.<br><br><strong><u>Job Description<br><br></u></strong><strong>Position Overview <br><br></strong>The Engineer I, Interconnections and Grid Analysis will perform technical analysis to assist in the interconnection process for the different generation projects. Based out of Invenergy’s Chicago office, the Engineer I, Interconnections will also be responsible for assisting in other transmission associated activities and analysis, including interpreting the different market rules as they apply to the interconnection process.<br><br><strong><u>Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li>Support submission and management of new Generation Interconnection Requests</li><li>Perform power flow analysis and market related evaluations as part of generation and transmission development activities.</li><li>Provide grid, transmission system planning and congestion evaluation, to assist in development activities mainly in NYISO, PJM, ISONE and SERC regions.</li><li>Review utility and ISO transmission expansion plans to identify potential opportunities.</li><li>Review utility interconnection studies (impact, stability and facility).</li><li>Identify areas for new transmission projects based on generation technological shifts and the corresponding impacts it has on grid behavior.</li><li>Utilize regulatory and compliance knowledge to identify and evaluate areas of critical impact for projects in the interconnection pipeline.</li><li>Interpret market rules as they apply to the interconnection study, construction, and operation of generation projects</li><li>Work with regulatory team to provide input on queue reforms and process changes as necessary.</li><li>Develop conceptual design of interconnection facilities and costs. </li><li>Assist in conceptual design of wind farm and solar electrical collection systems (34.5kV), substations (34.5kV – transmission voltage 115kV – 230kV – 345kV), and project owned transmission lines.</li><li>Perform technical diligence for potential M&amp;A projects</li><li>Perform complex Transmission delivery assessments to support Origination and business opportunities for RFPs.</li><li>Coordinate with consultants to prepare system models and perform reliability and economic studies.</li><li>Establish relationships with various technical experts among stakeholders, utilities, RTO/ISOs.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Required Skills<br></u></strong><ul><li>BS or MS in Electrical Engineering with a focus on power systems</li><li>0-1 year of experience in transmission system planning, compliance and operations including complex power flow, short circuit, and stability studies.</li><li>Proficiency in spreadsheet modeling using Microsoft Excel.</li><li>Excellent verbal and written communication skills<br></li></ul><strong><u>Preferred<br></u></strong><ul><li>Knowledge of FERC, NERC standards related to transmission and interconnections, including Open Access Transmission Tariff (OATT) a plus.</li><li>NYISO, PJM, SERC, ISONE experience preferred.</li><li>Experienced in the use one of power flow software such as PSS/E, TARA, PowerWorld, PSLF, or PSCAD similar software package a plus. <br></li></ul><strong><u>Benefits<br><br></u></strong>Eligible for medical, dental, vision, 401(k), bonus, paid time off, etc.<br><br>Invenergy LLC is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to, among other things, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, status as a protected veteran, or disability.

description: <strong>Chicago, Illinois(Hybrid Onsite)<br><br></strong><strong>Phone+Skype<br><br></strong><strong>6+Months<br><br></strong><strong><u>Jd<br><br></u></strong><strong>Job Description: Duties:<br></strong><ul><li>Assess the security posture of our systems, applications, and infrastructure and design and implement strategies for asset hardening.</li><li>Identify misconfigurations, and weaknesses in systems and apply appropriate security controls and countermeasures to mitigate risks.</li><li>Collaborate with system administrators, network engineers, and application developers to engineer and harden assets at all layers, including operating systems, cloud platforms, databases, and network devices.</li><li>Engineer and maintain security controls within the Microsoft 365 environment, including Azure Active Directory, Exchange Online, SharePoint, Intune and Teams.</li><li>Configure and enforce security policies, data loss prevention (DLP) measures, and threat protection mechanisms to safeguard our assets.</li><li>Stay informed about emerging security technologies and trends and provide recommendations for their adoption.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Software Requirements<br></u></strong><ul><li>Active Directory (Azure, On-prem)</li><li>AWS (Desirable)</li><li>M365</li><li>Windows Servers (2016 and newer)</li><li>Linux (Desirable)</li><li>Containers (Desirable)<br></li></ul><strong><u>Experience Required<br></u></strong><ul><li>5 years of experience as a Security Engineer or in a similar role, with a demonstrated background in asset hardening and Microsoft 365 security.</li><li>Scripting/automation experience such as Python and PowerShell<br></li></ul><strong><u>Education Requirements<br></u></strong><ul><li>4 year college degree in Information Technology or equivalent experience</li><li>Security certifications (CISSP, GSEC, MS-500, MS-700, CCSP, etc.) preferred<br></li></ul><strong><u>Knowledge, Skills, Ablilties, And Behaviors Required<br></u></strong><ul><li>Ability to work both independently and with a team while managing workload with minimal supervision.</li><li>Strong knowledge of servers, networking, cloud technologies, and related security considerations.</li><li>Familiarity with security principles, frameworks, and compliance standards (e.g., NIST, CIS)</li><li>Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to analyze complex technical issues.</li><li>Strong communication and collaboration skills to work effectively with cross-functional teams.</li><li>Ability to travel and collaborate in the downtown Chicago office two days a week.</li></ul>

title: Onsite_ PowerBI Developer (healthcare)
description: Hyatt Corporate Office, Chicago The Opportunity Hyatt seeks an enthusiastic Development professional to join our North America Select Service Development team. In this role, you will be collaborating closely with the broader Development team, where you'll be instrumental in continuing to make Hyatt a leading hospitality company. This position will be responsible for driving the growth of Hyatt's new upper-midscale extended-stay brand, Hyatt Studios, in a particular territory. You will be part of a team that is passionate about diversity, equity, and inclusion, committed to nurturing curiosity and new skills and building connections across the organization with stakeholders, colleagues, and guests. Who We Are At Hyatt, we believe in the power of belonging and creating a culture of care, where our colleagues become family. Since 1957, our colleagues and guests have been at the heart of our business and helped Hyatt become one of the world's best and fastest-growing hospitality brands. Our transformative growth and the addition of new hotels, brands, and business lines can open the door for exciting career and growth opportunities for our colleagues. As we continue to grow, we never lose sight of what's most important: People. We turn trips into journeys, encounters into experiences, and jobs into careers. Why Now? This is an exciting time to be at Hyatt. We are growing rapidly and are looking for passionate changemakers to be a part of our journey. The hospitality industry is resilient and continues to offer dynamic opportunities for upward mobility, and Hyatt is no exception. How We Care for Our People Our purpose sets us apart-to care for people so they can be their best. Every business decision is made through the lens of our purpose, and it informs how we have and will continue to support each other as members of the Hyatt family. Our care for our colleagues is the key to our success. We're proud to have earned a place on Fortune's prestigious 100 Best Companies to Work For® list for the last ten years. This recognition is a testament to the tremendous way our Hyatt family continues to come together to care for one another, our commitment to a culture of inclusivity, empathy, and respect, and making sure everyone feels like they belong. We're proud to offer exceptional corporate benefits which include:<br><ul><li>Annual allotment of free hotel stays at Hyatt hotels globally</li><li>Flexible work schedule and location</li><li>Work-life benefits including well-being initiatives such as a complimentary Headspace subscription, and a discount at the on-site fitness center</li><li>A global family assistance policy with paid time off following the birth or adoption of a child as well as financial assistance for adoption</li><li>Paid Time Off, Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K with company match Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion Our success is underpinned by our diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture and we are committed to diversity across the board-from whom we hire and develop, the organizations we support, and whom we buy from and work with. Being part of Hyatt means always having space to be you. Our global teams are a mosaic of cultures, ethnicities, genders, ages, abilities, and identities. We constantly strive to reflect the world we care for with teams that achieve and grow together. To learn more about our commitments to DE&amp;I, please visit the Why Hyatt section of the Hyatt career page. Who You Are As our ideal candidate, you understand the power and purpose of our Culture of Care and embody our core values of Empathy, Inclusion, Integrity, Experimentation, Respect, and Well-being. You enjoy working with others, are results-driven, and are looking for a variety of opportunities to develop personally and professionally. The Role The Developer role requires a wide and varied skill base, an understanding of local hotel markets, ability to develop relationships and convince developers that Hyatt products are well-suited for the location and market.</li><li>Develop relationships with possible franchises &amp; other partners to grow the Hyatt system with a focus on Hyatt Studios</li><li>Identify locations and markets in which to focus time and effort</li><li>Prepare and analyze market and performance data to demonstrate why the Hyatt Studios brand is the right fit for a market</li><li>Bring new Hyatt projects forward for approval through Hyatt's internal Select Development Committee</li><li>Negotiate terms and conditions of each franchise agreementQualificationsExperience Required:</li><li>5 + years of hotel franchise sales and development, hotel feasibility, hotel financial analysis or other sales-related experience. Established relationships with owners, operators, consultants, management companies, lenders, builders, etc.</li><li>Strong negotiation and influencing skills.</li><li>Excellent communication and presentation skills.</li><li>Excellent interpersonal skills and demeanor.</li><li>Ability to multi-task and handle multiple relationships and deals</li><li>Ability to travel approximately 75% of the time Experience Preferred:</li><li>Bachelor's degree, preferably in Hotel Management, Real Estate, or Finance The position responsibilities outlined above are in no way to be construed as all-encompassing. Other duties, responsibilities, and qualifications may be required and/or assigned as necessary. We welcome you: Research shows that women, people of color, and other historically excluded groups, tend to apply to jobs, only if they meet all the listed job qualifications. Unsure if you check every box, but feeling inspired to enhance your career? Apply. We'd love to consider your unique experiences and how you could make Hyatt even better.PDN-993f66a5-4613-45f3-b648-0184b0b1dd5e</li></ul>

Established relationships with owners, operators, consultants, management companies, lenders, builders, etc.</li><li>Strong negotiation and influencing skills.</li><li>Excellent communication and presentation skills.</li><li>Excellent interpersonal skills and demeanor.</li><li>Ability to multi-task and handle multiple relationships and deals</li><li>Ability to travel approximately 75% of the time Experience Preferred:</li><li>Bachelor's degree, preferably in Hotel Management, Real Estate, or Finance The position responsibilities outlined above are in no way to be construed as all-encompassing. Other duties, responsibilities, and qualifications may be required and/or assigned as necessary. We welcome you: Research shows that women, people of color, and other historically excluded groups, tend to apply to jobs, only if they meet all the listed job qualifications. Unsure if you check every box, but feeling inspired to enhance your career? Apply. We'd love to consider your unique experiences and how you could make Hyatt even better.PDN-993f66a5-4613-45f3-b648-0184b0b1dd5e</li></ul>

title: Engineer I Interconnection and Grid Analysis
description: <strong>Discover. A brighter future.</strong><p><br></p>With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day &amp; We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p><strong>Employer: </strong>DFS Corporate Services LLC<p><br></p><strong>Job Title</strong>: Infrastructure Engineer (multiple openings)<p><br></p><strong>Job Location:</strong> Riverwoods, Illinois<p><br></p><strong>Job Type:</strong> Full Time<p><br></p><strong>Duties: </strong>Work on holistic engineering deliverables across different stages of the product lifecycle and determine technology patterns for the overall solution. Achieve product commitments (and influence others to do the same) by using informal leadership and highly developed communication skills and contribute to or lead technology communities. Telecommuting and/or working from home may be permissible pursuant to company policies.<p><br></p><strong>Requirements: </strong>Employer will accept a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or a related field and 3 years of experience in Database Administrator or related occupation.<p><br></p><strong>Position required skills: </strong>Three (3) years of experience in the job offered or related occupation: working with database performance tuning to improve query performance; performing database upgrades, migration, and patching; utilizing scripting and automation; Working with database high availability and DR replication; working with database security; working with application developers to troubleshoot database issues; and utilizing Oracle Exadata Platform.<p><br></p>Position eligible for incentives under Employee Referral Program<p><br></p><strong>Rate of Pay: </strong><em>The base pay for this position generally ranges between $94,016.00 to $142,500.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position. We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. Learn more at MyDiscoverBenefits.com.</em><p><br></p><em>QUALIFIED APPLICANTS: Please apply directly through our website by clicking on “Apply Now.” No calls. Equal Opportunity Employer/disability/vet</em>.<p><br></p><strong>Compensation:</strong><p><br></p>The base pay for this position generally ranges between to . Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.<p><br></p><strong><strong><strong>Benefits:</strong></strong></strong><p><br></p>We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. These benefits include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Paid Time Off</li><li>401(k) Plan</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, &amp; Health Savings Account</li><li>STD, Life, LTD and AD&amp;D</li><li>Recognition Program</li><li>Education Assistance</li><li>Commuter Benefits</li><li>Family Support Programs</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li></ul><p><br></p>Learn more at MyDiscoverBenefits.com.<p><br></p>What are you waiting for? Apply today!<p><br></p>All Discover employees place our customers at the very center of our work. To deliver on our promises to our customers, each of us contribute every day to a culture that values compliance and risk management.<p><br></p>Discover is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Discover is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or other legally protected status. (Know Your Rights)

title: Security Engineer
description: <strong><u>Description<br><br></u></strong>There’s never been a more exciting time to join United Airlines. We’re on a path towards becoming the best airline in the history of aviation. Our shared purpose – Connecting People, Uniting the World – is about more than getting people from one place to another. It also means that as a global company that operates in hundreds of locations around the world with millions of customers and tens of thousands of employees, we have a unique responsibility to uplift and provide opportunities in the places where we work, live and fly and we can only do that with a truly diverse and inclusive workforce. And we’re growing – in the years ahead, we’ll hire tens of thousands of people across every area of the airline. Our careers include a competitive benefits package aimed at keeping you happy, healthy and well-traveled. From employee-run "Business Resource Group" communities to world-class benefits like parental leave, 401k and privileges like space available travel, United is truly a one-of-a-kind place to work. Are you ready to travel the world?<br><br><strong><u>Key Responsibilities<br><br></u></strong>The Analyst of Digital Fleet Management is responsible for developing and implementing innovate predictive alerting and health monitoring solutions for United’s fleet of assets (aircraft, engines and other capital assets). The Analyst will dive into technical details of system design and recommend novel uses of asset data to improve reliability by predicting when a system will fail and ensuring maintenance teams can fix issues before they cause operational disruptions. The Analyst will be a key member of a working team of engineering subject matter experts, maintenance personnel and data scientists to develop use cases following United’s Predictive Alerting Committee process to ensure solutions are fully vetted before going operational. The Analyst will ensure applicable solutions fit into United’s Integrated Asset Health Monitoring program for their fleet area of focus (aircraft, engines or other assets), ensuring any regulatory requirements are addressed as necessary. The Analyst will regularly monitor the performance of existing predictive alerts and recommend retraining or redesign as required.<br><ul><li>Support the development of predictive alerts and health monitoring solutions on a fleet area of focus (aircraft, engines or other assets) by creating recommended alerting approaches to address predictable system failures</li><li>Support engineering, maintenance and data science experts by applying United’s Predictive Alerting Committee processes and alert evaluation methods</li><li>Support the day-to-day implementation of the Integrated Asset Health Monitoring process for a fleet area of focus (aircraft, engines or other assets), track reliability of monitored systems and ensure predictive alerts are performing as planned or recommend retraining or redesign as required</li><li>Partner with engineering and data science teams to create, test and operationalize predictive maintenance and health monitoring alerts, including developing user acceptance testing and reporting of alert performance</li><li>Support operational teams responsible for ongoing monitoring of predictive alerts and ensuring maintenance action is taken in advance of operational issues</li><li>Act as a liaison to frontline teams as required to ensure successful execution of proactive maintenance<br></li></ul>United values diverse experiences, perspectives, and we encourage everyone who meets the minimum qualifications to apply. While having the “desired” qualifications make for a stronger candidate, we encourage applicants who may not feel they check ALL of those boxes! We are always looking for individuals who will bring something new to the table!<br><br><strong><u>Qualifications<br><br></u></strong>What’s needed to succeed (Minimum Qualifications):<br><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Business Administration or a related field</li><li>Knowledge of common system analysis or fault tree analysis strategies</li><li>Self-starter with the ability to think outside the box to evaluate complex problems and recommend solutions</li><li>Ability to tell a story with data, develop strong data visualizations and present complex concepts and recommendations backed by data</li><li>Ability to write, debug and troubleshoot software code</li><li>Proven project management and organization skills</li><li>Strong interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills, with ability to effectively interact with internal and external business partners</li><li>Must be legally authorized to work in the United States for any employer without sponsorship</li><li>Successful completion of interview required to meet job qualification</li><li>Reliable, punctual attendance is an essential function of the position<br></li></ul>What will help you propel from the pack (Preferred Qualifications):<br><ul><li>3 years experience in a business, engineering or data driven role</li><li>Airline experience or operations experience in a similar industry</li><li>Experience working with aircraft, engine, ground equipment or other asset sensor and fault data</li><li>Familiarity with modern data analytics concepts that include machine learning, statistical programming, data visualization, etc.</li><li>Familiarization with preventive maintenance and reliability concepts and implementation</li><li>Knowledge of mechanical and/or electrical system design in aviation, automotive or similar industries</li><li>Knowledge of aviation CFR regulations</li><li>Proven skills with Python, R or other programming language</li><li>Ability to define and track Key Performance Indicators to track system or process performance</li><li>Knowledge of reliability engineering principles, root cause analysis or statistics-based reliability<br></li></ul>United Airlines is an equal opportunity employer. United Airlines recruits, employs, trains, compensates and promotes regardless of race, religion, color, national origin, gender identity, sexual orientation, physical ability, age, veteran status and other protected status as required by applicable law. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform crucial job functions. Please contact JobAccommodations@united.com to request accommodation.<br><br>Equal Opportunity Employer - Minorities/Women/Veterans/Disabled/LGBT <strong>WHQ00021742</strong>

title: W2 Security Engineer
description: <p>We are seeking talented individuals that are motivated to kickstart their technology career. No prior professional experience required. </p><p> </p><p>Revature is the largest and fastest growing employer of emerging technology talent across the U.S. Come join us! As a <strong>Revature Entry Level Software Developer </strong>you will receive on-the-job-training to become an experienced software engineer. </p><p><strong>Remote interviews are starting now!</strong> </p><p> </p><p><strong>Benefits for Entry Level Software Developer</strong> </p><ul><li>Launch a software engineering career with no prior experience </li><li>Learn to code on the job. that's right: we pay you to learn. </li><li>Competitive salary </li><li>Relocation assistance </li><li>Paid time off </li><li>Industry Certifications - Employer paid. </li><li>401k </li><li>Mentoring program </li><li>Career acceleration: over 72% of Revature alumni have received an additional promotion and 92% saw their salary significantly increase after launching their tech career with Revature </li></ul><p> </p><p><strong>Entry Level Software Developer Training Programme</strong> </p><ul><li>Full-time, paid training </li><li>Work on real world projects in a team environment to get you enterprise-ready for placement with one of our corporate partners. </li><li>Training on the most in-demand programming skills in the job market. we work together with our corporate partners, to identify the skills that are most vital to their organization </li><li>We're invested in your success-you'll have an employee engagement team member to support and provide you with a wide range of assistance </li><li>As a Revature employee, you'll also have access to our expansive network of likeminded peers who will show you the ropes to ensure you'll rock your tech career </li></ul><p><strong>What We Are Looking For</strong> </p><ul><li>College degree (Associates or Bachelors) </li><li>Must be legally authorized to work in the US </li><li>Strong desire to learn to code - No prior professional experience required. </li><li>A natural problem solver </li><li>Team player </li><li>Challenge seekers looking to develop tech skills </li><li>Adaptable </li><li>Strong communication and interpersonal skills </li><li>Willing to relocate anywhere in the US - Relocation assistance provided </li></ul><p>Working for Revature is more than a job, we develop you into an experienced software engineer and put you on an accelerated career path. <strong>Fast track your tech career and work for a company that invests in you-whose own success is dependent on your success</strong>. </p><p> </p><p><strong>Equal Employment Opportunity</strong> </p><p> </p><p>The Company is an equal opportunity employer. We will extend equal opportunity to all individuals without regard to race, religion, color, sex, pregnancy, childbirth or related medical conditions, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, age, genetic information, marital status, veteran status, or any other status protected under applicable federal, state, or local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including but not limited to, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, benefits, compensation and training. If you require an accommodation to work based on any of these protected factors, please notify the Human Resources Department, and the Company will evaluate the request and provide accommodation in accordance with applicable law. </p><p> </p><p>We seek to comply with all applicable federal, state and local laws related to discrimination and will not tolerate the interference with the ability of any of the Company's employees to perform their job duties. Our policy reflects and affirms the Company's commitment to the principles of fair employment and the elimination of all discriminatory practices.</p>

title: Developer, West
description: <strong>Want to be a part of our team?<br><br></strong>Provides technical support to field engineers, technicians, and product support personnel who are diagnosing, troubleshooting, repairing, and debugging complex electro/mechanical equipment, computer systems, complex software, or networked and/or wireless systems.<br><br>Responds to situations where first-line product support has failed to isolate or fix problems in malfunctioning equipment or software. Reports design, reliability, and maintenance problems or bugs to design engineering/software engineering. May be involved in customer installation and training.<br><br>Provides support to customers/users where the product is highly technical or sophisticated in nature.<br><br><strong>Working at NTT<br><br></strong>The MS Engineer is responsible for providing a service to clients by proactively identifying and resolving technical incidents and problems. Through preemptive service incident and resolution activities, as well as product reviews, operational improvements, operational practices, and quality assurance this role will maintain a high level of service to clients. Their primary objective is to ensure zero missed service level agreement (SLA) conditions .The MS Engineer s responsible for managing tickets of low to high complexity.<br><br><strong>Key Roles and Responsibilities:<br></strong><ul><li>Ensure that assigned infrastructure at the client site is configured, installed, tested, and operational</li><li>Perform necessary checks, apply monitoring tools and respond to alerts</li><li>Identify problems and errors prior to or when it occurs and log all such incidents in a timely manner with the required level of detail</li><li>Assist in analyzing, assigning, and escalating support calls</li><li>Investigate third line support calls assigned and identify the root cause of incidents and problems</li><li>Report and escalate issues to 3rd party vendors if necessary</li><li>Provide onsite technical support to clients and provide field engineering services to clients</li><li>Conduct a monthly random review of incidents and service requests, analyze and recommend improvement in quality</li><li>Provide continuous feedback to clients and affected parties and update all systems and/or portals as prescribed by NTT</li><li>Proactively identify opportunities for work optimization including opportunities for automation of work<br><br></li></ul><strong>Knowledge, Skills, and Attributes:<br></strong><ul><li>Ability to communicate and work across different cultures and social groups</li><li>Ability to plan activities and projects well in advance, and takes into account possible changing circumstances</li><li>Ability to maintain a positive outlook at work</li><li>Ability to work well in a pressurized environment</li><li>Ability to work hard and put in longer hours when it is necessary</li><li>Ability to apply active listening techniques such as paraphrasing the message to confirm understanding, probing for further relevant information, and refraining from interrupting</li><li>Ability to adapt to changing circumstances</li><li>Ability to place clients at the forefront of all interactions, understanding their requirements, and creating a positive client experience throughout the total client journey<br><br></li></ul><strong>Academic Qualifications<br></strong><ul><li>Advanced diploma, degree, or relevant qualification in IT/Computing (or demonstrated equivalent work experience)<br><br></li></ul><strong>Required Experience:<br></strong><ul><li>Demonstrated work experience</li><li>Demonstrated experience required in Engineering function within a medium to large ICT organization</li><li>Demonstrated experience of Managed Services</li><li>Demonstrated working knowledge of ITIL processes</li><li>Demonstrated experience working with vendors and/or 3rd parties<br><br></li></ul><strong>What will make you a good fit for the role?</strong>
description_json: <strong>Want to be a part of our team?<br><br></strong>Provides technical support to field engineers, technicians, and product support personnel who are diagnosing, troubleshooting, repairing, and debugging complex electro/mechanical equipment, computer systems, complex software, or networked and/or wireless systems.<br><br>Responds to situations where first-line product support has failed to isolate or fix problems in malfunctioning equipment or software. Reports design, reliability, and maintenance problems or bugs to design engineering/software engineering. May be involved in customer installation and training.<br><br>Provides support to customers/users where the product is highly technical or sophisticated in nature.<br><br><strong>Working at NTT<br><br></strong>The MS Engineer is responsible for providing a service to clients by proactively identifying and resolving technical incidents and problems. Through preemptive service incident and resolution activities, as well as product reviews, operational improvements, operational practices, and quality assurance this role will maintain a high level of service to clients. Their primary objective is to ensure zero missed service level agreement (SLA) conditions .The MS Engineer s responsible for managing tickets of low to high complexity.<br><br><strong>Key Roles and Responsibilities:<br></strong><ul><li>Ensure that assigned infrastructure at the client site is configured, installed, tested, and operational</li><li>Perform necessary checks, apply monitoring tools and respond to alerts</li><li>Identify problems and errors prior to or when it occurs and log all such incidents in a timely manner with the required level of detail</li><li>Assist in analyzing, assigning, and escalating support calls</li><li>Investigate third line support calls assigned and identify the root cause of incidents and problems</li><li>Report and escalate issues to 3rd party vendors if necessary</li><li>Provide onsite technical support to clients and provide field engineering services to clients</li><li>Conduct a monthly random review of incidents and service requests, analyze and recommend improvement in quality</li><li>Provide continuous feedback to clients and affected parties and update all systems and/or portals as prescribed by NTT</li><li>Proactively identify opportunities for work optimization including opportunities for automation of work<br><br></li></ul><strong>Knowledge, Skills, and Attributes:<br></strong><ul><li>Ability to communicate and work across different cultures and social groups</li><li>Ability to plan activities and projects well in advance, and takes into account possible changing circumstances</li><li>Ability to maintain a positive outlook at work</li><li>Ability to work well in a pressurized environment</li><li>Ability to work hard and put in longer hours when it is necessary</li><li>Ability to apply active listening techniques such as paraphrasing the message to confirm understanding, probing for further relevant information, and refraining from interrupting</li><li>Ability to adapt to changing circumstances</li><li>Ability to place clients at the forefront of all interactions, understanding their requirements, and creating a positive client experience throughout the total client journey<br><br></li></ul><strong>Academic Qualifications<br></strong><ul><li>Advanced diploma, degree, or relevant qualification in IT/Computing (or demonstrated equivalent work experience)<br><br></li></ul><strong>Required Experience:<br></strong><ul><li>Demonstrated work experience</li><li>Demonstrated experience required in Engineering function within a medium to large ICT organization</li><li>Demonstrated experience of Managed Services</li><li>Demonstrated working knowledge of ITIL processes</li><li>Demonstrated experience working with vendors and/or 3rd parties<br><br></li></ul><strong>What will make you a good fit for the role?</strong>

title: Developer, South Central
description: <strong>Discover. A brighter future.</strong><p><br></p>With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day &amp; We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p>At Discover, be part of a culture where diversity, teamwork, and collaboration reign. Join a company that is just as employee focused as it is on its customers and is consistently awarded for both. <strong>We’re all about people, and our employees are why Discover <em>is </em>a great place to work. </strong>Be the reason we help millions of consumers build a brighter financial future and achieve yours along the way with a rewarding career.<p><br></p>The Infrastructure Engineer (Monitoring Engineer) works on holistic engineering deliverables across different stages of the product lifecycle and determines technology patterns for the overall solution. This role takes the lead in guiding more junior engineers and is a role model in fostering the adoption of new technologies. Actively manages and escalates risk and customer-impacting issues within the day-to-day role to management.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Achieves product commitments (and influences others to do the same) by using informal leadership &amp; highly developed communication skills and contributes to or led technology communities </li><li>Uses automation, system tools, open-source solutions, observability and 'security first' principles in daily work </li><li>Contributes to team agile ceremonies, leads demos and presentations, helps new engineers learn established norms </li><li>Initiates high level solution design approaches, and guides team to achieve desired key software delivery capabilities using automated, coded enterprise and observability </li><li>Participates in internal speaking and advocacy events </li><li>Supports research activities to adopt new technology solutions in ways of developing new capabilities </li><li>Continues professional education and creates opportunities for core product teams to learn engineering best practices </li><li>Coaches immediate chapter and actively fosters the adoption of new technologies </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Minimum Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>At a minimum, here’s what we need from you:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelors – Computer Science or related </li><li>3+ Years – (Software) Engineering, DevOps or related </li><li>Internal applicants only: technical proficiency rating of competent on the Dreyfus engineering scale </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>Bonus Points If You Have:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Previous administration experience in monitoring/event management tools such as: Datadog, Moogsoft, Netscout</li><li>Previous administration experience in workload management tools such as Autosys</li><li>1+ Years – Linux and SQL</li></ul><p><br></p>External applicants will be required to perform a technical interview.<p><br></p>#Remote<p><br></p>#JJ-Remote<p><br></p><strong>Compensation:</strong><p><br></p>The base pay for this position generally ranges between $84,500.00 to $142,500.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.<p><br></p><strong><strong><strong>Benefits:</strong></strong></strong><p><br></p>We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. These benefits include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Paid Time Off</li><li>401(k) Plan</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, &amp; Health Savings Account</li><li>STD, Life, LTD and AD&amp;D</li><li>Recognition Program</li><li>Education Assistance</li><li>Commuter Benefits</li><li>Family Support Programs</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li></ul><p><br></p>Learn more at MyDiscoverBenefits.com.<p><br></p>What are you waiting for? Apply today!<p><br></p>All Discover employees place our customers at the very center of our work. To deliver on our promises to our customers, each of us contribute every day to a culture that values compliance and risk management.<p><br></p>Discover is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Discover is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or other legally protected status. (Know Your Rights)<p><br></p>

title: Infrastructure Engineer (multiple openings) - IHM
description: Management Consulting has been the foundation of Point B’s employee-owned company for 25+ years. Our collaborative, forward looking leadership approach ensures our customers are on the right path to success.<p><br></p>Point B is a consulting company dedicated to helping organizations with critical initiatives in the areas of customer engagement, growth investments, workforce experience and operations excellence. Our diverse set of experts spans 13 U.S. locations, with international reach via our partnership with Nextcontinent. We’ve helped global organizations of all stages and sizes achieve sustainable success by focusing on the humans at the center of change.<p><br></p>Point B has been consistently recognized as one of the best places to work by Fortune® magazine, The Wall Street Journal, Consulting® magazine, Vault.com® and many others.<p><br></p>Firmwide Operations at Point B delivers internal and external results through leadership, process, people, and technology while supporting employees in delivering their best for our customers.<p><br></p>Our operations team includes roles focused on People &amp; Culture, Executive Talent, Risk &amp; Legal, Finance, Travel &amp; Events, Communications &amp; Change Management, IT &amp; Facilities, and Marketing. Working across these disciplines we create the foundation from which Point Bers discover and grow their careers.<p><br></p>The Account Coordinator assists Account Operations Managers and Account Leadership teams with many of the administrative aspects of running our client accounts. This includes managing data within CRM/vendor systems, analyzing, and manipulating data, creating dashboards, preparing account financials, managing invoice cycles, and other activities as directed by the Account Leadership teams or in support of the Account Services processes. The Account Coordinator will support one or more industries and build strong relationships with the leaders within those accounts and client and internal finance counterparts. This role will support the rhythm of the business and<p><br></p>will need to identify risks, opportunities for improvement, and create visibility into account mechanics. The accounts supported may have complex revenue collection processes, interact with 3rd party systems, and have a large sales goal with a large team structure.<p><br></p><strong><u>What You’ll Get To Do</u></strong><p><br></p>Partners with Account Leadership teams to drive client account support functions<p><br></p>Analyzes account sales and financial data, including project level estimates to completion<p><br></p>Manages active project data by ensuring milestones are correct and assignments are up to date<p><br></p>Creates and maintains financial and sales pipeline dashboards and presentations to support account<p><br></p>pursuit planning and financial performance visibility<p><br></p>Deeply understands customer’s business processes (invoicing, SOW, onboarding, etc.) and proactively<p><br></p>guides account approach to engage in those to benefit Point B and the Customer<p><br></p>Monitors time and expense compliance<p><br></p>Works with associates and/or ASA to resolve miscoded T&amp;E and flags anomalies for Account<p><br></p>Leader<p><br></p>Tracks hours that need to be logged with Business Partner company and system and checks for<p><br></p>accuracy<p><br></p>Produces client invoices in partnership with ASA. Reviews and reconciles outstanding invoices and works<p><br></p>with account/client to follow up on past due payments<p><br></p>Assists associates in account onboarding / offboarding at the beginning and end of engagements<p><br></p>Assists in problem resolution with internal partners and client contacts<p><br></p>Supports account meetings by scheduling, preparing materials, confirming speaking roles, and sending<p><br></p>out related comms before and after the meeting<p><br></p>Gains leverage from the firm’s best practices, processes, and knowledge and contributes feedback to<p><br></p>refine/improve account services processes<p><br></p>Be a connector and serve as a link across account teams and the firm with knowledge on engagements<p><br></p>and/or administrative best practices<p><br></p>Supports team efforts and builds authentic relationships with individuals in work groups and teams<p><br></p>Consistently demonstrates and lives Point B cultural tenets and values<p><br></p>Participates in firm culture activities to connect regularly with other Point Bers (e.g., FW Ops Meetings,<p><br></p>Geo Meetings)<p><br></p>Supports activity tracking and business development pursuits with a growth mindset<p><br></p>Maintains data hygiene in Salesforce<p><br></p>Leads customer project schedule management of associates in a 90-120 day view<p><br></p>Ensures sales contribution ratings and project closure activities are completed before its deadline<p><br></p>Maintains and organizes essential data elements that are critical for our predictable performance efforts<p><br></p>Creating and maintaining Teams collaboration sites<p><br></p>Develops Account Operations Analyst that support accounts within their industry scope<p><br></p>Provide accounts with “Supporting” or “Leading” level of business management support<p><br></p><strong><u>What We Offer</u></strong><p><br></p>The opportunity to affect the learning approach for our firm's future<p><br></p>The chance to impact the journey of our employees’ growth and development<p><br></p>An environment that encourages you to identify new opportunities and the support to make it happen<p><br></p>The opportunity to build and be part of a fun and collaborative culture with teams that are as passionate about their communities as they are about their work<p><br></p><strong><u>What We Expect You’ve Already Done</u></strong><p><br></p>B.A. or B.S. degree<p><br></p>3+ years of experience<p><br></p>Experience in a professional business environment<p><br></p>Experience with information analysis preferably with financial or sales data<p><br></p>Experienced MS Excel user with comfort using formulas, pivot tables and lookups<p><br></p>Proficient in all Microsoft Office applications<p><br></p>Experience in, familiarity with, or willingness to dive deep into Salesforce and Microsoft Teams<p><br></p>capabilities<p><br></p>Interest in developing others<p><br></p><strong><u>Compensation And Benefits</u></strong><p><br></p>The estimated salary range for this role is $56,000 - $92,500 USD per year. This salary range is provided as required by local and state law as applicable. Individual salaries vary on a number of factors including but not limited to geography, skills, education, experience and unique qualifications where applicable.<p><br></p>Bonuses are awarded at Point B’s discretion and are based upon individual contributions and overall firm performance.<p><br></p><strong><u>The Kind Of People We Look For</u></strong><p><br></p>Innate problem solvers who want to grow in a flexible, collaborative culture<p><br></p>Engaging leaders who make a positive impact on their firm, clients, and communities<p><br></p>Versatile people who thrive on variety and challenge<p><br></p>Successful in ambiguous environments<p><br></p>Desire to and ability to learn<p><br></p>Passion for Point B’s Mission, Vision, Values &amp; Culture<p><br></p>Gets it done brand and attitude<p><br></p>Ability to work from home<p><br></p>Ability to work non-standard work hours as necessary<p><br></p>Ability to travel occasionally for team meetings<p><br></p><strong><u>Your Office Home Base</u></strong><p><br></p>Any Point B Office Location<p><br></p>#EL<p><br></p><strong>INTRIGUED TO LEARN MORE?</strong><p><br></p>When you apply for this role, your information will be personally reviewed by our talent acquisition team (not by a robot). You can expect to hear back from us with feedback if we think there could be a fit and what next steps look like.<p><br></p><strong>WHAT MAKES POING B DIFFERENT?</strong><p><br></p>Our Founding Purpose and Values of our firm. Be part of a fun and collaborative culture with teams that are as passionate about their communities as they are about their clients<p><br></p>Employee Ownership – Giving you a voice in directing your career and building our firm<p><br></p>Benefits – Our comprehensive package includes competitive base pay and an annual bonus, complete health benefits including an option for 100% employer paid premium for medical, vision and dental coverage for employees, ownership shares through our ESOP, self-directed time off and more<p><br></p>Work-Life Balance – A unique culture that recognizes the importance of flexibility and collaboration. Our local and national model empowers you to choose the life you want <p><br></p>Award winning – We are proud to be named a Best Workplace in the US by Fortune magazine, Best Workplaces for Millennials, and Best Workplaces for Women. Hear more about why people love working at Point B on GlassDoor<p><br></p>We are an <strong>equal opportunity employer committed to a diverse workforce</strong>. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status or disability. You can read more about our commitment to diversity on our Careers Website.<p><br></p>Point B is committed to providing equal opportunities for persons with disabilities or religious observances, which includes providing reasonable accommodation for in any individuals with disabilities or for religious purposes. Applicants with disabilities may contact our Accommodations team at applicantaccommodations@pointb.com or 206-517-5000 to request and arrange for accommodations through the application and/or recruiting process. If you need assistance to accommodate a disability or religious observance, you may request an accommodation at any time. Please note: This mailbox is only for accommodation requests or questions. Please use the Contact Us form for any recruiting inquires.<p><br></p>Legal Information for Job Seekers can be accessed on our Careers Website.<p><br></p>
