title: Analyst - Digital Fleet Management - Aircraft
description: CoinFlip is a leading fintech company powered by cryptocurrency. Believing everyone deserves to participate in the new digital economy, the company operates one of the world’s largest networks of cryptocurrency ATMs — with over 4,000 active kiosks — as well as an over-the-counter trading desk. In 2022, CoinFlip became an international company by expanding into Canada , and launched CoinFlip Ventures , a new initiative designed to support start-up companies.<p><br></p>CoinFlip placed No. 60 on the 2021 Inc. 5000 list of the nation’s fastest-growing private companies. CoinFlip was also named the 2021 and 2022 #1 fastest-growing company in Chicago by Crain’s Business.<p><br></p>As our growth trajectory continues, we’re looking to quickly expand all of our teams. It’s an exciting time to join CoinFlip as we’re pursuing additional business lines and continued international expansion to further cement us as a leading financial technology company.<p><br></p>We're currently seeking a talented and experienced Salesforce Admin &amp; Developer with a robust background in SalesCloud and ServiceCloud deployments in a global theatre. As a member of the IT team, you will have a mix of technical but also business understanding, providing high quality solutions to our business stakeholders. The ideal individual must have demonstrated capabilities with third-party integrations (e.g., Docusign, JIRA, Netsuite) and effective communication and collaboration skills to join our dynamic team. In this role, you will be the subject matter expert working closely with all functions and business teams to optimize, customize, and develop our Salesforce platform to meet the evolving needs of our business, including global expansion.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Design, implement, and maintain Salesforce ServiceCloud configurations, customizations, and integrations, ensuring optimal system performance and data quality.</li><li>Collaborate with sales, operations, and IT partners to gather and analyze requirements, translating them into actionable solutions that enhance the Salesforce platform and support business objectives.</li><li>Develop, test, and deploy third-party integrations, including Docusign, to streamline processes, improve efficiency, and automate workflows.</li><li>Utilize JIRA for effective project management, issue tracking, and communication with internal stakeholders and external vendors.</li><li>Provide Salesforce administration support, including user management, security, roles, profiles, permission sets, and data management.</li><li>Develop custom objects, fields, validation rules, workflows, process builder, and Apex code to accommodate unique business requirements.</li><li>Monitor system performance and resolve issues proactively, ensuring minimal disruption to end-users.</li><li>Create and maintain comprehensive documentation related to Salesforce configurations, customizations, and integrations.</li><li>Offer ongoing training and support to end-users, ensuring a smooth and efficient user experience.</li><li>Stay current on Salesforce platform updates, features, and best practices, applying this knowledge to drive continuous improvement.</li><li>Ensures data backup and data retention requirements are met.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field.</li><li>Salesforce Certified Administrator and Salesforce Certified Platform Developer credentials required.</li><li>3+ years of experience in Salesforce administration and development, with a strong focus on ServiceCloud.</li><li>Strong emphasis on data security and familiarity with multi-region requirements (e.g., GDPR)</li><li>Demonstrated experience with third-party integrations, including DocuSign.</li><li>Proficiency in JIRA for project management and issue tracking.</li><li>Solid understanding of Apex, Visualforce, Lightning Web Components, and Salesforce APIs.</li><li>Experience with agile methodologies and version control systems (e.g., Git).</li><li>Strong analytical, problem-solving, and organizational skills.</li><li>Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Nice To Have</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>General passion and knowledge of fintech and crypto</li><li>Experience with working in a start up</li><li>Experience with Oracle NetSuite</li></ul><p><br></p>Working at CoinFlip means collaborating with experienced and innovative leaders who share a clear vision and a track record of success. We offer a collaborative and positive working environment where we encourage employees to balance productivity with time to recharge. Compensation is above and beyond a typical “startup” — we offer competitive salaries, performance-based incentives, and competitive benefits for full-time employees.<p><br></p>CoinFlip values diversity in the workplace and is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing an inclusive and accessible work environment. We thank all candidates who apply, but only those selected for an interview will be contacted.<p><br></p>By applying to this role, you give express consent to CoinFlip to send you informational text (SMS) messages regarding this role and the application process. You can cancel the SMS service at any time by replying "STOP" to the text message you received. If at any time you forget what keywords are supported, just reply "HELP." Message and data rates apply. If you require a special accommodation, please let us know and we’ll work with you to meet your needs.
industry: IT Services and IT Consulting, Technology, Information and Internet, and Financial Services

title: Entry Level Software Developer
description: <strong>Fermilab</strong><p><br></p><strong>Position:</strong> Linux Systems Engineer<p><br></p><strong>Duration: </strong> 6-12 month contract<p><br></p><strong>Location:</strong> onsite in Wheaton, IL 60187<p><br></p>I am looking for a Linux Systems Engineer to work as a systems administrator and utilize DevOps expertise to develop, test, supervise, and maintain computing services that run across a distributed, global computing infrastructure. In this role, you will be responsible for building, testing, supervising, and maintaining services across the enterprise.<p><br></p>Your responsibilities will include monitoring global batch jobs on computing clusters, supporting the infrastructure and staff, and providing data center support to include UPSs (Uninterruptible Power Supplies), UPS batteries, PDU's (Power Distribution Units), CRAC (Computer Room AC) units, ATS (Automatic Transfer Switches), Standby Generators, electrical switchboards, commercial electrical breakers, and electrical power distribution.<p><br></p>Additionally, you will work with Computing Systems that integrate with the Legacy infrastructure.<p><br></p><strong>The ideal candidate will </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>possess a solid understanding of computing system concepts such as scheduling, I/O, networking, and file systems.</li><li>have experience working with UNIX-based operating systems and have strong command line interface skills. </li><li>hold expertise in scripting languages like Bash and Python, version control systems, and configuration management tools such as Puppet or Ansible. </li><li>be able to resolve system and service operational problems and communicate effectively to both technical and non-technical audiences.</li><li>Have experience defining SLA and KPIs, analyzing, diagnosing, and monitoring system and service performance, gathering user requirements, and providing feedback on system and service projects. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in computer science, information technology, engineering, or a related field from an accredited institution or equivalent work experience in IT or computer science. </li><li>UNIX shell scripting and Python</li><li>Strong oral and written communication skills are essential for this role, as well as the ability to collaborate with teams across different time zones, produce quality work, and meet deadlines. </li><li>Prior experience with batch systems like HTCondor and Slurm, familiarity with container technologies such as Docker, Podman, etc. </li><li>An understanding of container orchestration tools like Kubernetes, OpenShift, Docker Swarm, etc. </li><li>Experience with distributed computing systems and grid computing technologies such as distributed file systems (CVMFS), compute entry points (HTCondor CE), and service monitoring tools and technologies such as Grafana, Prometheus, etc., is also preferable.</li></ul><p><br></p><em><strong>Did you know about Sterling?</strong></em><em> As a Sterling W2 employee on contract, you are becoming an owner in Sterling. We are an Employee-Owned ESOP (Employee Stock Option Program) Company, that in itself is an additional retirement benefit on top of our other exceptional Sterling benefits, including paid holidays, PTO, and the ability to join the 401K with a company match. Sterling Engineering / Staffing could be your future home.</em><p><br></p><strong>Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or genetic information.</strong><p><br></p><strong>#SP</strong>

title: MS Engineer
description: At U.S. Bank, we’re on a journey to do our best. Helping the customers and businesses we serve to make better and smarter financial decisions and enabling the communities we support to grow and succeed. We believe it takes all of us to bring our shared ambition to life, and each person is unique in their potential. A career with U.S. Bank gives you a wide, ever-growing range of opportunities to discover what makes you thrive at every stage of your career. Try new things, learn new skills and discover what you excel at—all from Day One.<br><br><strong>Job Description<br><br></strong>This position will be responsible for the analysis, design, testing, development and maintenance of best in class software experiences. The candidate is a self-motivated individual who can collaborate with a team and across the organization. The candidate takes responsibility of the software artifacts produced adhering to U.S. Bank standards in order to ensure minimal impact to the customer experience. The candidate will be adept with the agile software development lifecycle and DevOps principles.<br><br><strong>Essential Responsibilities:<br><br></strong><ul><li> Responsible for designing, developing, testing, operating and maintaining products</li><li> Takes full stack ownership by consistently writing production-ready and testable code</li><li> Consistently creates optimal design adhering to architectural best practices; considers scalability, reliability and performance of systems/contexts affected when defining technical designs</li><li> Performs analysis on failures, propose design changes, and encourage operational improvements</li><li> Makes sound design/coding decisions keeping customer experience in the forefront</li><li> Takes feedback from code review and apply changes to meet standards</li><li> Conducts code reviews to provide guidance on engineering best practices and compliance with development procedures</li><li> Accountable for ensuring all aspects of product development follow compliance and security best practices</li><li> Exhibits relentless focus in software reliability engineering standards embedded into development standards</li><li> Embraces emerging technology opportunities and contributes to the best practices in support of the bank’s technology transformation</li><li> Contributes to a culture of innovation, collaboration and continuous improvement</li><li> Reviews tasks critically and ensures they are appropriately prioritized and sized for incremental delivery; anticipates and communicates blockers and delays before they require escalation<br><br></li></ul><strong>Basic Qualifications<br><br></strong><ul><li> Bachelor’s degree, or equivalent work experience</li><li> Two to three years of relevant experience<br><br></li></ul><strong>Preferred Skills/Experience<br><br></strong><ul><li>Adept with agile software development lifecycle and DevOps principles</li><li>2 years of hands on Salesforce Development experience (Apex, Visualforce, LWC/Aura)</li><li>Experience with SFDX is a huge plus</li><li>Good understanding of algorithms and data structures</li><li>Ability to communicate processes and results with all parties involved in the product team, including engineers, product owner, scrum master, third party vendors and customers</li><li>Effective problem-solving and analytical skills<br><br></li></ul>If there’s anything we can do to accommodate a disability during any portion of the application or hiring process, please refer to our disability accommodations for applicants.<br><br><strong>Learn how</strong> the way we work at U.S. Bank drives meaningful relationships with our customers and collaboration across the company.<br><br><strong>Benefits:<br><br></strong>Our approach to benefits and total rewards considers our team members’ whole selves and what may be needed to thrive in and outside work. That's why our benefits are designed to help you and your family boost your health, protect your financial security and give you peace of mind. Our benefits include the following (some may vary based on role, location or hours):<br><br><ul><li>Healthcare (medical, dental, vision)</li><li>Basic term and optional term life insurance</li><li>Short-term and long-term disability</li><li>Pregnancy disability and parental leave</li><li>401(k) and employer-funded retirement plan</li><li>Paid vacation (from two to five weeks depending on salary grade and tenure)</li><li>Up to 11 paid holiday opportunities</li><li>Adoption assistance</li><li>Sick and Safe Leave accruals of one hour for every 30 worked, up to 80 hours per calendar year unless otherwise provided by law<br><br></li></ul><strong>EEO is the Law<br><br></strong>U.S. Bank is an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse workforce. We consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, religion, color, sex, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status, among other factors. Applicants can learn more about the company’s status as an equal opportunity employer by viewing the federal <strong>KNOW YOUR RIGHTS</strong> EEO poster.<br><br><strong>E-Verify<br><br></strong>U.S. Bank participates in the U.S. Department of Homeland Security E-Verify program in all facilities located in the United States and certain U.S. territories. The E-Verify program is an Internet-based employment eligibility verification system operated by the U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services. Learn more about the E-Verify program.

title: Infrastructure Engineer
description: <strong>Discover. A brighter future.</strong><p><br></p>With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day &amp; We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p>At Discover, be part of a culture where diversity, teamwork and collaboration reign. Join a company that is just as employee-focused as it is on its customers and is consistently awarded for both. <strong>We’re all about people, and our employees are why Discover <em>is </em>a great place to work. </strong>Be the reason we help millions of consumers build a brighter financial future and achieve yours along the way with a rewarding career.<p><br></p>The Infrastructure Engineer works on holistic engineering deliverables across different stages of the product lifecycle and determines technology patterns for the overall solution. This role takes the lead in guiding more junior engineers and is a role model in fostering the adoption of new technologies. Actively manages and escalates risk and customer-impacting issues within the day-to-day role to management.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Achieves product commitments (and influences others to do the same) by using informal leadership &amp; highly developed communication skills and contributes to or led technology communities </li><li>Uses automation, system tools, open-source solutions, observability and 'security first' principles in daily work </li><li>Contributes to team agile ceremonies, leads demos and presentations, helps new engineers learn established norms </li><li>Initiates high level solution design approaches, and guides team to achieve desired key software delivery capabilities using automated, coded enterprise and observability </li><li>Participates in internal speaking and advocacy events </li><li>Supports research activities to adopt new technology solutions in ways of developing new capabilities </li><li>Continues professional education and creates opportunities for core product teams to learn engineering best practices </li><li>Coaches immediate chapter and actively fosters the adoption of new technologies </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Minimum Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>At a minimum, here’s what we need from you:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelors – Computer Science or related </li><li>3+ Years – (Software) Engineering, DevOps or related </li><li>Internal applicants only: technical proficiency rating of competent on the Dreyfus engineering scale </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>Bonus Points If You Have:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Devops infrastructure experience</li><li>OpenShift/Kubernetes</li><li>Strong Linux administration/scripting skillsets</li><li>CI/CD with Jenkins or similar</li><li>Git/GitHub</li><li>AWS</li><li>Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, ability to solve problems and articulate solutions to leadership.</li><li>Strong verbal and written communication skills.</li><li>Strong collaboration skills, responsive to service needs and project demands in a fast-changing environment.</li><li>Golang programing language</li><li>AWS RDS experience (Postgres)</li><li>Redis administration experience </li><li>Working in agile environment</li></ul><p><br></p>External applicants will be required to perform a technical interview.<p><br></p><strong>Compensation:</strong><p><br></p>The base pay for this position generally ranges between $84,500.00 to $142,500.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.<p><br></p><strong><strong><strong>Benefits:</strong></strong></strong><p><br></p>We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. These benefits include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Paid Time Off</li><li>401(k) Plan</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, &amp; Health Savings Account</li><li>STD, Life, LTD and AD&amp;D</li><li>Recognition Program</li><li>Education Assistance</li><li>Commuter Benefits</li><li>Family Support Programs</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li></ul><p><br></p>Learn more at MyDiscoverBenefits.com.<p><br></p>What are you waiting for? Apply today!<p><br></p>All Discover employees place our customers at the very center of our work. To deliver on our promises to our customers, each of us contribute every day to a culture that values compliance and risk management.<p><br></p>Discover is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Discover is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or other legally protected status. (Know Your Rights)<p><br></p>
description_json: <strong>Discover. A brighter future.</strong><p><br></p>With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day &amp; We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p>At Discover, be part of a culture where diversity, teamwork and collaboration reign. Join a company that is just as employee-focused as it is on its customers and is consistently awarded for both. <strong>We’re all about people, and our employees are why Discover <em>is </em>a great place to work. </strong>Be the reason we help millions of consumers build a brighter financial future and achieve yours along the way with a rewarding career.<p><br></p>The Infrastructure Engineer works on holistic engineering deliverables across different stages of the product lifecycle and determines technology patterns for the overall solution. This role takes the lead in guiding more junior engineers and is a role model in fostering the adoption of new technologies. Actively manages and escalates risk and customer-impacting issues within the day-to-day role to management.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Achieves product commitments (and influences others to do the same) by using informal leadership &amp; highly developed communication skills and contributes to or led technology communities </li><li>Uses automation, system tools, open-source solutions, observability and 'security first' principles in daily work </li><li>Contributes to team agile ceremonies, leads demos and presentations, helps new engineers learn established norms </li><li>Initiates high level solution design approaches, and guides team to achieve desired key software delivery capabilities using automated, coded enterprise and observability </li><li>Participates in internal speaking and advocacy events </li><li>Supports research activities to adopt new technology solutions in ways of developing new capabilities </li><li>Continues professional education and creates opportunities for core product teams to learn engineering best practices </li><li>Coaches immediate chapter and actively fosters the adoption of new technologies </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Minimum Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>At a minimum, here’s what we need from you:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelors – Computer Science or related </li><li>3+ Years – (Software) Engineering, DevOps or related </li><li>Internal applicants only: technical proficiency rating of competent on the Dreyfus engineering scale </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>Bonus Points If You Have:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Devops infrastructure experience</li><li>OpenShift/Kubernetes</li><li>Strong Linux administration/scripting skillsets</li><li>CI/CD with Jenkins or similar</li><li>Git/GitHub</li><li>AWS</li><li>Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, ability to solve problems and articulate solutions to leadership.</li><li>Strong verbal and written communication skills.</li><li>Strong collaboration skills, responsive to service needs and project demands in a fast-changing environment.</li><li>Golang programing language</li><li>AWS RDS experience (Postgres)</li><li>Redis administration experience </li><li>Working in agile environment</li></ul><p><br></p>External applicants will be required to perform a technical interview.<p><br></p><strong>Compensation:</strong><p><br></p>The base pay for this position generally ranges between $84,500.00 to $142,500.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.<p><br></p><strong><strong><strong>Benefits:</strong></strong></strong><p><br></p>We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. These benefits include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Paid Time Off</li><li>401(k) Plan</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, &amp; Health Savings Account</li><li>STD, Life, LTD and AD&amp;D</li><li>Recognition Program</li><li>Education Assistance</li><li>Commuter Benefits</li><li>Family Support Programs</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li></ul><p><br></p>Learn more at MyDiscoverBenefits.com.<p><br></p>What are you waiting for? Apply today!<p><br></p>All Discover employees place our customers at the very center of our work. To deliver on our promises to our customers, each of us contribute every day to a culture that values compliance and risk management.<p><br></p>Discover is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Discover is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or other legally protected status. (Know Your Rights)<p><br></p>

title: Account Coordinator
description: <p><strong>Epitec</strong></p><p><strong> </strong></p><p><strong>POSITION: </strong>Test Analyst</p><p> </p><p><strong>JOB TYPE:</strong> W-2, 12 mo. Contract, Full time, Dayshift, On-site</p><p> </p><p><strong>LOCATION: </strong>Lisle, IL <strong>** VISA SPONSORSHIP NOT AVAILABLE! **</strong></p><p> </p><p><strong>JOB SUMMARY FOR TEST ANALYST:</strong></p><p> </p><ul><li>The primary method of insuring that our vehicles work with a charger is to perform an interoperability study.</li><li>This involves more than just plugging a charger into a vehicle and watching it charge once for a short period of time.</li><li>We have a documented test process to verify that our vehicles charge with a specific model charger under a wide variety of conditions.</li><li>That test procedure will be provided separately.</li></ul><p> </p><p> </p><p><strong>RESPONSIBILITIES FOR TEST ANALYST:</strong></p><p> </p><ul><li>There are several things that need to happen to perform an interoperability study:</li><li>A production vehicle with the latest hardware and software must be available.</li><li>Electric Vehicle Supply Equipment (EVSE) must be present and functional next to the vehicle.</li><li>A trained company representative must be present to perform testing according to the interoperability test procedure.</li><li>Vector hardware and software is required for data logging.</li><li>Wiring harnesses are required to connect the vehicle and EVSE to the data logging equipment.</li><li>CAN data logs must be recorded from the vehicle.</li><li>PLC data logs mut be recorded from the EVSE.</li><li>Preferable- a representative from the EVSE supplier should perform testing with a company representative.</li><li>Preferable – a person needs to be in attendance who can drive the vehicle.</li></ul><p> </p><p> </p><p><strong>REQUIRED EXPERIENCE FOR TEST ANALYST:</strong></p><p> </p><p>REQUIRED:</p><ul><li>Bench Testing - 1-3 Years</li><li>CAN - 1-3 Years</li><li>Documentation - 1-3 Years</li><li>Electric Vehicles - 1-3 Years</li><li>Test Management - 1-3 Years</li></ul><p>Desired qualifications for person doing interoperability testing:</p><ul><li>• Work independently</li><li>• Technical competency</li><li>o Can be trained to take CAN &amp; PLC logs</li><li>o Can be trained to troubleshoot interoperability issues</li><li>• Attention to detail</li><li>o Perform testing</li><li>o Document test results</li><li>• Willingness to travel more than 50% of the time</li><li>• Can coordinate test activities at various locations throughout the country</li></ul><p>Nice to have:</p><ul><li>• CDL to move trucks and buses</li><li>• Ability to be customer facing and explain in simple terms why a vehicle may not charge</li><li>• Experience troubleshooting interoperability issues</li></ul><p> </p><p> </p><p><strong>SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS FOR TEST ANALYST:</strong></p><p> </p><ul><li>Pay Range: $42 hr. - $48 hr.</li></ul><p> </p><p> </p><p><strong>Why should you choose Epitec?</strong></p><p>We started Epitec with a single focus, “Placing People First.” Knowing every good endeavor begins with listening and understanding, we’ve set about challenging every part of the employment process. Bringing the proper connections together for the perfect fit.</p><p> </p><p><strong>How is Epitec different?</strong></p><p>Epitec gets to know our prospective employees, using these insights to locate the perfect placement for you. We are there, every step of the way. Providing a best-in-class compensation package combined with the opportunity to grow financially and personally through your work.</p><p> </p><p><strong>What is the result?</strong></p><p>Epitec represents the world’s top companies and works to fill their open jobs with the world’s best talent. That’s led to Epitec servicing an impressive list of Fortune 100 companies. We've also won many awards, including one of Crain’s Detroit Business “Cool Places to Work,” and 101 Best &amp; Brightest – local, national and elite winner. And that’s just the beginning, as we work to innovate the way the world thinks about employment.</p><p></p>

title: Salesforce Admin & Developer
description: <strong><u>Description</u></strong><p><br></p><em> Please Note: This Role is Remote to be worked on Central Standard Time Hours </em><p><br></p><strong><u>How You Will Make An Impact</u></strong><p><br></p><strong> Primary duties include but are not limited to: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Provides trouble resolution on complex problems and leads implementations for system and network security technologies </li><li> Develops testing plans to ensure quality of implementation </li><li> Coordinates and prepares the reporting of data security events and incidents </li><li> Provides system and network architecture support for information and network security technologies </li><li> Provides technical support to business and technology associates in risk assessments and implementation of appropriate information security procedures, standards and technologies </li><li> Represents major upgrades and reconfigurations in change control </li><li> Design &amp; analyze mix of vendor services meeting business and information security requirements </li><li> Maintains relationship with key vendors/strategic partners within organization </li><li> Determine and perform complex configuration changes to meet business and information security requirements </li><li> Perform capacity analysis </li><li> Recommend and implement capacity increases </li><li> Serve as the technical escalation for results of preventative maintenance routines </li><li> Supervise preventative maintenance </li><li> Represents infrastructure security support in significant projects and performs the most complex operations and administration tasks </li><li> Respond to level 3 &amp; 4 change and problem requests without supervision </li><li> Lead level 1 &amp; 2 incident recoveries and root cause analysis. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Requires a BA/BS degree in Information Technology and a minimum of 3 years experience in a support and operations, or design and engineering role in any of the following areas: Access management or network security technologies, servers, networks, network communications, application security, cyber security (or) </li><li> Any combination of education and experience, which would provide an equivalent background. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Preferred Skills, Capabilities And Experiences</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Current working experience on application security vulnerabilities remediation for .NET &amp; Java stack </li><li> Current working experience in using Static scan tools and Dynamic scan tools like Checkmarx, prisma or Qualys </li><li> Exceptional experience in encountering and understanding of the security best practices in every step of the software development lifecycle (SDLC) </li><li> Coordination with various cross functional teams on remediating application security findings that comes out pen test, Qualys, Prisma etc. </li><li> Knowledge of adhering to secure coding principles and aid in coding/testing the application against security risks/parameters before release </li><li> Using app security scan tools and also a good understanding of remediation steps </li><li> Ample understanding of security protocols for web interfaces </li><li> Current and/or prior experience with enabling and recommending developers on possible remediation efforts. </li><li> Technical security certifications (e.g. Systems Security Certified Practitioner) </li><li> Experience providing top-tier support for Application Security and, two or more of the information security technology areas:1) Access Control, 2) Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery Planning, 3) Cryptography, 4) Information Security and Risk Management 5) Legal, Regulations, 6) Compliance and Investigations, 7) Operations Security, 8) Physical (Environmental) Security, 9) Security Architecture and Design, 10) Telecommunications and Network Security. </li></ul><p><br></p>Please be advised that Elevance Health only accepts resumes from agencies that have a signed agreement with Elevance Health. Accordingly, Elevance Health is not obligated to pay referral fees to any agency that is not a party to an agreement with Elevance Health. Thus, any unsolicited resumes, including those submitted to hiring managers, are deemed to be the property of Elevance Health.<p><br></p><strong>Be part of an Extraordinary Team</strong><p><br></p>Elevance Health is a health company dedicated to improving lives and communities – and making healthcare simpler. A Fortune 20 company with a longstanding history in the healthcare industry, we are looking for leaders at all levels of the organization who are passionate about making an impact on our members and the communities we serve. You will thrive in a complex and collaborative environment where you take action and ownership to solve problems and lead change. Do you want to be part of a larger purpose and an evolving, high-performance culture that empowers you to make an impact?<p><br></p>We offer a range of market-competitive total rewards that include merit increases, paid holidays, Paid Time Off, and incentive bonus programs (unless covered by a collective bargaining agreement), medical, dental, vision, short and long term disability benefits, 401(k) +match, stock purchase plan, life insurance, wellness programs and financial education resources, to name a few.<p><br></p>The health of our associates and communities is a top priority for Elevance Health. We require all new candidates in certain patient/member-facing roles to become vaccinated against COVID-19. If you are not vaccinated, your offer will be rescinded unless you provide – and Elevance Health approves – a valid religious or medical explanation as to why you are not able to get vaccinated that Elevance Health is able to reasonably accommodate. Elevance Health will also follow all relevant federal, state and local laws.<p><br></p>Elevance Health has been named as a Fortune Great Place To Work in 2022, has been ranked for five years running as one of the 2023 World’s Most Admired Companies by Fortune magazine, and is a growing Top 20 Fortune 500 Company. To learn more about our company and apply, please visit us at careers.ElevanceHealth.com. Elevance Health is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, citizenship status, color, creed, disability, ethnicity, genetic information, gender (including gender identity and gender expression), marital status, national origin, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, veteran status or any other status or condition protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws. Applicants who require accommodation to participate in the job application process may contact ability@icareerhelp.com for assistance.

title: Linux Systems Engineer
description: Description <br><br>Assess the security posture of our systems, applications, and infrastructure and design and implement strategies for asset hardening (baseline security configurations). Identify misconfigurations, and weaknesses in systems and apply appropriate security controls and countermeasures to mitigate risks. Collaborate with system administrators, network engineers, and application developers to engineer and harden assets at all layers, including operating systems, cloud platforms, databases, and network devices. Engineer and maintain security controls within the Microsoft 365 environment, including Azure Active Directory, Exchange Online, SharePoint, Intune and Teams. Configure and enforce security policies, data loss prevention (DLP) measures, and threat protection mechanisms to safeguard our assets. Stay informed about emerging security technologies and trends and provide recommendations for their adoption. Software Requirements Active Directory (Azure, On-prem) AWS (Desirable) M365 Windows Servers (2016 and newer) Linux (Desirable) Containers (Desirable) Experience Required 5 years of experience as a Security Engineer or in a similar role, with a demonstrated background in asset hardening and Microsoft 365 security. Scripting/automation experience such as Python and PowerShell Knowledge, Skills, ablilties, and behaviors required Ability to work both independently and with a team while managing workload with minimal supervision. Strong knowledge of servers, networking, cloud technologies, and related security considerations. Familiarity with security principles, frameworks, and compliance standards (e.g., NIST, CIS) Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to analyze complex technical issues. Strong communication and collaboration skills to work effectively with cross-functional teams. Ability to travel and collaborate in the downtown Chicago office two days a week.<br><br> Skills <br><br>security, information security, firewall, network security, cloud<br><br> Top Skills Details <br><br>security,information security,firewall,network security,cloud<br><br> Additional Skills &amp; Qualifications <br><br>Education Requirements 4 year college degree in Information Technology or equivalent experience Security certifications (CISSP, GSEC, MS—500, MS-700, CCSP, etc.) preferred<br><br> Experience Level <br><br>Intermediate Level<br><br> About TEKsystems <br><br>We're partners in transformation. We help clients activate ideas and solutions to take advantage of a new world of opportunity. We are a team of 80,000 strong, working with over 6,000 clients, including 80% of the Fortune 500, across North America, Europe and Asia. As an industry leader in Full-Stack Technology Services, Talent Services, and real-world application, we work with progressive leaders to drive change. That's the power of true partnership. TEKsystems is an Allegis Group company.<br><br>The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

title: Salesforce Developer (Software Engineer 1)
description: Prestigious Financial Institution is currently seeking an Enterprise Monitoring Engineer with Splunk experience . Candidate will provide services related to Enterprise Systems Monitoring. This includes Infrastructure, Application and logging.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Write automation scripts using common automation tools such as Ansible, Terraform, Python, or Shell Scripting</li><li>Interface with 3rd party applications using API s</li><li>Design and develop enterprise monitoring solutions for cloud environments</li><li>Design and develop enterprise monitoring solutions for microservices technologies</li><li>Administer log ingestion tools such as Splunk</li><li>Administer Infrastructure monitoring tools such as LogicMonitor</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>System administration and change management practices</li><li>Advanced knowledge of Splunk administration</li><li>Experience Scripting and coding against API s</li><li>Solid understanding of network technologies</li><li>Experience with cloud native applications</li><li>Experience with technologies used to support microservices.</li></ul>

title: Infrastructure Engineer
description: Hyatt Corporate Office, Chicago The Opportunity Hyatt Hotels Corporation seeks an enthusiastic Development professional to join our North America Select Service Development team. In this role, you will be collaborating closely with the broader Development team, where you'll be instrumental in continuing to make Hyatt a leading hospitality company. This position will be responsible for driving the growth of Hyatt's new upper-midscale extended-stay brand, Hyatt Studios, in a particular territory. You will be part of a team that is passionate about diversity, equity, and inclusion, committed to nurturing curiosity and new skills and building connections across the organization with stakeholders, colleagues, and guests. Who We Are At Hyatt, we believe in the power of belonging and creating a culture of care, where our colleagues become family. Since 1957, our colleagues and guests have been at the heart of our business and helped Hyatt become one of the world's best and fastest-growing hospitality brands. Our transformative growth and the addition of new hotels, brands, and business lines can open the door for exciting career and growth opportunities for our colleagues. As we continue to grow, we never lose sight of what's most important: People. We turn trips into journeys, encounters into experiences, and jobs into careers. Why Now? This is an exciting time to be at Hyatt. We are growing rapidly and are looking for passionate changemakers to be a part of our journey. The hospitality industry is resilient and continues to offer dynamic opportunities for upward mobility, and Hyatt is no exception. How We Care for Our People Our purpose sets us apart-to care for people so they can be their best. Every business decision is made through the lens of our purpose, and it informs how we have and will continue to support each other as members of the Hyatt family. Our care for our colleagues is the key to our success. We're proud to have earned a place on Fortune's prestigious 100 Best Companies to Work For® list for the last ten years. This recognition is a testament to the tremendous way our Hyatt family continues to come together to care for one another, our commitment to a culture of inclusivity, empathy, and respect, and making sure everyone feels like they belong. We're proud to offer exceptional corporate benefits which include:<br><ul><li>Annual allotment of free hotel stays at Hyatt hotels globally</li><li>Flexible work schedule and location</li><li>Work-life benefits including well-being initiatives such as a complimentary Headspace subscription, and a discount at the on-site fitness center</li><li>A global family assistance policy with paid time off following the birth or adoption of a child as well as financial assistance for adoption</li><li>Paid Time Off, Medical, Dental, Vision, 401K with company match Our Commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion Our success is underpinned by our diverse, equitable, and inclusive culture and we are committed to diversity across the board-from whom we hire and develop, the organizations we support, and whom we buy from and work with. Being part of Hyatt means always having space to be you. Our global teams are a mosaic of cultures, ethnicities, genders, ages, abilities, and identities. We constantly strive to reflect the world we care for with teams that achieve and grow together. To learn more about our commitments to DE&amp;I, please visit the Why Hyatt section of the Hyatt career page. Who You Are As our ideal candidate, you understand the power and purpose of our Culture of Care and embody our core values of Empathy, Inclusion, Integrity, Experimentation, Respect, and Well-being. You enjoy working with others, are results-driven, and are looking for a variety of opportunities to develop personally and professionally. The Role The Developer role requires a wide and varied skill base, an understanding of local hotel markets, ability to develop relationships and convince developers that Hyatt products are well-suited for the location and market.</li><li>Develop relationships with possible franchises &amp; other partners to grow the Hyatt system with a focus on Hyatt Studios</li><li>Identify locations and markets in which to focus time and effort</li><li>Prepare and analyze market and performance data to demonstrate why the Hyatt Studios brand is the right fit for a market</li><li>Bring new Hyatt projects forward for approval through Hyatt's internal Select Development Committee</li><li>Negotiate terms and conditions of each franchise agreementQualificationsExperience Required:</li><li>5 + years of hotel franchise sales and development, hotel feasibility, hotel financial analysis or other sales-related experience. Established relationships with owners, operators, consultants, management companies, lenders, builders, etc.</li><li>Strong negotiation and influencing skills.</li><li>Excellent communication and presentation skills.</li><li>Excellent interpersonal skills and demeanor.</li><li>Ability to multi-task and handle multiple relationships and deals</li><li>Ability to travel approximately 75% of the time Experience Preferred:</li><li>Bachelor's degree, preferably in Hotel Management, Real Estate, or Finance The position responsibilities outlined above are in no way to be construed as all-encompassing. Other duties, responsibilities, and qualifications may be required and/or assigned as necessary. We welcome you: Research shows that women, people of color, and other historically excluded groups, tend to apply to jobs, only if they meet all the listed job qualifications. Unsure if you check every box, but feeling inspired to enhance your career? Apply. We'd love to consider your unique experiences and how you could make Hyatt even better.PDN-993f66a1-3c4d-4fbb-a3ca-43b632d1f583</li></ul>

title: Test Analyst
description: Hands on experience in Qlik Sense development, dashboarding and data modeling and reporting (ad hoc report generation) techniques.<p><br></p>Must be good at Data transformation, the creation of QVD files and set analysis.<p><br></p>Experienced in application designing, architecting, development and deployment using Qlik Sense. Must be efficient in front-end development and know visualization best practices.<p><br></p>Strong database designing and SQL skills. Experienced in RDMS such as MS SQL Server, Oracle etc.<p><br></p>Strong communication skills (verbal/written) to deliver the technical insights and interpret the data reports to the clients. Also helps in understanding and serving to the clients requirements.<p><br></p>Leadership qualities and thoughtful implementation of Qlik Sense best practices in order to deliver effective Qlik Sense solutions to the users.<p><br></p>Able to comprehend and translate complex and advanced functional, technical and business requirements into executable architectural designs.<p><br></p>Creating and maintaining technical documentation.<p><br></p>Experienced in data integration through extracting, transforming and loading (ETL) data from various sources.<p><br></p><em>Diverse Lynx LLC is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive due consideration for employment without any discrimination. All applicants will be evaluated solely on the basis of their ability, competence and their proven capability to perform the functions outlined in the corresponding role. We promote and support a diverse workforce across all levels in the company.</em>

title: Application Security Engineer (Engineer III)
description: <strong>Discover. A brighter future.</strong><p><br></p>With us, you’ll do meaningful work from Day 1. Our collaborative culture is built on three core behaviors: We Play to Win, We Get Better Every Day &amp; We Succeed Together. And we mean it — we want you to grow and make a difference at one of the world's leading digital banking and payments companies. We value what makes you unique so that you have an opportunity to shine.<p><br></p>Come build your future, while being the reason millions of people find a brighter financial future with Discover.<p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p>At Discover, be part of a culture where diversity, teamwork, and collaboration reign. Join a company that is just as employee focused as it is on its customers and is consistently awarded for both. <strong>We’re all about people, and our employees are why Discover <em>is </em>a great place to work. </strong>Be the reason we help millions of consumers build a brighter financial future and achieve yours along the way with a rewarding career.<p><br></p>As an Infrastructure Engineer(developer), you will be responsible for building, configuring, and customizing a modern Intranet solution utilizing modern SharePoint &amp; Microsoft Viva Connections. Additionally, you will own and build out the governance process for managing M365 integrations, MS graph API, power automate, and power applications. Responsibilities include building systems according to company specifications, building Microsoft Viva adaptive cards, writing, and modifying code, debugging software and training staff.<p><br></p>The ideal candidate will have the following skills: Modern SharePoint Design, Microsoft Graph API, UI/UX design process, proficient with .Net, JavaScript, C#, CSS &amp; HTML, Microsoft framework, and automation applications (power applications, power automate).<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Delivers technology solutions that support business goals. Partners with the product owner to understand business requirements, evaluates features, and translates application specifications into workable technical solutions.</li><li>Maintains application software and systems. Ensures all projects and releases are appropriately tested and risks are mitigated. </li><li>Oversees and reviews development activities of team members and contractors.</li><li>Supports technical initiatives and provides input best practices to team.</li><li>Achieves product commitments (and influences others to do the same) by using informal leadership &amp; highly developed communication skills and contributes to or led technology communities </li><li>Uses automation, system tools, open-source solutions, observability and 'security first' principles in daily work </li><li>Contributes to team agile ceremonies, leads demos and presentations, helps new engineers learn established norms </li><li>Initiates high level solution design approaches, and guides team to achieve desired key software delivery capabilities using automated, coded enterprise and observability </li><li>Participates in internal speaking and advocacy events </li><li>Supports research activities to adopt new technology solutions in ways of developing new capabilities </li><li>Continues professional education and creates opportunities for core product teams to learn engineering best practices </li><li>Coaches immediate chapter and actively fosters the adoption of new technologies </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Minimum Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>At a minimum, here’s what we need from you:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelors – Computer Science or related </li><li>3+ Years – (Software) Engineering, DevOps or related </li><li>Internal applicants only: technical proficiency rating of competent on the Dreyfus engineering scale </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications</strong><p><br></p><strong>Bonus Points If You Have:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>In depth knowledge with PowerShell scripting and automation builds</li><li>Familiar with Jira and Agile Scrum methods (ceremonies)</li><li>Actively fosters the adoption of new technologies</li><li>Continues professional education and create opportunities for core product teams to learn engineering best practices</li><li>Initiates high level solution design approaches, and guides team to achieve desired key software delivery capabilities using automated, coded enterprise and observability</li><li>Participates in internal speaking and advocacy event</li><li>Supports research activities to adopt new technology solutions in ways of developing new capabilities</li><li>Achieves product commitments (and influences others to do the same) by using informal leadership &amp; highly developed communication skills and contributes to or led technology communities</li></ul><p><br></p>External applicants will be required to perform a technical interview<p><br></p><strong>Compensation:</strong><p><br></p>The base pay for this position generally ranges between $84,500.00 to $142,500.00. Additional incentives may be provided as part of a market competitive total compensation package. Factors, such as but not limited to, geographical location, relevant experience, education, and skill level may impact the pay for this position.<p><br></p><strong><strong><strong>Benefits:</strong></strong></strong><p><br></p>We also offer a range of benefits and programs based on eligibility. These benefits include:<p><br></p><ul><li>Paid Parental Leave</li><li>Paid Time Off</li><li>401(k) Plan</li><li>Medical, Dental, Vision, &amp; Health Savings Account</li><li>STD, Life, LTD and AD&amp;D</li><li>Recognition Program</li><li>Education Assistance</li><li>Commuter Benefits</li><li>Family Support Programs</li><li>Employee Stock Purchase Plan</li></ul><p><br></p>Learn more at MyDiscoverBenefits.com.<p><br></p>What are you waiting for? Apply today!<p><br></p>All Discover employees place our customers at the very center of our work. To deliver on our promises to our customers, each of us contribute every day to a culture that values compliance and risk management.<p><br></p>Discover is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Discover is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or other legally protected status. (Know Your Rights)

title: Cloud Field Engineer - Americas (Remote)
description: <strong><u>Description<br><br></u></strong><strong>Company: </strong>Oak Street Health<br><br><strong>Title: </strong>Quality Engineer II - Data<br><br><strong>Location: </strong>Chicago/Remote<br><br><strong><u>Role Description<br><br></u></strong>The Quality Engineer will be responsible for managing all functional and automated testing processes in support of business intelligence development efforts at Oak Street Health. From design to implementation, you will partner with our stellar engineering, product, and design teams in a fast-paced, agile environment to transform ideas into a reality. Utilizing modern methodologies and open source tools, you will be empowered to push the boundaries of Quality Engineering as we seek to deliver applications that will directly and immediately impact the experience of our teams and our patients. This role will handle the creation of all test scripts, the documentation of all test cases and identification of bugs across ETL development and reporting. The Quality Engineer will manage the identification of bugs and assist in the prioritization of bug fixes.<br><br>There is no better time to join our rapidly growing team at Oak Street Health. We can’t think of a mission any more motivating; and, with your help, we can drive change in healthcare for the patients that need us most.<br><br><strong><u>Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li>Contribute in all aspects of SDLC process( SCRUM, Design, Code, Test, Deploy &amp; Maintain)</li><li>Review and analyze business and system requirements / specifications</li><li>Design test plans, scenarios, scripts, and procedures</li><li>Execute test cases (manual or automated) and log test results</li><li>Work with the development and product team to correct bugs / errors and identify requirement updates / clarifications</li><li>Support, design, develop, and enhance test processes and reporting for QA processes</li><li>Develop and maintain automation frameworks and solutions for ETL and data architecture</li><li>Automate tests to facilitate regression testing</li><li>Provide testing SME guidance to QA engineers</li><li>Other duties as assigned<br></li></ul><strong><u>What We’re Looking For<br></u></strong><ul><li>3+ years in data engineering / ETL pipeline testing</li><li>3+ years of experience writing and executing SQL queries</li><li>Proficiency with Test Case Preparation and Execution</li><li>Sound knowledge of data flows, data architecture, data engineering / ETL and processing data</li><li>Sound knowledge of QA methodology and Agile frameworks</li><li>Strong communication skills and a keen eye for details</li><li>US work authorization</li><li>Someone who embodies being “Oaky”<br></li></ul><strong><u>Why Oak Street Health?<br><br></u></strong>Oak Street Health is on a mission to “Rebuild healthcare as it should be'', providing personalized primary care for older adults on Medicare, with the goal of keeping patients healthy and living life to the fullest. Our innovative care model is centered right in our patient’s communities, and focused on the quality of care over volume of services. We’re an organization on the move! With over 150 locations and an ambitious growth trajectory, Oak Street Health is attracting and cultivating team members who embody “Oaky” values and passion for our mission.<br><br><strong><u>Oak Street Health Benefits<br></u></strong><ul><li>Mission-focused career impacting change and measurably improving health outcomes for medicare patients</li><li>Paid vacation, sick time, and investment/retirement 401K match options</li><li>Health insurance, vision, and dental benefits</li><li>Opportunities for leadership development and continuing education stipends</li><li>New centers and flexible work environments</li><li>Opportunities for high levels of responsibility and rapid advancement<br></li></ul>Oak Street Health is an equal opportunity employer. We embrace diversity and encourage all interested readers to apply.<br><br>Learn more at <u>www.oakstreethealth.com/diversity-equity-and-inclusion-at-oak-street-health</u>

This role will handle the creation of all test scripts, the documentation of all test cases and identification of bugs across ETL development and reporting. The Quality Engineer will manage the identification of bugs and assist in the prioritization of bug fixes.<br><br>There is no better time to join our rapidly growing team at Oak Street Health. We can’t think of a mission any more motivating; and, with your help, we can drive change in healthcare for the patients that need us most.<br><br><strong><u>Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li>Contribute in all aspects of SDLC process( SCRUM, Design, Code, Test, Deploy &amp; Maintain)</li><li>Review and analyze business and system requirements / specifications</li><li>Design test plans, scenarios, scripts, and procedures</li><li>Execute test cases (manual or automated) and log test results</li><li>Work with the development and product team to correct bugs / errors and identify requirement updates / clarifications</li><li>Support, design, develop, and enhance test processes and reporting for QA processes</li><li>Develop and maintain automation frameworks and solutions for ETL and data architecture</li><li>Automate tests to facilitate regression testing</li><li>Provide testing SME guidance to QA engineers</li><li>Other duties as assigned<br></li></ul><strong><u>What We’re Looking For<br></u></strong><ul><li>3+ years in data engineering / ETL pipeline testing</li><li>3+ years of experience writing and executing SQL queries</li><li>Proficiency with Test Case Preparation and Execution</li><li>Sound knowledge of data flows, data architecture, data engineering / ETL and processing data</li><li>Sound knowledge of QA methodology and Agile frameworks</li><li>Strong communication skills and a keen eye for details</li><li>US work authorization</li><li>Someone who embodies being “Oaky”<br></li></ul><strong><u>Why Oak Street Health?<br><br></u></strong>Oak Street Health is on a mission to “Rebuild healthcare as it should be'', providing personalized primary care for older adults on Medicare, with the goal of keeping patients healthy and living life to the fullest. Our innovative care model is centered right in our patient’s communities, and focused on the quality of care over volume of services. We’re an organization on the move! With over 150 locations and an ambitious growth trajectory, Oak Street Health is attracting and cultivating team members who embody “Oaky” values and passion for our mission.<br><br><strong><u>Oak Street Health Benefits<br></u></strong><ul><li>Mission-focused career impacting change and measurably improving health outcomes for medicare patients</li><li>Paid vacation, sick time, and investment/retirement 401K match options</li><li>Health insurance, vision, and dental benefits</li><li>Opportunities for leadership development and continuing education stipends</li><li>New centers and flexible work environments</li><li>Opportunities for high levels of responsibility and rapid advancement<br></li></ul>Oak Street Health is an equal opportunity employer. We embrace diversity and encourage all interested readers to apply.<br><br>Learn more at <u>www.oakstreethealth.com/diversity-equity-and-inclusion-at-oak-street-health</u>

title: Security Engineer
description: <strong>Cliecon Solutions Inc,</strong> (head quartered in central NJ ) is one of the fastest growing and a leading consulting and management firm with 12 years of experience in Staff Augmentation. We handle complete recruiting cycle for fortune 500 clients, major implementing partners and tier -1 vendors. We specialized in recruiting for Application development, Big data, Databases, Infrastructure, Cloud, Mobile and ERP based solutions projects.<p><br></p><strong>Role: Linux Engineer / Middleware </strong><p><br></p><strong>Location: Chicago, IL</strong><p><br></p><strong>Description:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>8 plus years of Linux Patching along with Apache Tomcat </li><li>We need resource in Chicago with close proximity to our YASH office and need to travel to customer site in case of critical break fix during the patching window/cycle.</li></ul><p><br></p>Thanks &amp; Regards,<p><br></p>Linux Engineer / Middleware on W2 (Chicago, IL)

title: Adobe Target Developer
description: <p> <br><br></p><p> <br><br></p><p>Welcome to Gallagher - Employee Experience &amp; Communication, where we go beyond flat websites, static emails, and throw-away home mailers. We're championing behavioral shifts on a grand scale, for some of the world's most prominent brands. From high street fashion labels to international tech powerhouses, we specialize in devising innovative solutions to transform diverse workforces into unstoppable forces.<br><br></p><p> <br><br></p><p>Check out our latest showreel.<br><br></p><p> <br><br></p><p> <br><br></p><p>Are you passionate, with the ability to learn? Have you got experience in developing intuitive, secure, and engaging web applications? Does the following sound like your profile?<br><br></p><p> <br><br></p><ul><li>Experience in building Angular2 web applications</li><li>Logical and methodical problem solver</li><li>Having a keen eye for detail</li><li>Collaborative team player</li><li>Embracer and advocate for the latest technologies</li><li>Passionate about secure, efficient, and optimized code</li></ul><p> <br><br></p><p>Working as part of a dynamic, forward-thinking team of web development professionals, you will effectively contribute to the development of commercially viable digital solutions, continuing the strong sustainable growth of Gallagher Communication. You will also have opportunities to develop and maintain business relationships with clients to first-hand promote technical innovation and excellence.<br><br></p><p> <br><br></p><p> <br><br></p><ul><li>Collaborate with a cross-functional team to design, develop, and maintain high-quality web applications using Angular</li><li>Create scalable and reusable UI components that adhere to best practices and coding standards</li><li>Participate in the entire application lifecycle, focusing on coding, debugging, and performance optimization</li><li>Integrate with RESTful APIs, ensuring seamless data flow and functionality</li><li>Conduct thorough testing to ensure optimal performance and identify potential issues</li><li>Collaborate with product managers, UX/UI designers, and other stakeholders to gather and refine requirements</li><li>Stay up to date with the latest industry trends and emerging technologies to ensure our applications are always at the forefront</li><li>Actively contribute to technical meetings</li><li>Provide technical guidance, support, and mentorship to junior team members as needed</li><li>Contribute to all aspects of digital service delivery, supporting other roles and teams where there is a project need or skills gap and, as required, perform the role of any lower role in the team to ensure project success</li><li>Attend relevant courses and take advantage of L&amp;D opportunities that arise</li><li>Provide reasoned estimates of time and resources</li></ul><span>Our stack:</span><p> <br><br></p><p>To work well as a team, develop efficient code, and deliver great solutions, we currently use the following technology:<br><br></p><p> <br><br></p><ul><li>Angular2</li><li>Typescript</li><li>PHP proprietary restful API</li><li>Node</li><li>E2EE tools (CryptoJS, Curve25519, Elliptic)</li><li>Swagger IO</li><li>Google Cloud Platform services</li></ul><p> <br><br></p><p> <br><br></p><p> <br><br></p><ul><li>At least 2 years of professional experience working with Angular, including knowledge of Angular CLI and library dependencies.</li><li>At least 3 years of professional experience working in strongly typed programming</li><li>Proficiency in TypeScript, JavaScript, HTML5, and CSS3</li><li>Familiarity with RxJS, NgRx, or other state management libraries</li><li>Experience with RESTful APIs, JSON, and web services integration</li><li>A strong understanding of responsive design principles and cross-browser compatibility</li><li>Excellent problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and the ability to work independently or as part of a team</li><li>Strong communication and interpersonal skills to effectively collaborate with team members and stakeholders</li><li>A proven proactive approach to staying up to date with new technologies, tools, and best practices in web development.</li><li>Awareness of time and budget constraints when delivering project work</li><li>A bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Technology, or a related field, or equivalent professional experience.</li></ul><span>Bonus Points</span><ul><li>Knowledge of other modern JavaScript frameworks or libraries (e.g., React, Vue.js)</li><li>Familiarity with version control systems such as Git</li><li>Experience with Agile methodologies and tools like Jira or DevOps</li><li>Commercial awareness</li><li>Ability to develop ideas for product or service delivery innovation</li></ul><span>What we offer you:</span><p> <br><br></p><p>At Gallagher Communication, our goal is to foster a workplace environment where every individual is proud to belong and can confidently call themselves a team member. We embrace a culture that values diversity, allowing everyone to excel and, most importantly, be their authentic selves.<br><br></p><p> <br><br></p><p>We acknowledge and appreciate that each person is unique. Uniformity in thought and background would make our organization vulnerable. By welcoming and promoting diverse perspectives and backgrounds within our company, we create a more robust, innovative, and profitable business.<br><br></p><p> <br><br></p><p>If this resonates with you and aligns with your values, we would be thrilled to connect with you. Should you need flexibility for any position you're applying to, don't hesitate to contact us to discuss the available options.<br><br></p><p> <br><br></p><p>As an Angular Developer, you can expect:<br><br></p><p> <br><br></p><ul><li>Competitive salary and benefits package</li><li>Flexible work arrangements, including remote and hybrid options</li><li>Opportunities for continuous learning, training, and career development</li><li>A vibrant and dynamic company culture that fosters collaboration, innovation, and work-life balance</li></ul>

title: Enterprise Monitoring Engineer
description: <strong>Job Purpose</strong><p><br></p>The Repower engineering team currently has an opening for an experienced engineer who is focused individual and has analytical approach to problem solving. The engineer will be responsible for carrying out required duties not only to support production projects but also to support inquiry team with proposals for the repower engineering department, including design, research, prototyping, engineering documentation, estimating and participate in process improvement activities. The successful candidate will report directly to the manager of the engineering team and collaborate with other departments (such as purchasing, operations, inquiry, sales, program management and manufacturing) on ongoing proposals, production and R&amp;D projects.<p><br></p><strong>Req ID</strong><p><br></p>8409BR<p><br></p><strong>Work Location Options</strong><p><br></p>LaGrange, IL<p><br></p><strong>City</strong><p><br></p>La Grange<p><br></p><strong>State:</strong><p><br></p>Illinois<p><br></p><strong>Company Description</strong><p><br></p>Railroads transport goods and people millions of miles every day. At Progress Rail, we believe in going the distance with them. We are looking for talented and innovative team players to address the challenges of the rail industry today, ensuring success for the future. Build a long-term career with opportunities for growth and advancement as part of a vibrant network of close to 200 global locations. Our innovative team members work together to forge the bridge between ideas and success!<p><br></p>As a Caterpillar company, Progress Rail is an integrated rolling stock and infrastructure provider, delivering a full range of products and services to domestic and international railroad customers. Our customers enjoy one-stop shopping and comprehensive railway solutions – whether it rolls on the rail or is the rail itself. From locomotives, transit, freight cars and engines, to tracks, signals and advanced technology, we ensure customers can count on us to meet their needs.<p><br></p>Learn how we keep our customers rolling by following us on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, YouTube and LinkedIn, and by visiting progressrail.com .<p><br></p><strong>Key Job Elements</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Incumbent will have overall design and technical responsibility for the project as a whole. Multiple projects will be worked simultaneously;</li><li> Respond to new sales inquiries in a timely manner and create customer technical proposals;</li><li> Undertake task such locomotive performance studies, project cost estimates, and engineering cost estimates;</li><li> Interpret customer requirements and translate into locomotive engineering specifications;</li><li> Applicant must be capable and comfortable making timely judgement calls on technical issues, based on often-incomplete customer requirements;</li><li> Create engineering requirements documents and specifications for execution of projects, translating the project commercial requirements into specific engineering design deliverables;</li><li> Guide the design of the product to minimize cost and schedule. Contain scope creep on projects;</li><li> Conduct field testing for demonstration of contract requirements and for certification purposes;</li><li>Attend meetings with customers, vendors, and certifying agencies, making presentations and negotiating technical issues;</li><li> Determining customer’s requirements and translating them into an actionable plan;</li><li> Organizing many tasks into a timeline. Holding required meetings with to ensure specification compliance and project execution in accordance with time and budget restrictions;</li><li> Making sure that all health, safety, legal and railroad regulatory (FRA, CFR, AAR) requirements are being met throughout the process;</li><li> Up to 25% travel may be required.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Education / Training</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> BS in mechanical or electrical engineering, or related discipline.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications And Experience</strong><p><br></p>Required:<p><br></p><ul><li> Knowledge of locomotive structure, powerplant, cooling system, electrical system, and pneumatic system;</li><li> Experience with diesel engine installation and application requirements;</li><li> Knowledge of locomotive performance characteristics and ability to address customer operational requirements;</li><li> High level of analytical abilities where problems are very complex;</li><li> High level of written and oral communication skills;</li><li> Ability to travel as required.</li></ul><p><br></p>Preferred:<p><br></p><ul><li> Expected high level of analytical ability where problems are unusual and difficult;</li><li> Thorough understanding of complex mechanical and/or electrical concepts;</li><li> Previous locomotive or heavy equipment design familiarity and test experience;</li><li> Experience with both EMD and Caterpillar diesel engine characteristics and requirements;</li><li> Familiarity with AAR and UIC standards relating to rolling stock;</li><li> Experience with project management methodology;</li><li> Familiarity with EMD engineering processes and systems;</li><li> Prior experience in field test, commissioning, or field service engineering.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Essential And Physical Activities Functions</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Strength – Position typically involves work in an office environment with occasional visits to an industrial environment. Frequent/constant sitting. Occasional standing and walking. Occasional light to medium-level lifting or carrying (up to 30 pounds);</li><li> Motion – Position regularly requires standard motions associated with working in an office environment. Depending on assigned project, position occasionally require motions involved in an industrial working environment, including some low to intense levels of pushing, pulling, climbing, balancing, crouching, stooping, kneeling, reaching, grasping, such as climbing onto and off of locomotives;</li><li> Vision/Hearing Requirements – Frequent verbal communications, including both talking and hearing;</li><li> Work Environment – Position is typically located in an office environment with occasional visits to an industrial environment which may include a non-temperature-controlled environment, as well as exposure to noise (85+ decibels), occasional exposure to temperature changes, heavy machinery and other hazardous working conditions requiring the use of PPE. Position requires travel as necessary, both domestic and international;</li><li> Emotional Demands – Very high level of responsibility. Must be able to coordinate diverse aspects of a project. Requires significant interpersonal skills while sustaining very high standards;</li><li> Safety – Position occasionally requires the use of Personal Protective Equipment during visits to industrial areas.</li></ul><p><br></p>The preceding description is not designed to be a complete list of all duties and responsibilities required of a Locomotive Repower Systems Engineer.<p><br></p><strong>Benefits</strong><p><br></p>Progress Rail offers an excellent total compensation package,* including competitive salary, paid time off for vacation and holidays, 401(k) plan with company match, medical/dental/vision/life/disability insurance and flexible spending accounts. Relocation assistance may be available for some positions.<p><br></p><ul><li>Benefits eligibility differs by job position and employment status - governing plan documents control such benefits. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>EEO</strong><p><br></p>Equal Opportunity Employer – Race/Color/Sex/Religion/National Origin/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/Vets/Disabilities<p><br></p><strong>Job Category</strong><p><br></p>Engineering<p><br></p><strong>PRS Facility Location</strong><p><br></p>EMD HQ LaGrange, IL- 400
