title: Developer, Southeast
description: We are seeking a talented and detail-oriented Data Scientist to join our team. As a key member of our organization, you will be responsible for standardizing data collection processes, analyzing business information to provide valuable insights, visualizing data to facilitate decision-making, and helping us back up our unique project delivery process with hard evidence. Additionally, you will support our design teams in preparing analyses of potential future projects and developments based on GIS and publicly available data sources. You will collaborate closely with integrated teams, including architects, engineers, estimators, and project managers to help develop innovative solutions that enhance our project delivery process. This role requires strong analytical skills, proficiency in data analysis and visualization, and the ability to collaborate with various teams to find optimal solutions.<br><br><strong><u>Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li>Collaborate with different business groups to standardize data collection processes across the organization.</li><li>Clean, validate, and analyze data from various sources to identify trends, patterns, and insights.</li><li>Develop predictive models to optimize project timelines, resource allocation, cost estimation, and risk assessment.</li><li>Generate reports, dashboards, and visualizations to effectively communicate data insights to stakeholders and facilitate informed decision-making.</li><li>Assist in designing and implementing strategies for collecting GIS and publicly available data to evaluate the viability of future projects.</li><li>Collaborate with integrated teams, including architects, engineers, estimators, and project managers to identify areas where data-driven insights and artificial intelligence can enhance our processes and boost client satisfaction.</li><li>Design and implement data pipelines, automate data collection, and integrate data from various sources to ensure data integrity and accuracy.</li><li>Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and advancements in data science, artificial intelligence, and construction technology to identify opportunities for innovation and improvement within the company.<br><br></li></ul><strong><u>Qualifications<br></u></strong><ul><li>Bachelor's degree or higher in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, MIS, Computer Engineering, or a related discipline.</li><li>3+ years related work experience</li><li>Proficiency in programming languages such as Python or R, and experience working with data science libraries.</li><li>Strong understanding of data analysis, statistical modeling, and predictive modeling<br><br></li></ul>Wight &amp; Company offers excellent benefits and a wonderful work environment. For more information about our company, visit our website at www.wightco.com .<br><br>Wight &amp; Company is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status. Please view the following links for more information - EEO , EEO Supplement , and Pay Transparency .<br><br>Wight &amp; Company values diversity in our workforce. We are committed to recruiting, hiring and promoting people with disabilities and veterans. If you need an accommodation to assist with completing the electronic application, please call us at 630.969.7000 and ask to speak with a Human Resources representative.

title: Developer, Northeast/Mid-Atlantic
description: <p><em>Please Note: This Role is Remote to be worked on Central Standard Time Hours<br><br></em></p><p> <br><br></p><p><strong>How you will make an impact:<br><br></strong></p><p><strong>Primary duties include but are not limited to:<br><br></strong></p><ul><li>Provides trouble resolution on complex problems and leads implementations for system and network security technologies</li><li>Develops testing plans to ensure quality of implementation</li><li>Coordinates and prepares the reporting of data security events and incidents</li><li>Provides system and network architecture support for information and network security technologies</li><li>Provides technical support to business and technology associates in risk assessments and implementation of appropriate information security procedures, standards and technologies</li><li>Represents major upgrades and reconfigurations in change control</li><li>Design &amp; analyze mix of vendor services meeting business and information security requirements</li><li>Maintains relationship with key vendors/strategic partners within organization</li><li>Determine and perform complex configuration changes to meet business and information security requirements</li><li>Perform capacity analysis</li><li>Recommend and implement capacity increases</li><li>Serve as the technical escalation for results of preventative maintenance routines</li><li>Supervise preventative maintenance</li><li>Represents infrastructure security support in significant projects and performs the most complex operations and administration tasks</li><li>Respond to level 3 &amp; 4 change and problem requests without supervision</li><li>Lead level 1 &amp; 2 incident recoveries and root cause analysis. </li></ul><p> <br><br></p><p><strong>Qualifications:<br><br></strong></p><ul><li>Requires a BA/BS degree in Information Technology and a minimum of 3 years experience in a support and operations, or design and engineering role in any of the following areas: Access management or network security technologies, servers, networks, network communications, application security, cyber security (or)</li><li>Any combination of education and experience, which would provide an equivalent background. </li></ul><p> <br><br></p><p><strong>Preferred Skills, Capabilities and Experiences:<br><br></strong></p><ul><li>Current working experience on application security vulnerabilities remediation for .NET &amp; Java stack </li><li>Current working experience in using Static scan tools and Dynamic scan tools like Checkmarx, prisma or Qualys</li><li>Exceptional experience in encountering and understanding of the security best practices in every step of the software development lifecycle (SDLC)</li><li>Coordination with various cross functional teams on remediating application security findings that comes out pen test, Qualys, Prisma etc.</li><li>Knowledge of adhering to secure coding principles and aid in coding/testing the application against security risks/parameters before release</li><li>Using app security scan tools and also a good understanding of remediation steps</li><li>Ample understanding of security protocols for web interfaces</li><li>Current and/or prior experience with enabling and recommending developers on possible remediation efforts.</li><li>Technical security certifications (e.g. Systems Security Certified Practitioner)</li><li>Experience providing top-tier support for Application Security and, two or more of the information security technology areas:1) Access Control, 2) Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery Planning, 3) Cryptography, 4) Information Security and Risk Management 5) Legal, Regulations, 6) Compliance and Investigations, 7) Operations Security, 8) Physical (Environmental) Security, 9) Security Architecture and Design, 10) Telecommunications and Network Security.</li></ul><p> <br><br></p><p> <br><br><br></p><p><strong>Be part of an Extraordinary Team<br><br></strong></p><br><p>Elevance Health is a health company dedicated to improving lives and communities - and making healthcare simpler. A Fortune 20 company with a longstanding history in the healthcare industry, we are looking for leaders at all levels of the organization who are passionate about making an impact on our members and the communities we serve. You will thrive in a complex and collaborative environment where you take action and ownership to solve problems and lead change. Do you want to be part of a larger purpose and an evolving, high-performance culture that empowers you to make an impact?<br><br></p><br><p>We offer a range of market-competitive total rewards that include merit increases, paid holidays, Paid Time Off, and incentive bonus programs (unless covered by a collective bargaining agreement), medical, dental, vision, short and long term disability benefits, 401(k) +match, stock purchase plan, life insurance, wellness programs and financial education resources, to name a few.<br><br></p><br><p>The health of our associates and communities is a top priority for Elevance Health. We require all new candidates in certain patient/member-facing roles to become vaccinated against COVID-19. If you are not vaccinated, your offer will be rescinded unless you provide - and Elevance Health approves - a valid religious or medical explanation as to why you are not able to get vaccinated that Elevance Health is able to reasonably accommodate. Elevance Health will also follow all relevant federal, state and local laws.<br><br></p><br><p>Elevance Health has been named as a Fortune Great Place To Work in 2022, has been ranked for five years running as one of the 2023 World's Most Admired Companies by Fortune magazine, and is a growing Top 20 Fortune 500 Company. To learn more about our company and apply, please visit us at careers.ElevanceHealth.com. Elevance Health is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, citizenship status, color, creed, disability, ethnicity, genetic information, gender (including gender identity and gender expression), marital status, national origin, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, veteran status or any other status or condition protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws. Applicants who require accommodation to participate in the job application process may contact ability@icareerhelp.com for assistance.<br><br></p>

title: Qliksense Developer
description: *We are unable to sponsor for this permanent Full time role*<p><br></p>*Position is bonus eligible*<p><br></p>Prestigious Global Firm is currently seeking an Identity and Access Management Engineer with SailPoint experience. Candidate will be integrating internal applications with SailPoint using OAuth methodologies and custom scopes, coordinating directly with application development teams and enterprise architecture. Team Members collaborate daily for IAM System design and implementation, as well as assist with operational support in Identity and Access related functions.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Administration and configuration of our IAM products and processes with an emphasis on SailPoint Identity products.</li><li>Developing custom integration, workflows and rules between tools using Agile methodologies.</li><li>Planning, implementation, enforcement and review of security policies, procedures, and controls specific to Identity Access Management.</li><li>Processing access requests and issue tickets for internal and external customers</li><li>Leading troubleshooting and resolution of system issues that might contribute to enterprise Production problems.</li><li>Managing project work through all phases (design, build, test, cutover).</li><li>Report on controls, evidence gathering and control execution.</li><li>Work collaboratively across IT and Business departments to implement technical solutions</li><li>Under limited direction from management, monitor, evaluate and maintain systems and procedures to enforce best practices for user access authorization and control.</li><li>Research, recommend, and implement changes to procedures and systems to enhance systems security.</li><li>Assist in communicating security policies and procedures to users.</li><li>Assist internal and external customers with multi-platform security access issues and requests.</li><li>Assist in identifying or developing tools or methods to track and monitor risk</li><li>Support management with special projects and other duties as assigned</li><li>Report on controls, evidence gathering and control execution.</li><li>Work collaboratively across IT and Business departments to implement technical solutions</li><li>Under limited direction from management, monitor, evaluate and maintain systems and procedures to enforce best practices for user access authorization and control.</li><li>Research, recommend, and implement changes to procedures and systems to enhance systems security.</li><li>Assist in communicating security policies and procedures to users.</li><li>Assist internal and external customers with multi-platform security access issues and requests.</li><li>Assist in identifying or developing tools or methods to track and monitor risk</li><li>Support management with special projects and other duties as assigned.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Qualifications</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Microsoft Active Directory and LDAP</li><li>Experience working in and developing solutions for a highly regulated environment or organization that leverages a security framework (such as NIST, COBIT, etc).</li><li>Experience supporting the ForgeRock Identity Platform including Identity Gateway, Access Manager, and Directory Server.</li><li>Experience with Multi-Factor authentication protocols and systems (Entrust, Duo, or similar).</li><li>Experience with Single-Sign on protocols (OIDC, OAuth2.0, SAML, SWA, etc) and systems (Okta, Ping, Siteminder, or similar).</li><li>Development experience: Java, Javascript, Groovy</li><li>Development experience: Python and Shell Scripting</li><li>Solid understanding of Encryption and Network protocols (SSL, IPV4, HTTP)</li><li>Basic knowledge of Linux operating system administration.</li><li>Basic knowledge of Windows server and desktop operating systems</li><li>Basic knowledge of Amazon Web Services (AWS)</li><li>Basic knowledge of Controls, Risk Ranking/mapping, Remediation items and general IT audit</li><li>Preferred (nice to have)</li><li>Sailpoint Identity IQ administration or experience</li><li>E-GRC/Archer</li><li>ServiceNow</li><li>Mainframe architecture</li><li>CA-ACF2 Mainframe access control facilities</li><li>Directory services, LDAP, and their inherent security (Active Directory, CA Directory).</li><li>Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or other related field, or equivalent experience </li><li>7+ Years Identity Access Management (IAM) experience preferred</li><li>Hands-on IT or security operations experience</li><li>Industry recognized certifications (CISSP, ITIL, etc)</li></ul>

title: Project Manager- FBusiness Analyst
description: Position Overview <br><br>Our client is looking to bring in an End Point Security Engineer to assist them with their migration to Crowdstrike. They are seeking an individual who has performed a similar migration in the past and how is comfortable being hands-on and also working with business stakeholders and leadership.<br><br> Top Skills' Details <br><ul><li> Knowledge on optimizing and enhancing a Endpoint Security program post implementation with Crowdstrike (Other nice to haves McAfee Endpoint Security (Solidcore for change monitoring), SentinelOne]</li><li> O365 Security experience (implementing Microsoft Information Protection, securing Azure AD)</li><li> Experience with EPO managing BitLocker and Firewall modules</li><li> Understanding of various ways to secure legacy operating systems that cannot be modernized</li><li>Beyond Trust is a plus as they are integrating it into their environment<br><br></li></ul> Description <br><br>Primary focus is on the operational management, engineering and support of Endpoint Security products within their environment.<br><br>The successful individual will assist with reviewing existing &amp; new Endpoint Security products, policies, controls and processes to help strengthen and optimize current Endpoint Security capabilities, as well as identifying any gaps or technical solutions to further enhance the team's effectiveness and alignment with operational best practices.<br><br> Additional Areas Of Responsibility Include <br><ul><li> Securing Endpoint Protection across an organization including legacy operating systems (ie. Windows 2003)</li><li> Understanding of security parameters within Windows/ Linux and ways to secure these through Crowdstrike</li><li> Experience working with MSSP and managing the relationship as it pertains to Endpoint Protection</li><li> O365 Security (implementing Microsoft Information Protection, securing the environment within Azure AD)</li><li> Knowledge of BeyondTrust and migration from McAfee</li><li> Own the engineering and maintenance for Crowdstrike, Microsoft Information Protection, SentinelOne, and McAfee Solidcore for whitelisting</li><li> Work with Security Operations team to understand Endpoint alerts needed, and ways to continuously make this more effective for their day to day operations</li><li> Collaboration with technology and business partners across functions/processes to ensure product currency, alignment, understanding and ongoing communication on product upgrades, policy changes or new deployments</li><li> Make recommendations and assist in the implementation of changes to strengthen processes, procedures and compliance resulting in enhanced information security, service continuity or reduced IT risk.<br><br></li></ul> Required Skills <br><br>Significant experience (+5 years) and demonstrated expertise working in the fields Infrastructure Security and Endpoint Security.<br><br>Specific knowledge related to Endpoint Security products and required skill sets including:<br><ul><li> Anti-virus</li><li> Endpoint protection on legacy operating systems</li><li> Host Based Intrusion Prevention</li><li> Next generation endpoint protection and advanced threat detection tools</li><li> Real time endpoint data collection and investigation tools</li><li> Infrastructure maintenance including application and database servers</li><li> VB Scripting/Automation</li><li> Microsoft SQL query language<br><br></li></ul>Good knowledge about current security industry solutions, best practices, developments and trends.<br><br> About TEKsystems <br><br>We're partners in transformation. We help clients activate ideas and solutions to take advantage of a new world of opportunity. We are a team of 80,000 strong, working with over 6,000 clients, including 80% of the Fortune 500, across North America, Europe and Asia. As an industry leader in Full-Stack Technology Services, Talent Services, and real-world application, we work with progressive leaders to drive change. That's the power of true partnership. TEKsystems is an Allegis Group company.<br><br>The company is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all applications without regards to race, sex, age, color, religion, national origin, veteran status, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information or any characteristic protected by law.

title: Infrastructure Engineer (SharePoint)
description: <strong>Position Title:</strong><em> </em> Edge Data Center Engineering – Implementation I (P3)<br><br><strong><u>Company Summary<br><br></u></strong>Crown Castle is the nation’s largest provider of shared communications infrastructure: towers, small cells and fiber. It all works together to meet unprecedented demand—connecting people and communities and transforming the way we do business. Whenever you make a call, track a workout or stream music and videos, we’re the ones providing the communications infrastructure that makes it all possible. From 5G and the internet of things to drones, autonomous vehicles and AR/VR, we enable the technologies that help people stay safe, connected and ready for the future. Crown Castle is publicly traded on the S&amp;P 500, and one of the largest Real Estate Investment Trusts in the US, with an enterprise value of ~$100B.<br><br>We offer a total benefits package and professional growth development for teammates in any stage of their career. Along with caring for our teammates, we’re an active member in the communities where we live, work and do business. We have a responsibility to give back, which we do through our Connected by Good program. Giving back allows us to improve public spaces where people connect, promote public safety and advance access to education and technology.<br><br><strong><u>Role<br><br></u></strong>In the role of an Edge Data Center Engineer-Implementation I, you will be part of a forward-thinking Edge Engineering Team. You will be responsible for planning, maintaining, and engineering the installation of network equipment within Crown Castle Facilities and POP locations. This will include new buildouts supporting our colocation customers within our own Data Centers. You will create detailed installation specifications and drawings associated with each project that falls under your responsibility. The Edge DC Engineering-Implementation team will work with various departments to implement and complete projects within a specified period and within budget.<br><br><strong><u>Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li>Engineer and maintain critical POP infrastructure &amp; DC power plants</li><li>Project Management &amp; Implementation </li><li> Engineer Edge spatial layout designs </li><li> Create Purchase Orders, Material Requests, and Logistics</li><li>Create Change Management MOPS and Manage to Completion </li><li>Vendor management </li><li> Plan annual and project budgetary requirements<br></li></ul><strong>Expectations<br></strong><ul><li>Collaborative work done in a way that balances educated decision making with measured speed of implementation</li><li> Ability to continuously prioritize long-term plans with short-term urgent response needs. </li><li>Ability to influence conversations and work through building of relationships, thoughtful framing of issues, and building influence through excellent work. </li><li> Strong written and verbal communication skills with an ability to present complex information in a clear and simple format. </li><li>Proficient with Microsoft Suite and network computer skills. <br></li></ul><strong>Education/Certifications</strong> <br><ul><li>Associate degree or equivalent work experience </li><li>4+ years of experience in datacenter edge infrastructure<br></li></ul><strong><u>Experience/Minimum Requirements<br></u></strong><ul><li>Knowledge of AC/DC power including DC rectifiers, BDFB and power cable sizing </li><li>Knowledge of Telcordia installation standards </li><li>Familiarity with standard drawing; floor, rack, one-line, construction drawings </li><li>Knowledge of creating detail installation packages for network equipment, customer colocation and superstructure </li><li> Knowledge of network design and capacity planning<br></li></ul><strong>Organizational Relationship</strong> <br><br><strong>Reports to:</strong> Manager, Edge Data Center Engineering &amp; Implementation<br><br> <br><br><strong><u>Title(s) Of Direct Reports (if Applicable)<br><br></u></strong> <br><br><strong>Working Conditions:</strong> This role falls into our hybrid work model working in your assigned office approximately 60% of the time (3 days per week) and where you do your best work 40% (2 days per week). There is an expectation of collaboration with teammates and stakeholders for moments that matter that will require travel.<br><br><strong>Additional Information</strong>: N/A

title: Engineer II, Test Engineer
description: Wabtec Corporation is a leading global provider of equipment, systems, digital solutions and value-added services for freight and transit rail. Drawing on nearly four centuries of collective experience across Wabtec, GE Transportation and Faiveley Transport, the company has unmatched digital expertise, technological innovation, and world-class manufacturing and services, enabling the digital-rail-and-transit ecosystems. Wabtec is focused on performance that drives progress, creating transportation solutions that move and improve the world. Wabtec has approximately 27,000 employees in facilities throughout the world. Visit the company’s new website at: http://www.WabtecCorp.com.<p><br></p>It’s not just about your career… or your job title…it’s about who you are and the impact you are going to make on the world. Do you want to go into uncharted waters…do things that haven’t been done to make yours and someone else's life better? Wabtec has been doing that for decades and we will continue to do so! Through our people, leadership development, services, technology and scale, Wabtec delivers better outcomes for global customers by speaking the language of industry.<p><br></p><em><strong>Summary: </strong></em><p><br></p>It’s not just about your career or your job title. It’s about who you are and the impact you are going to make on the world. Do you want to do things that haven’t been done to make your life and someone else’s life better? Wabtec has been doing that for decades and we will continue to do so! Through our people, leadership development, services, technology and scale. This position will be working hands-on within an AWS Cloud technical domain. You will work within a multi-cloud infrastructure environment on highly complex projects, as a key member of the Platform team across the organization.<p><br></p><strong><em>Duties and Responsibilities:</em></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Review and develop architectural requirements and communicate them within the product portfolio or team</li><li>Advocate for a “cloud smart” enterprise environment where we optimize design for both on-premise and cloud use cases</li><li>Contribute to the development of infrastructure as code with integrated testing and deployment pipelines</li><li>Design and deploy standardized solutions with end to end automation for secure and regulatory compliant application environments</li><li>Enable multi-cloud solutions with AWS and Azure clouds using standard tools and processes for best fit applications deployments</li><li>Participate in the research and evaluation of emerging technology, industry and market trends to assist in project development and operational support</li><li>Engage with internal consumers of the cloud infrastructure to enable cloud adoption, hybrid solutions and full application migrations<br></li></ul><p><br></p><em><strong>Minimum Qualifications:</strong></em><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or "STEM" majors (Science, Technology, Engineering and Math) or 3+ years of AWS enterprise build experience</li><li>Minimum 5 years’ experience in infrastructure architecture or relevant discipline</li><li>Direct experience with administration, building, and/or supporting AWS</li><li>AWS Certification<br></li></ul><p><br></p><strong><em>Knowledge, Skills and Abilities:<br></em></strong><ul><li>Enterprise-scale experience with cloud and hybrid infrastructures, architecture designs, migrations, and technology management</li><li>Broad hands-on experience across AWS services, with deeper expertise in the following areas/services:</li><ul><li>IAM administration and policy writing (with a strong understanding of The Principle of Least Privilege)</li><li>AWS Organizations for a large multi-account corporate environment</li><li>Managing guardrails for AWS Organization Units with SCP</li><li>Strong understanding of VPC network concepts such as subnets, routing, name services, security groups, etc.<br></li></ul><li>Hands-on experience with Infrastructure as Code (Terraform), version control systems (Git), and CICD pipelines (GitLab) for full lifecycle management of AWS infrastructure &amp; guardrails.</li><li>Experience and understanding of large-scale application portfolios including migration of on-premise workloads to the cloud</li><li>Deep domain expertise of cloud infrastructure solutions focusing on IaaS, business continuity, disaster recovery, security, operations excellence and standardization</li><li>One or more of the following languages: HCL, JSON, Python, Ruby, PowerShell, Bash, Node.js</li><li>Demonstrate knowledge of business' structure (P&amp;Ls) and the interplay of functions to support business goals</li><li>Applies values, business strategy, policies, precedent, and experience to make complex decisions with uncertain consequences</li><li>Challenges conventional thinking and traditional ways of operating and invites stakeholders to identify issues and opportunities<br></li></ul><p><br></p><strong><em>Physical Demands:</em></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Requires daily interaction with Team members on meeting calls or in person</li><li>Requires sitting or standing in cubical and meeting rooms</li><li>Employee is regularly required to look at computer screen<br></li></ul><p><br></p><strong><em>Work Environment: </em></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>The employee will normally work in a temperature-controlled office environment, with frequent exposure to electronic office equipment. Any disagreeable conditions are generally absent<br></li></ul><p><br></p>Relocation Assistance not provided<p><br></p>Wabtec Corporation is committed to taking on the world’s toughest challenges. In order to fulfill that commitment we rely on a culture of leadership, diversity and inclusiveness. We aim to employ the world’s brightest minds to help us create a limitless source of ideas and opportunities. We believe in hiring talented people of varied backgrounds, experiences and styles…people like you! Wabtec Corporation is committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or expression, or protected Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.

title: Linux Engineer / Middleware on W2 (Chicago, IL)
description: <p><strong>&nbsp;</strong></p><p><strong>Title: Mainframe/Cobol developer</strong></p><p><strong>Location: Chicago, IL (Onsite/Hybrid)---NO REMOTE</strong></p><p><strong>Duration:6+ Months</strong></p><p><strong>Visa: USC or GC</strong></p><p><strong>Job Description:</strong></p><p>This position is responsible supporting enhancements and new capabilities to an existing, critical, mainframe based business application within Finance &amp; Actuarial applications space. As a systems analyst, it is required you bring strong experience of performing Systems Analysis for various projects and build a backlog of systems requirements that can be assigned to various developers. You are for also responsible for ensuring reviews of the requirements, designs, code and help plan SIT and UAT testing as well as releases. You will be working closely with the business team comprising of business analysts, business owners, QA team as well as IT team members like Applications Architects, Developers, product and project managers and other team members.</p><p><strong>Required Job Qualifications</strong></p><p>*10+ years experience</p><p>* Very strong in Mainframe/COBOL/Batch</p><p>* Very strong database skills: DB2, SQL DB</p><p>* Very Strong SQL experience</p><p>* Experience in ETL/Talend or any other ETL tool</p><p>* Experience in any one of the scripting Languages - BASH /SHELL</p><p>* SDLC Methodology - Agile / Scrum / Iterative Development</p><p>*Develop detailed technical specifications and designs for projects / system enhancements.</p><p>*Develop &amp; document standard operating procedures for transition system support into routine operations.</p><p>*Support operations by addressing operational, production and ad-hoc requests</p><p>*Production and Test problem determination and debugging</p><p>*Review, guide, troubleshoot and resolve contentious issues escalated during implementation and support the scrum team.</p><p><strong>Preferred Job Qualifications:</strong></p><p>*Exposure to data integration, data mapping &amp; transformation needs with enterprise applications.</p><p>*Experience in Health care and/or financial business applications is a plus</p><p>*Support infrastructure first build with Solution Architects and Infrastructure Engineers.</p><p>*Work with architecture, application services, infrastructure, release management and other relevant stakeholders to enable a smooth deployment.</p><p>*Ability to thrive in a fast-paced work environment and work effectively through change.</p><p>* Problem solving and analytical thinking</p><p>*Strong oral/written communication skills</p><p><br></p><p><strong>Thanks &amp; Regards</strong></p><p><strong>Shivam Mishra</strong></p><p><strong>Technical Recruiter</strong></p><p><strong>Mob</strong><span>:9727368307</span></p><p><strong>E-Mail</strong><span>:Shivam.mishra@sibitalent.com</span></p><p><strong>Website</strong><span>:&nbsp;</span>www.sibitalent.com<u>&nbsp;</u></p><p><strong>Office</strong><span> :– </span><strong><u>101 E. Park Blvd., Suite 600, Plano, TX -75074</u></strong></p>

title: System Engineer
description: <strong><u>Description<br><br></u></strong><strong>Company: </strong>Oak Street Health<br><br><strong>Title:</strong> Engineer II - Test Engineer SF<br><br><strong>Location: </strong>Chicago/Remote<br><br><strong><u>Role Description<br><br></u></strong>We are currently looking for a talented, experienced Test Engineer with good communication skills and a passion for testing Salesforce product for our growing organization. The Test Engineer will be responsible for managing all functional and automated testing processes in support of Salesforce development efforts at Oak Street Health. From design to implementation, you will partner with our stellar engineering, product, and design teams in a fast-paced, agile environment to transform ideas into a reality. Utilizing modern methodologies and open source tools, you will be empowered to push the boundaries of Test Engineering as we seek to deliver Salesforce that will directly and immediately impact the experience of our teams and our patients. This role will handle the creation of all test scripts, the documentation of all test cases and identification of bugs across Salesforce development and reporting. The Test Engineer will manage the identification of bugs and assist in the prioritization of bug fixes<br><br>There is no better time to join our rapidly growing team at Oak Street Health. We can’t think of a mission any more motivating; and, with your help, we can drive change in healthcare for the patients that need us most.<br><br><strong><u>Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li>Contribute in all aspects of SDLC process( SCRUM, Design, Code, Test, Deploy &amp; Maintain)</li><li>Collaborate with Salesforce Product, UX and Engineering teams</li><li>Review and analyze business and system requirements / specifications</li><li>Design test plans, scenarios, scripts, and procedures</li><li>Execute test cases (manual or automated) and log test results</li><li>Work with the development and product team to correct bugs / errors and identify requirement updates / clarifications</li><li>Contribute to code review process to improve code quality</li><li>Develop and maintain automation frameworks and solutions for Salesforce product and APIs </li><li>Automate tests to facilitate regression testing</li><li>Collaborate with engineering to build solutions on testing and automation to achieve SecDevOps best practices</li><li>Other duties as assigned. <br></li></ul><strong>What are we looking for?<br><br></strong><strong><u>We’re Looking For a Motivated Test Engineer With<br></u></strong><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree in CS or equivalent work experience</li><li>3+ years experience in automation testing development including Salesforce test automation</li><li>Proficiency with one or more of the following programming languages/frameworks - .NET/JAVA, Java Script, Python</li><li>3+ years experience with testing tools like Selenium, SOAP UI, Ready API, open source tools</li><li>2+ years experience with databases and SQL </li><li>Proficiency with Test Case Preparation and Execution.</li><li>Sound knowledge of QA methodology and Agile frameworks</li><li>Strong communication skills and a keen eye for details</li><li>Experience working in an Agile/Devops environment</li><li>Experience working with source code and CI tools and processes </li><li>Familiarity with Azure DevOps and gRPC - Preferred</li><li>US work authorization</li><li>Someone who embodies being “Oaky”<br></li></ul><strong>What does being “Oaky” look like?<br></strong><ul><li>Radiating positive energy</li><li>Assuming good intentions</li><li>Creating an unmatched patient experience</li><li>Driving clinical excellence</li><li>Taking ownership and delivering results</li><li>Being relentlessly determined<br></li></ul><strong><u>Why Oak Street Health?<br><br></u></strong>Oak Street Health is on a mission to “Rebuild healthcare as it should be'', providing personalized primary care for older adults on Medicare, with the goal of keeping patients healthy and living life to the fullest. Our innovative care model is centered right in our patient’s communities, and focused on the quality of care over volume of services. We’re an organization on the move! With over 150 locations and an ambitious growth trajectory, Oak Street Health is attracting and cultivating team members who embody “Oaky” values and passion for our mission.<br><br><strong><u>Oak Street Health Benefits<br></u></strong><ul><li>Mission-focused career impacting change and measurably improving health outcomes for medicare patients</li><li>Paid vacation, sick time, and investment/retirement 401K match options</li><li>Health insurance, vision, and dental benefits</li><li>Opportunities for leadership development and continuing education stipends</li><li>New centers and flexible work environments</li><li>Opportunities for high levels of responsibility and rapid advancement<br></li></ul>Oak Street Health is an equal opportunity employer. We embrace diversity and encourage all interested readers to apply.<br><br>Learn more at <u>www.oakstreethealth.com/diversity-equity-and-inclusion-at-oak-street-health</u>

Utilizing modern methodologies and open source tools, you will be empowered to push the boundaries of Test Engineering as we seek to deliver Salesforce that will directly and immediately impact the experience of our teams and our patients. This role will handle the creation of all test scripts, the documentation of all test cases and identification of bugs across Salesforce development and reporting. The Test Engineer will manage the identification of bugs and assist in the prioritization of bug fixes<br><br>There is no better time to join our rapidly growing team at Oak Street Health. We can’t think of a mission any more motivating; and, with your help, we can drive change in healthcare for the patients that need us most.<br><br><strong><u>Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li>Contribute in all aspects of SDLC process( SCRUM, Design, Code, Test, Deploy &amp; Maintain)</li><li>Collaborate with Salesforce Product, UX and Engineering teams</li><li>Review and analyze business and system requirements / specifications</li><li>Design test plans, scenarios, scripts, and procedures</li><li>Execute test cases (manual or automated) and log test results</li><li>Work with the development and product team to correct bugs / errors and identify requirement updates / clarifications</li><li>Contribute to code review process to improve code quality</li><li>Develop and maintain automation frameworks and solutions for Salesforce product and APIs </li><li>Automate tests to facilitate regression testing</li><li>Collaborate with engineering to build solutions on testing and automation to achieve SecDevOps best practices</li><li>Other duties as assigned. <br></li></ul><strong>What are we looking for?<br><br></strong><strong><u>We’re Looking For a Motivated Test Engineer With<br></u></strong><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree in CS or equivalent work experience</li><li>3+ years experience in automation testing development including Salesforce test automation</li><li>Proficiency with one or more of the following programming languages/frameworks - .NET/JAVA, Java Script, Python</li><li>3+ years experience with testing tools like Selenium, SOAP UI, Ready API, open source tools</li><li>2+ years experience with databases and SQL </li><li>Proficiency with Test Case Preparation and Execution.</li><li>Sound knowledge of QA methodology and Agile frameworks</li><li>Strong communication skills and a keen eye for details</li><li>Experience working in an Agile/Devops environment</li><li>Experience working with source code and CI tools and processes </li><li>Familiarity with Azure DevOps and gRPC - Preferred</li><li>US work authorization</li><li>Someone who embodies being “Oaky”<br></li></ul><strong>What does being “Oaky” look like?<br></strong><ul><li>Radiating positive energy</li><li>Assuming good intentions</li><li>Creating an unmatched patient experience</li><li>Driving clinical excellence</li><li>Taking ownership and delivering results</li><li>Being relentlessly determined<br></li></ul><strong><u>Why Oak Street Health?<br><br></u></strong>Oak Street Health is on a mission to “Rebuild healthcare as it should be'', providing personalized primary care for older adults on Medicare, with the goal of keeping patients healthy and living life to the fullest. Our innovative care model is centered right in our patient’s communities, and focused on the quality of care over volume of services. We’re an organization on the move! With over 150 locations and an ambitious growth trajectory, Oak Street Health is attracting and cultivating team members who embody “Oaky” values and passion for our mission.<br><br><strong><u>Oak Street Health Benefits<br></u></strong><ul><li>Mission-focused career impacting change and measurably improving health outcomes for medicare patients</li><li>Paid vacation, sick time, and investment/retirement 401K match options</li><li>Health insurance, vision, and dental benefits</li><li>Opportunities for leadership development and continuing education stipends</li><li>New centers and flexible work environments</li><li>Opportunities for high levels of responsibility and rapid advancement<br></li></ul>Oak Street Health is an equal opportunity employer. We embrace diversity and encourage all interested readers to apply.<br><br>Learn more at <u>www.oakstreethealth.com/diversity-equity-and-inclusion-at-oak-street-health</u>

title: Frontend Web Developer (Remote)
description: <strong>Description</strong><p><br></p>Sr Quant Risk Development Associate is responsible for developing/implementing Risk/Pricing Models that evaluate counterparty exposures to the Clearing House and their C++ implementation and testing for Windows and Linux. The models include pricing asset classes constituting CME portfolios, models related to Value-at-Risk, Liquidity, Regulatory Capital, and compliant with Stress Testing and other model validation techniques. The role implies developing tools for Portfolio Analytics and particularly Sensitivities, Margin Coverage, Risk Scenario generation, Liquidity charges, and reports.This role would fit someone with hands on experience risk model implementation and/or pricing models in IRS, FX, CDS, Swaptions, or Futures/Commodities and participation in C ++ projects.<p><br></p>Principal Accountabilities:<p><br></p><ul><li> Code development of new quantitative risk models within the CME C++ production risk library (based on mathematical specifications and research code)</li><li> Writing unit and functional test cases and obtaining test data from systems or other groups</li><li> Work with the QA teams to ensure correctness not only within the risk library itself but also the integration into the wider system infrastructure (e.g. data integrity, correct usage)</li><li> Work with IT teams to help bring the code into production</li><li> Agreeing on time lines, milestones, interfaces, required data, format, and providing documentation and usage assistance</li><li> Lead or manage junior quantitative developers and mentor/develop skills among junior quant developers</li><li> Responsible for code reviews, design discussions and documentation</li><li> Collaborate with offshore development teams and coordinate projects to guarantee a timely delivery</li></ul><p><br></p>Skills and Software Requirements:<p><br></p><ul><li> Experience in developing finance related software with an emphasis on (numerical) algorithms (e.g. pricing or calibration)</li><li> Possession of good analytical, mathematical, and problem solving skills, with good quantitative skills being a plus</li><li> Ability to read and understand mathematical and algorithmic specifications</li><li> Good knowledge of C++ with strong working knowledge in STL and 4 + years of experience</li><li> Basic knowledge of Java and/or C#</li><li> Working knowledge of versioning systems (e.g. git) and development environments (e.g. Visual Studio, Eclipse)</li><li> System experience with Linux/Unix environments, databases, Latex documentation system is a plus</li><li> Ability lead or mentor junior developers (onshore and offshore) and to collaborate with other teams (onshore and offshore)</li><li> Good presentation/writing skills on code documentation, white papers, etc. as well as strong oral and written communication skills</li></ul><p><br></p>#dice<p><br></p>CME Group: Where Futures Are Made<p><br></p>CME Group ( is the world's leading derivatives marketplace. But who we are goes deeper than that. Here, you can impact markets worldwide. Transform industries. And build a career shaping tomorrow. We invest in your success and you own it, all while working alongside a team of leading experts who inspire you in ways big and small. Problem solvers, difference makers, trailblazers. Those are our people. And we're looking for more.<p><br></p>

title: Systems Engineer, Locomotive Repowers
description: <strong>Top Growing Global Markets Prop Trading Shop - Hiring Infrastructure/Systems Engineers</strong><p><br></p>This Jobot Job is hosted by: Ryan Kilroy<p><br></p>Are you a fit? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply Now" button and sending us your resume.<p><br></p>Salary: $100,000 - $175,000 per year<p><br></p><strong>A bit about us:</strong><p><br></p>Founded over 45 years ago- we are a privately held global markets proprietary trading firm with offices in Chicago, Caribbean, and Europe. We use next generation technology to capture opportunities around the world and manage risk in financial markets. Our mission is to bless others through the services we provide and through generous stewardship of the wealth we create.<p><br></p>We are a well-established and profitable business as a respected member of the global financial system for over 40 years, but also is like a startup because the potential of our group is at least one order of magnitude greater than what we are currently producing. We have an entrepreneurial culture and collaboratively develop our business with patience and discipline; we work hard, learn constantly, and relentlessly improve our expertise.<p><br></p><strong>Why join us?</strong><p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p>Ownership over our data center infrastructure, tasked with all aspects of keeping it up and operating in an optimal and reliable manner<p><br></p>Contacting third-party vendors about remote equipment installation and maintenance and then supervising those projects through completion<p><br></p>Performing hardware installation and troubleshooting existing hardware<p><br></p>Documenting both new and established procedures to establish and foster best practices firmwide<p><br></p>Cooperating with other engineers to provide stable and secure deployments of new infrastructure components<p><br></p>Working with network engineers to reliably upgrade and replace old network equipment<p><br></p>Developing an automated provisioning system and keeping the inventory system up to date<p><br></p>Troubleshooting software issues that might be related to hardware failures<p><br></p>Providing in-office hardware support<p><br></p>Working as part of an in-office team to collaborate directly with our experienced traders and technologists on brainstorming and implementing creative solutions to a wide range of problems<p><br></p><strong>Job Details</strong><p><br></p><strong>Requirements</strong><p><br></p>BA/BS/MS degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related experience<p><br></p>2+ years of experience in related field<p><br></p>Hands-on experience cabling, racking, and installing bare metal servers, network devices, and network cards<p><br></p>Experience with remote management tools for servers (iDrac, iLO)<p><br></p>Understanding of automated provisioning tools (PXE, Foreman) and ability to create installation files<p><br></p>Experience with Linux at the administration level (Debian, CentOS)<p><br></p>Working experience with Windows is a plus<p><br></p>Practical knowledge of inventory tools (Netbox)<p><br></p>Good understanding of monitoring tools (Icinga2, Grafana, ELK)<p><br></p>Experience with infrastructure management tools (Ansible, Puppet)<p><br></p>Good management skills with ticketing and documentation tools (Jira, Confluence)<p><br></p>Experience with scripting and automation (Python, Bash or other) is a plus<p><br></p>Experience in a low latency environment a strong plus, e.g., Solarflare, Onload, PTP<p><br></p><strong>Additional Requirements</strong><p><br></p>Flexibility to occasionally work outside of core business hours and on weekends.<p><br></p>Ability to travel and provide support to other regions occasionally as needed.<p><br></p>This position requires physical presence and is onsite (no remote work)<p><br></p>Interested in hearing more? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply Now" button. Infrastructure Engineer

title: Data Scientist
description: Job TitleRedis Developer<p><br></p>Relevant Experience<p><br></p>(in Yrs)4+<p><br></p>Technical/Functional Skills<p><br></p><ul><li>Design, develop and maintain Azure Redis Cache solutions for our enterprise applications.</li><li>Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand application requirements and provide optimal cache solutions.</li><li>Optimize Redis Cache performance to ensure the highest levels of availability and scalability.</li><li>Monitor Redis Cache instances and troubleshoot issues to ensure optimal performance and stability.</li><li>Develop scripts and tools to automate deployment, management, and monitoring of Redis Cache instances.</li><li>Stay up-to-date with emerging technologies and industry trends related to Redis Cache and NoSQL databases.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Experience RequiredMinimum 5-8 Years</u></strong><p><br></p>Roles &amp; Responsibilities<p><br></p><ul><li>Package management of application using docker builds using maven/gradle.</li><li>Externalizing dependencies on docker using persistent volume claims.</li><li>Management of trust store and keystores using docker.</li><li>Expose services hosted on K8S using ISTIO ingress.</li><li>Versioning of docker images and storing them in repository ( ACR).</li><li>Housekeeping of SNAPSHOTs and Release docker image</li></ul><p><br></p>EducationBachelors or Masters with Majors in Science, EE, IT, CS, ECE etc<p><br></p>Start date (dd-mmm-yy)01-Apr-2023<p><br></p>Duration of assignment (in Months)12+ Months<p><br></p>Work Location (State, City and Zip)Deerfield IL<p><br></p>Key words to search in resumeRedis, Cache

title: Application Security Engineer (Engineer III)
description: <strong>Open for "C2H" only.</strong><p><br></p>We are Wipro (NYSE: WIT), a rapidly expanding and leading global Information Technology, Consulting and Business Process Services company with over 225,000 employees worldwide, servicing clients in 175+ cities and 69 countries across 6 continents. For more information, please visit<p><br></p><strong>Role:</strong> Sysyem Engineer<p><br></p>Location-IL.<p><br></p><strong>Role Description:</strong><p><br></p>Performs Problem determination and resolution of mobile Equipment and Software problems through the effective use of available technical resources. Resolves Problems, including completing all related administrative duties. Resolves Customer's Equipment/Software mobility Problem tickets.<p><br></p>Below is the JD- Field Support Engineer<p><br></p><ul><li>The Field Support Engineer will be responsible for the installation, configuration, and troubleshooting of network infrastructure hardware and software. This position supports a broad range of IT hardware and software.</li><li>The selected professional will be responsible for working with end users about the issues related to physical workstations, including laptops, desktops, peripherals, network devices, among others. Individual should also be well versed about remote troubleshooting and remote desktop support, Physical hardware inventory etc.</li><li>In addition, they will also be responsible for serving in a client-facing role to carry out imaging and deploying desktop equipment, fielding onsite escalations from services desk, supervisor and customer.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Responsible for installing, maintaining and repairing company and multi-vendor systems which include hardware, software and networking products as well as operating systems.</li><li>Diagnose and resolve various hardware performance issues, make decisions when appropriate related to replacing existing user workstation equipment and carry out the entire product replacement process, including the removal of existing IT assets as well as the implementation of new IT assets.</li><li>Takes responsibility for potential or desired follow-up services or problem escalation.</li><li>Should contribute directly to the implementation of new company service solutions, or short projects as per the supervisor?s directives.</li><li>Manage all IT assets, including tagging in / out existing and new IT assets as they are rolled out to end users.</li><li>Ensure the best possible experience when setting up new user equipment, perform the necessary onsite testing to assure existing and / or new employees have access to equipment, applications, and various other technical solutions.</li><li>Friendly presence and helpful attitude; good interpersonal skills and ability to work well with others.</li><li>Good problem solving skills; ability to visualize a problem or situation and think abstractly to solve it.</li><li>Ability to handle constantly changing flow of traffic; remain productive during slow times, be able to multitask effectively during busy times, exercise patience and professionalism during stressful situations.</li><li>Dealing with hardware and application support queries and issues reported to the Field Services team</li><li>Take ownership and responsibility of an issues from start through to a successful resolution</li><li>Escalate issues and involve experts wherever required in order to resolve issues as quickly as possible</li><li>Ensures that supported customer accurately completes the approved work request with the date and time of submission</li><li>Develop sound understanding of IT operations and related applications and IT systems as well as business related processes and procedures</li><li>Develop technical knowledge of each system within company profile and specialized knowledge of certain nominated areas</li><li>Maintain adequate knowledge of operating systems and application software used to provide a high level of support</li><li>Maintains and consistently demonstrates a general knowledge of company guidelines, processes, practices and procedures</li><li>When the restoration is beyond the scope of the Service Desk Agent he/she will escalate the issue/problem to proper tier 2 and 3 support team members</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Requirements</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>5+ years of experience working in a field services support capacity, with specific experience in the configuration, implementation, and maintenance of IT assets (Laptops, Desktops, Peripherals), troubleshooting and resolving any and all technical issues which require onsite service support.</li><li>Knowledge and practical experience troubleshooting and supporting local area data networking (hardware/software/protocols and best practices).</li><li>Knowledge of Incident Management, Service Request management, DEPOT model etc.</li><li>Proficiency in Microsoft Desktop OS (domain environment), Desktop application related configurations, troubleshooting etc..</li><li>Knowledge of standard Microsoft Productivity Applications such as Microsoft Office and Outlook. Familiarity with all major web browsers including Google Chrome and Mozilla Firefox, EDGE and IE etc.</li><li>Working knowledge of Apple-MAC operating systems and devices configuration and troubleshooting</li><li>Working knowledge of ServiceNow ticketing tool.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Wipro is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer and makes all employment and employment-related decisions without regard to a person's race, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability, sexual orientation, or any other status protected by applicable law</strong><p><br></p>TIS Service Desk System Engineer

title: SailPoint Identity and Access Management Engineer
description: <strong><u>Job Description<br><br></u></strong>S&amp;C Electronics, a global leader for power reliability products is looking for a Software Design Engineer. Included in this position is the support of intelligent embedded software devices including microprocessor-based switch and fault interrupting controls. Candidates must have a strong background in design and development of embedded software on custom electronics.<br><br>This position is located in Chicago. In this position, you will report to the Senior Manager – Embedded Firmware.<br><br><strong>The work associated with this position includes, but is not limited to, the following:<br></strong><ul><li>Design embedded application firmware for microprocessor-based fault interrupting controls.</li><li>Develop embedded C/C++ firmware for low power designs, including hardware device drivers.</li><li>Develop and support PC-based engineer test tools as needed.</li><li>Create, execute, and automate Unit Tests.</li><li>Review and implement product requirements.</li><li>Participate in Agile scrum meetings and peer reviews of source code.</li><li>Investigate new technologies and create design documents as necessary.</li><li>Collaborate with hardware and test engineers to support verification and validation of products at the module level and system level. <br></li></ul><strong>To select this job as one of interest to you, at a minimum, you must have the following:<br></strong><ul><li>Being a team player is essential.</li><li>Excellent written and verbal communications skills.</li><li>Good interpersonal and leadership skills.</li><li>Continuous learner and self-starter.</li><li>BS degree in Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or equivalent.</li><li>Demonstrated working knowledge of programming principles in C/C++ and Python.</li><li>Embedded software development experience.</li><li>Experience with digital multimeters, oscilloscopes, and logic analyzers.</li><li>Experience working with and writing drivers for common peripherals and interconnects, such as GPIO, I2C, SPI, ADC, DAC, UART, DMA, flash memory.</li><li>Experience with configuration management/process tools: Jira, Confluence, Bitbucket/Git.</li><li>Experience with embedded Linux, Zephyr, or other real time operating systems is a plus.</li><li>Familiarity with real-time operation and low power microprocessor modes is a plus.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Relevant Experience Required<br></u></strong><ul><li>2-5 years of experience developing embedded C/C++ firmware applications and device drivers for low power designs. <br></li></ul><strong>MAJOR PHYSICAL DEMANDS<br></strong><ul><li>Standing: Occasional standing for work on complete control assemblies.</li><li>Lifting: Occasional lifting of controls and test equipment, less than 50 pounds.</li><li>Walking: Occasional walking throughout the facility.</li><li>Carrying: Occasional carrying of light objects.</li><li>Pushing: Infrequent pushing of objects, possibly related to rearrangement work.</li><li>Pulling: Infrequent pulling of objects, possibly related to rearrangement work.</li><li>Bending: Occasional bending during access to equipment.</li><li>Reaching: Infrequent reaching.</li><li>Handling: Frequent handling of parts or tools.</li><li>Environment: Frequent handling of parts or tools.<br></li></ul><strong>S &amp; C - TOP WORKPLACE<br></strong><ul><li>For 2019, S &amp; C Electric Company was named the 10th-best place to work among large employers in the Chicagoland area by The Chicago Tribune as part of the newspaper's prestigious annual Top Workplaces list.</li><li>For 2020, S &amp; C Electric was named as the 15th-Best Workplace in Chicago Tribune’s 11th Annual Report.</li><li>For 2021, S &amp; C Electric was named Among Top 2021 Workplaces in the United States by Top Workplaces USA, the nation’s most credible employer-recognition program.</li></ul>

title: Endpoint Security Engineer
description: Cognizant (NASDAQ: CTSH) is a leading provider of information technology, consulting, and business process outsourcing services, dedicated to helping the world's leading companies build stronger businesses. Headquartered in Teaneck, New Jersey (U.S.). Cognizant is a member of the NASDAQ-100, the S&amp;P 500, the Forbes Global 1000, and the Fortune 500 and we are among the top performing and<br><br>Practice - AIA - Artificial Intelligence and Analytics<br><ul><li>This role is not able to offer visa transfer or sponsorship now or in the future*<br></li></ul>About AI &amp; Analytics: Artificial intelligence (AI) and the data it collects and analyzes will soon sit at the core of all intelligent, human-centric businesses. By decoding customer needs, preferences, and behaviors, our clients can understand exactly what services, products, and experiences their consumers need. Within AI &amp; Analytics, we work to design the future—a future in which trial-and-error business decisions have been replaced by informed choices and data-supported strategies.<br><br>By applying AI and data science, we help leading companies to prototype, refine, validate, and scale their AI and analytics products and delivery models. Cognizant’s AIA practice takes insights that are buried in data, and provides businesses a clear way to transform how they source, interpret and consume their information. Our clients need flexible data structures and a streamlined data architecture that quickly turns data resources into informative, meaningful intelligence<br><br><strong><u>Roles &amp; Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li> Develop and maintain ETL solutions to fit business needs. ETL development require one or more of the skills Abinitio, AWS, Snowflake and Teradata</li><li> Work independently or with own team to innovate on and enhance development practices and processes.</li><li> Collaborate within the team to innovate on and enhance development practices and processes.</li><li> Responsible for delivery- Managing the data and analytics onsite team and offshore team from different geographic locations and guide the team to complete the project within the stipulated time.</li><li> Responsible for account management and own delivery responsibility of entire AIA team.</li><li> Work with modelers to understand requirements and align on capabilities that a deliver reusability and automation</li><li> Also, experience on :</li><li> Experience in Python, Teradata, Snowflake development or related development experience</li><li> Experience in automated software build &amp; deployment automation in distributed cloud environment such as AWS and other cloud platforms.</li><li> Experience developing and implementing automation capabilities and re-usable components</li><li> Experience working with code repositories such as Github, EME and competent in implementing versioning, branching, etc</li><li> Experience working with a variety of data platforms such as S3, Snowflake</li><li> Understanding of observability and how to achieve reliability in a service</li><li> Experience as part of an Agile engineering or development team<br></li></ul><strong><u>Salary And Other Compensation<br><br></u></strong>The annual salary for this position is between $[126k +] depending on experience and other qualifications of the successful candidate.<br><br>This position is also eligible for Cognizant’s discretionary annual incentive program, based on performance and subject to the terms of Cognizant’s applicable plans.<br><br><strong>Benefits</strong>: Cognizant offers the following benefits for this position, subject to applicable eligibility requirements:<br><ul><li> Medical/Dental/Vision/Life Insurance</li><li> Paid holidays plus Paid Time Off</li><li> 401(k) plan and contributions</li><li> Long-term/Short-term Disability</li><li> Paid Parental Leave<br></li></ul><strong>Disclaimer</strong>: The salary, other compensation, and benefits information is accurate as of the date of this posting. Cognizant reserves the right to modify this information at any time, subject to applicable law.<br><br><em>Cognizant is an Equal Opportunity Employer M/F/D/V. Cognizant is committed to ensuring that all current and prospective associates are afforded equal opportunities and treatment and a work environment free of harassment.<br><br></em><em>Cognizant is recognized as a Military Friendly Employer and is a coalition member of the Veteran Jobs Mission. Our Cognizant Veterans Network assists Veterans in building and growing a career at Cognizant that allows them to leverage the leadership, loyalty, integrity, and commitment to excellence instilled in them through participation in military service.<br><br></em># L1-AV1# CB#Ind123<br><br># Ab Initio developer # Snowflake # ETL Ab initio # Teradata#<br><br>Employee Status : Full Time Employee<br><br>Shift : Day Job<br><br>Travel : No<br><br>Job Posting : May 25 2023<br><br><strong><u>About Cognizant<br><br></u></strong>Cognizant (Nasdaq-100: CTSH) is one of the world's leading professional services companies, transforming clients' business, operating and technology models for the digital era. Our unique industry-based, consultative approach helps clients envision, build and run more innovative and efficient businesses. Headquartered in the U.S., Cognizant is ranked 185 on the Fortune 500 and is consistently listed among the most admired companies in the world. Learn how Cognizant helps clients lead with digital at www.cognizant.com or follow us @USJobsCognizant.<br><br>Applicants may be required to attend interviews in person or by video conference. In addition, candidates may be required to present their current state or government issued ID during each interview.<br><br>Cognizant is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected Veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.<br><br>If you have a disability that requires a reasonable accommodation to search for a job opening or submit an application, please email CareersNA2@cognizant.com with your request and contact information.

title: Edge Data Center Engineer - Implementation
description: <strong>Bee Data Technology is a Global Leader in Enterprise Application Development. We undertake both Product Development and enable our clients in several countries. With the backing of stable governance and defined processes, we excel in reaching our Goals effectively. We have 3 branches in the USA and deal with several market trending technologies with renowned clients:</strong><p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Assess the security posture of our systems, applications, and infrastructure and design and implement strategies for asset hardening.</li><li>Identify misconfigurations, and weaknesses in systems and apply appropriate security controls and countermeasures to mitigate risks.</li><li>Collaborate with system administrators, network engineers, and application developers to engineer and harden assets at all layers, including operating systems, cloud platforms, databases, and network devices.</li><li>Engineer and maintain security controls within the Microsoft 365 environment, including Azure Active Directory, Exchange Online, SharePoint, Intune and Teams.</li><li>Configure and enforce security policies, data loss prevention (DLP) measures, and threat protection mechanisms to safeguard our assets.</li><li>Stay informed about emerging security technologies and trends and provide recommendations for their adoption.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Software Requirements</strong>:<p><br></p><ul><li>Active Directory (Azure, On-prem)</li><li>AWS (Desirable)</li><li>M365</li><li>Windows Servers (2016 and newer)</li><li>Linux (Desirable)</li><li>Containers (Desirable)</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Experience Required</strong>:<p><br></p><ul><li>5 years of experience as a Security Engineer or in a similar role, with a demonstrated background in asset hardening and Microsoft 365 security.</li><li>Scripting/automation experience such as Python and PowerShell</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Education Requirements:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>4-year college degree in Information Technology or equivalent experience</li><li>Security certifications (CISSP, GSEC, MS—500, MS-700, CCSP, etc.) preferred</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Knowledge, Skills, abilities, and behaviors required</strong>:<p><br></p><ul><li>Ability to work both independently and with a team while managing workload with minimal supervision.</li><li>Strong knowledge of servers, networking, cloud technologies, and related security considerations.</li><li>Familiarity with security principles, frameworks, and compliance standards (e.g., NIST, CIS)</li><li>Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to analyze complex technical issues.</li><li>Strong communication and collaboration skills to work effectively with cross-functional teams.</li><li>Ability to travel and collaborate in the downtown Chicago office two days a week.</li></ul>
