title: Software Prototype Developer [Remote]
description: Management Consulting has been the foundation of Point B’s employee-owned company for 25+ years. Our collaborative, forward looking leadership approach ensures our customers are on the right path to success.<p><br></p>Point B is a consulting company dedicated to helping organizations with critical initiatives in the areas of customer engagement, growth investments, workforce experience and operations excellence. Our diverse set of experts spans 13 U.S. locations, with international reach via our partnership with Nextcontinent. We’ve helped global organizations of all stages and sizes achieve sustainable success by focusing on the humans at the center of change.<p><br></p>Point B has been consistently recognized as one of the best places to work by Fortune® magazine, The Wall Street Journal, Consulting® magazine, Vault.com® and many others.<p><br></p>Firmwide Operations at Point B delivers internal and external results through leadership, process, people, and technology while supporting employees in delivering their best for our customers.<p><br></p>Our operations team includes roles focused on People &amp; Culture, Executive Talent, Risk &amp; Legal, Finance, Travel &amp; Events, Communications &amp; Change Management, IT &amp; Facilities, and Marketing. Working across these disciplines we create the foundation from which Point Bers discover and grow their careers.<p><br></p>The Account Operations Analyst assists Account Operations Managers and Account Leadership teams with many of the administrative aspects of running our client accounts. This includes managing data within CRM/vendor systems, analyzing, and manipulating data, creating dashboards, preparing account financials, managing invoice cycles, and other activities as directed by the Account Leadership teams or in support of the Account Services processes. The Account Operations Analyst will support one or more industries and build strong relationships with the leaders within those accounts and client and internal finance counterparts. This role will support the rhythm of the business and will need to identify risks, opportunities for improvement, and create visibility into account mechanics.<p><br></p><strong><u>What You’ll Get To Do</u></strong><p><br></p>Partners with Account Services and Account Leadership teams to drive client account support functions<p><br></p>Analyzes account sales and financial data, including project level estimates to completion<p><br></p>Manages active project data by ensuring milestones are correct and assignments are up to date<p><br></p>Maintains financial and sales pipeline dashboards and presentations<p><br></p>Deeply understands customer’s business processes (invoicing, SOW, onboarding, etc.) and proactively guides account approach to engage in those to benefit Point B and the Customer<p><br></p>Monitors time and expense compliance<p><br></p>Works with associates and/or ASA to resolve miscoded T&amp;E and flags anomalies for Account Leader<p><br></p>Tracks hours that need to be logged with Business Partner company and system and checks for accuracy<p><br></p>Produces client invoices in partnership with ASA. Reviews and reconciles outstanding invoices and works with account/client to follow up on past due payments<p><br></p>Gains leverage from the firm’s best practices, processes, and knowledge and contributes feedback to refine/improve account services processes<p><br></p>Be a connector and serve as a link across account teams and the firm with knowledge on engagements and/or administrative best practices<p><br></p>Supports team efforts and builds authentic relationships with individuals in work groups and teams<p><br></p>Consistently demonstrates and lives Point B cultural tenets and values<p><br></p>Participates in firm culture activities to connect regularly with other Point Bers (e.g., FW Ops Meetings, Geo Meetings)<p><br></p>Supports activity tracking and business development pursuits with a growth mindset<p><br></p>Maintains data hygiene in Salesforce<p><br></p>Leads customer project schedule management of associates in a 90-120 day view<p><br></p>Ensures sales contribution ratings and project closure activities are completed before its deadline<p><br></p>Maintains and organizes essential data elements that are critical for our predictable performance efforts<p><br></p>Creating and maintaining Teams collaboration sites<p><br></p><strong><u>What We Offer</u></strong><p><br></p>The opportunity to affect the learning approach for our firm's future<p><br></p>The chance to impact the journey of our employees’ growth and development<p><br></p>An environment that encourages you to identify new opportunities and the support to make it happen<p><br></p>The opportunity to build and be part of a fun and collaborative culture with teams that are as passionate about their communities as they are about their work<p><br></p><strong><u>What We Expect You’ve Already Done</u></strong><p><br></p>B.A. or B.S. degree<p><br></p>1-3 years of relevant work experience<p><br></p>Strong quantitative and qualitative analysis skills with high degree of attention to detail<p><br></p><strong><u>Experience In a Professional Business Environment Preferred</u></strong><p><br></p>Experience with information analysis preferably with financial or sales data<p><br></p>Experience with using MS Excel with comfort using formulas, pivot tables and lookups<p><br></p>Proficient in all Microsoft Office applications<p><br></p>Experience in, familiarity with, or willingness to dive deep into Salesforce and Microsoft Teams capabilities<p><br></p><strong><u>The Kind Of People We Look For</u></strong><p><br></p>Innate problem solvers who want to grow in a flexible, collaborative culture<p><br></p>Engaging leaders who make a positive impact on their firm, clients, and communities<p><br></p>Versatile people who thrive on variety and challenge<p><br></p>Successful in ambiguous environments<p><br></p>Desire to and ability to learn<p><br></p>Passion for Point B’s Mission, Vision, Values &amp; Culture<p><br></p>Gets it done brand and attitude<p><br></p>Ability to work from home<p><br></p>Ability to work non-standard work hours as necessary<p><br></p>Ability to travel occasionally for team meetings<p><br></p><strong><u>Compensation And Benefits</u></strong><p><br></p>The estimated salary range for this role is $51,500 - $85,000 USD per year. This salary range is provided as required by local and state law as applicable. Individual salaries vary on a number of factors including but not limited to geography, skills, education, experience and unique qualifications where applicable.<p><br></p>Bonuses are awarded at Point B’s discretion and are based upon individual contributions and overall firm performance.<p><br></p><strong><u>Your Office Home Base</u></strong><p><br></p>Any Point B Office Location<p><br></p>#sg<p><br></p><strong>INTRIGUED TO LEARN MORE?</strong><p><br></p>When you apply for this role, your information will be personally reviewed by our talent acquisition team (not by a robot). You can expect to hear back from us with feedback if we think there could be a fit and what next steps look like.<p><br></p><strong>WHAT MAKES POING B DIFFERENT?</strong><p><br></p>Our Founding Purpose and Values of our firm. Be part of a fun and collaborative culture with teams that are as passionate about their communities as they are about their clients<p><br></p>Employee Ownership – Giving you a voice in directing your career and building our firm<p><br></p>Benefits – Our comprehensive package includes competitive base pay and an annual bonus, complete health benefits including an option for 100% employer paid premium for medical, vision and dental coverage for employees, ownership shares through our ESOP, self-directed time off and more<p><br></p>Work-Life Balance – A unique culture that recognizes the importance of flexibility and collaboration. Our local and national model empowers you to choose the life you want <p><br></p>Award winning – We are proud to be named a Best Workplace in the US by Fortune magazine, Best Workplaces for Millennials, and Best Workplaces for Women. Hear more about why people love working at Point B on GlassDoor<p><br></p>We are an <strong>equal opportunity employer committed to a diverse workforce</strong>. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status or disability. You can read more about our commitment to diversity on our Careers Website.<p><br></p>Point B is committed to providing equal opportunities for persons with disabilities or religious observances, which includes providing reasonable accommodation for in any individuals with disabilities or for religious purposes. Applicants with disabilities may contact our Accommodations team at applicantaccommodations@pointb.com or 206-517-5000 to request and arrange for accommodations through the application and/or recruiting process. If you need assistance to accommodate a disability or religious observance, you may request an accommodation at any time. Please note: This mailbox is only for accommodation requests or questions. Please use the Contact Us form for any recruiting inquires.<p><br></p>Legal Information for Job Seekers can be accessed on our Careers Website.<p><br></p>
description_json: Management Consulting has been the foundation of Point B’s employee-owned company for 25+ years. Our collaborative, forward looking leadership approach ensures our customers are on the right path to success.<p><br></p>Point B is a consulting company dedicated to helping organizations with critical initiatives in the areas of customer engagement, growth investments, workforce experience and operations excellence. Our diverse set of experts spans 13 U.S. locations, with international reach via our partnership with Nextcontinent. We’ve helped global organizations of all stages and sizes achieve sustainable success by focusing on the humans at the center of change.<p><br></p>Point B has been consistently recognized as one of the best places to work by Fortune® magazine, The Wall Street Journal, Consulting® magazine, Vault.com® and many others.<p><br></p>Firmwide Operations at Point B delivers internal and external results through leadership, process, people, and technology while supporting employees in delivering their best for our customers.<p><br></p>Our operations team includes roles focused on People &amp; Culture, Executive Talent, Risk &amp; Legal, Finance, Travel &amp; Events, Communications &amp; Change Management, IT &amp; Facilities, and Marketing. Working across these disciplines we create the foundation from which Point Bers discover and grow their careers.<p><br></p>The Account Operations Analyst assists Account Operations Managers and Account Leadership teams with many of the administrative aspects of running our client accounts. This includes managing data within CRM/vendor systems, analyzing, and manipulating data, creating dashboards, preparing account financials, managing invoice cycles, and other activities as directed by the Account Leadership teams or in support of the Account Services processes. The Account Operations Analyst will support one or more industries and build strong relationships with the leaders within those accounts and client and internal finance counterparts. This role will support the rhythm of the business and will need to identify risks, opportunities for improvement, and create visibility into account mechanics.<p><br></p><strong><u>What You’ll Get To Do</u></strong><p><br></p>Partners with Account Services and Account Leadership teams to drive client account support functions<p><br></p>Analyzes account sales and financial data, including project level estimates to completion<p><br></p>Manages active project data by ensuring milestones are correct and assignments are up to date<p><br></p>Maintains financial and sales pipeline dashboards and presentations<p><br></p>Deeply understands customer’s business processes (invoicing, SOW, onboarding, etc.) and proactively guides account approach to engage in those to benefit Point B and the Customer<p><br></p>Monitors time and expense compliance<p><br></p>Works with associates and/or ASA to resolve miscoded T&amp;E and flags anomalies for Account Leader<p><br></p>Tracks hours that need to be logged with Business Partner company and system and checks for accuracy<p><br></p>Produces client invoices in partnership with ASA. Reviews and reconciles outstanding invoices and works with account/client to follow up on past due payments<p><br></p>Gains leverage from the firm’s best practices, processes, and knowledge and contributes feedback to refine/improve account services processes<p><br></p>Be a connector and serve as a link across account teams and the firm with knowledge on engagements and/or administrative best practices<p><br></p>Supports team efforts and builds authentic relationships with individuals in work groups and teams<p><br></p>Consistently demonstrates and lives Point B cultural tenets and values<p><br></p>Participates in firm culture activities to connect regularly with other Point Bers (e.g., FW Ops Meetings, Geo Meetings)<p><br></p>Supports activity tracking and business development pursuits with a growth mindset<p><br></p>Maintains data hygiene in Salesforce<p><br></p>Leads customer project schedule management of associates in a 90-120 day view<p><br></p>Ensures sales contribution ratings and project closure activities are completed before its deadline<p><br></p>Maintains and organizes essential data elements that are critical for our predictable performance efforts<p><br></p>Creating and maintaining Teams collaboration sites<p><br></p><strong><u>What We Offer</u></strong><p><br></p>The opportunity to affect the learning approach for our firm's future<p><br></p>The chance to impact the journey of our employees’ growth and development<p><br></p>An environment that encourages you to identify new opportunities and the support to make it happen<p><br></p>The opportunity to build and be part of a fun and collaborative culture with teams that are as passionate about their communities as they are about their work<p><br></p><strong><u>What We Expect You’ve Already Done</u></strong><p><br></p>B.A. or B.S. degree<p><br></p>1-3 years of relevant work experience<p><br></p>Strong quantitative and qualitative analysis skills with high degree of attention to detail<p><br></p><strong><u>Experience In a Professional Business Environment Preferred</u></strong><p><br></p>Experience with information analysis preferably with financial or sales data<p><br></p>Experience with using MS Excel with comfort using formulas, pivot tables and lookups<p><br></p>Proficient in all Microsoft Office applications<p><br></p>Experience in, familiarity with, or willingness to dive deep into Salesforce and Microsoft Teams capabilities<p><br></p><strong><u>The Kind Of People We Look For</u></strong><p><br></p>Innate problem solvers who want to grow in a flexible, collaborative culture<p><br></p>Engaging leaders who make a positive impact on their firm, clients, and communities<p><br></p>Versatile people who thrive on variety and challenge<p><br></p>Successful in ambiguous environments<p><br></p>Desire to and ability to learn<p><br></p>Passion for Point B’s Mission, Vision, Values &amp; Culture<p><br></p>Gets it done brand and attitude<p><br></p>Ability to work from home<p><br></p>Ability to work non-standard work hours as necessary<p><br></p>Ability to travel occasionally for team meetings<p><br></p><strong><u>Compensation And Benefits</u></strong><p><br></p>The estimated salary range for this role is $51,500 - $85,000 USD per year. This salary range is provided as required by local and state law as applicable. Individual salaries vary on a number of factors including but not limited to geography, skills, education, experience and unique qualifications where applicable.<p><br></p>Bonuses are awarded at Point B’s discretion and are based upon individual contributions and overall firm performance.<p><br></p><strong><u>Your Office Home Base</u></strong><p><br></p>Any Point B Office Location<p><br></p>#sg<p><br></p><strong>INTRIGUED TO LEARN MORE?</strong><p><br></p>When you apply for this role, your information will be personally reviewed by our talent acquisition team (not by a robot). You can expect to hear back from us with feedback if we think there could be a fit and what next steps look like.<p><br></p><strong>WHAT MAKES POING B DIFFERENT?</strong><p><br></p>Our Founding Purpose and Values of our firm. Be part of a fun and collaborative culture with teams that are as passionate about their communities as they are about their clients<p><br></p>Employee Ownership – Giving you a voice in directing your career and building our firm<p><br></p>Benefits – Our comprehensive package includes competitive base pay and an annual bonus, complete health benefits including an option for 100% employer paid premium for medical, vision and dental coverage for employees, ownership shares through our ESOP, self-directed time off and more<p><br></p>Work-Life Balance – A unique culture that recognizes the importance of flexibility and collaboration. title: AWS Infrastructure Engineer
description: <strong><u>About Prevail Health Solutions (iPrevail.com)<br><br></u></strong>iPrevail.com is a unique platform that combines digital therapeutics with a human touch to offer mental and behavioral health solutions. Our goal is to making mental and behavioral** health care’s services accessible to all. iPrevail.com is backed by clinical research and designed to help individuals navigate a wide range of mental health challenges, including anxiety, depression, stress, among others.<br><br>iPrevail.com partnered with the National Science Foundation to develop its innovative platform with support from a range of partners and funders, including Goldman Sachs Foundation, Bristol Myers Squibb Foundation, Rush University, and many others.<br><br><strong><u>About This Role<br><br></u></strong>We are rapidly expanding our team! We are looking for highly motivated software engineer who wants to build life-changing software in the health tech space. You will work with a skilled group of engineers/developers and help build new features while scaling the existing products.<br><br>We are an agile team that works in a fast-paced environment, your voice is critical to our growth and success. If you are an individual that is passionate about making a difference and want to write some awesome code to drive our product forward.<br><br><strong><u>What You Will Do<br></u></strong><ul><li>Collaborating with management, development team members and customers to identify end-user requirements and specifications, this would include new features ad scale product.</li><li>Produce efficient and effective code based on requirements.</li><li>Write unit and integration tests and ensure proper coverage.</li><li>Troubleshooting, debugging, maintaining, and improving existing code.  </li><li>Review code and provide feedback with other members of the Prevail team.</li><li>Work with cutting edge technologies and work within the entire stack.</li><li>Assist with high-level architecture decisions keeping in mind scale and growth.</li><li>Deploy code to staging and production environment.</li><li>Positively contribute to a solid mission and be a critical voice within the team.</li><li>Develop technical documentation to guide future software development projects.<br></li></ul><strong><u>What We Are Looking For<br></u></strong><ul><li>A degree in computer science or equivalent experience.</li><li>2+ years working with Ruby on Rails OR</li><li>2+ years working with React, Angular, Vue etc.</li><li>Knowledge of the software development life cycle.</li><li>The desire to work in a fast-paced, changing environment.</li><li>Experience with service-oriented and object-oriented programming.</li><li>Ability to write tests.</li><li>A self-starter and able to independently handle multiple task and priorities.</li><li>Excellent written and verbal communication skills</li><li>Detail-oriented, organized, and able to handle multiple tasks with minimal oversight</li><li>Passion for learning new technologies</li><li>Must live in the United States Preferred Experience: </li><li>Solid DevOps chops!</li><li>Healthcare (HIPAA) and/or strong security background a huge plus, but not required.</li><li>Master’s degree in computer science or Cyber Security.<br></li></ul><strong>Perks<br></strong><ul><li>Salary commensurate with experience</li><li>Opportunity for professional growth – we support our teammates who want to expand their web development skills<br></li></ul><strong><u>Benefits Include<br></u></strong><ul><li>Health, vision, and dental insurance</li><li>401 k plan</li><li>PTOs</li><li>Work from home</li><li>A very casual dress code and a fun, interactive and open working environment</li><li>Rapid growth opportunities<br></li></ul>If you’re ready to take on new challenges in a dynamic start-up atmosphere that is changing the way we access support in health and wellness, then don’t hesitate to reach out and apply for the position. We take a holistic approach to hiring and consider the unique qualifications of each candidate.<br><br>Prevail Health is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Prevail Health will not discriminate against any applicant for employment on the basis of race, color, age, religion, sex, sex orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires an accommodation, please let us know.

title: Mainframe/Cobol developer
description: <strong>Title</strong>: Security Engineer<p><br></p><strong>Location: </strong>Chicago IL - Onsite<p><br></p><strong>Duration: </strong>1 Year<p><br></p><strong>Job Description:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Assess the security posture of our systems, applications, and infrastructure and design and implement strategies for asset hardening.</li><li>Identify misconfigurations, and weaknesses in systems and apply appropriate security controls and countermeasures to mitigate risks.</li><li>Collaborate with system administrators, network engineers, and application developers to engineer and harden assets at all layers, including operating systems, cloud platforms, databases, and network devices.</li><li>Engineer and maintain security controls within the Microsoft 365 environment, including Azure Active Directory, Exchange Online, SharePoint, Intune and Teams.</li><li>Configure and enforce security policies, data loss prevention (DLP) measures, and threat protection mechanisms to safeguard our assets.</li><li>Stay informed about emerging security technologies and trends and provide recommendations for their adoption.</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Software Requirements</strong>:<p><br></p><ul><li>Active Directory (Azure, On-prem)</li><li>AWS (Desirable)</li><li>M365</li><li>Windows Servers (2016 and newer)</li><li>Linux (Desirable)</li><li>Containers (Desirable)</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Experience Required</strong>:<p><br></p><ul><li>5 years of experience as a Security Engineer or in a similar role, with a demonstrated background in asset hardening and Microsoft 365 security.</li><li>Scripting/automation experience such as Python and PowerShell</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Education Requirements:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>4-year college degree in Information Technology or equivalent experience</li><li>Security certifications (CISSP, GSEC, MS—500, MS-700, CCSP, etc.) preferred</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Knowledge, Skills, abilities, and behaviors required</strong>:<p><br></p><ul><li>Ability to work both independently and with a team while managing workload with minimal supervision.</li><li>Strong knowledge of servers, networking, cloud technologies, and related security considerations.</li><li>Familiarity with security principles, frameworks, and compliance standards (e.g., NIST, CIS)</li><li>Excellent problem-solving skills and ability to analyze complex technical issues.</li><li>Strong communication and collaboration skills to work effectively with cross-functional teams.</li><li>Ability to travel and collaborate in the downtown Chicago office two days a week.</li></ul>

title: Engineer II, Test Engineer
description: <strong>Quality Assurance Analyst (Manual)<br><br></strong><strong>Pay: </strong>$60-$70 w2<br><br><strong>Contract Length:</strong> 6 months contract (potential extension)<br><br><strong>Location: Chicago, IL (hybrid)<br><br></strong><strong><u>Note<br><br></u></strong>This is a Manual Tester, automation tools knowledge is not required, but it is a huge nice to have. It is important that the candidate have experience in cross browser, cross platform web and mobile testing and their dev tools that come with them.<br><br><strong><u>Purpose<br><br></u></strong>Quality Assurance Analyst will report to QA Manager. The Quality Assurance Analyst's role is to develop and establish quality assurance standards and measures for the information technology services within the organization.<br><br><strong><u>Position Responsibilities<br></u></strong><ul><li> Gather and analyze data in support of business cases, proposed projects, and systems requirements.</li><li> Write test plans and scripts for tracking defects and fixes in product development, software application development, information systems, and operations systems.</li><li> Develop and establish quality assurance measures and testing standards for new development and enhancements.</li><li> Create and execute test plans and scripts that will determine application quality.</li><li> Communicate test progress, test results, and quality of application changes.</li><li> Analyze test results to discover and report out on defects.</li><li> Work with business community to plan and execute UAT.</li><li> Assist in environment setup and management in preparation for test execution.</li><li> Experience with writing acceptance criteria.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Experience And Qualifications<br></u></strong><ul><li>10+ years direct experience as a lead tester for major application integration and/or major application product release.</li><li>Strong knowledge of system testing best practices and methodologies.</li><li>Extensive experience with core software applications.</li><li>Direct hands-on experience with ad hoc query programs, manual testing tools, and reporting software.</li><li>Experience with statistical reporting and analysis.</li><li>Good project management skills and/or substantial exposure to project-based work structures.</li><li>Experience with communication tools like MS-Word, MS-Excel, MS-PowerPoint.</li><li>Comfortable with test planning and tracking tools<br></li></ul><strong><u>Must Have Tools<br></u></strong><ul><li>Familiarity in testing APIs/services (REST and SOAP) using SoapUI, Postman or equivalent tools</li><li>Experience in cross browser, cross platform web and mobile testing and their dev tools that come with them</li><li>Proficient in leveraging Splunk or similar tools to view system logs and troubleshoot potential defects</li><li>Experience with communication tools like MS-Word, MS-Excel, MS-PowerPoint, MS Teams</li><li>Comfortable with test planning and tracking tools such as Confluence, Jira, Zephyr</li><li>HIGHLY DESIRED*</li><li>Familiarity in Java, XML, JS, CSS and HTML</li><li>Familiarity with SauceLabs or equivalent tools</li><li>Direct hands-on experience with Java and/or Groovy, test automation frameworks, Selenium/Appium, with ad hoc query programs, and reporting software</li><li>Familiarity in version control systems like Git and Subversion</li><li>Familiarity in Java, XML, JS, CSS and HTML</li><li>Sound knowledge of Jenkins for Continuous Integration.<br></li></ul><strong><u>Education<br></u></strong><ul><li>Four year college degree<br></li></ul>#PCIT<br><br>

title: Quantitative Developer
description: <p><strong>Job Title: C++ Developer</strong></p><p><strong>Location: Chicago, IL (Hybrid from Day 1)</strong></p><p><strong>Duration:&nbsp;12 + Months </strong></p><p><strong>&nbsp;</strong></p><p><strong>Interview:-Phone + skype</strong></p><p><strong>&nbsp;</strong></p><p><strong>Description:-</strong></p><p>1.Associate should have expertise in C++ Develpment projects and should be able to perform Analyze, Design, Development and Unit Testing functions.</p><p>2.Should be able to lead technical design and development activities.</p><p>3.3+ Years’ Experience in Java, Oracle, Linux Development.</p><p>4.Experience in Agile model projects.</p><p>5.Knowledge in Microfocus Voltage Data Encryption software a plus.</p><p>6.C++, Solaris.</p><p><span>Thanks &amp; Regards</span></p><p><span>&nbsp;</span></p><p><span>Sunita Gautam</span></p><p><span>Technical Recruiter </span></p><p>sunita@skill-bird.com</p><p><span>Direct:#1-302-343-1350, Ext-333</span></p><p><span>SKILL-BIRD LLC.</span></p><ul><li><span>4 Peddlers Row, Unit#5, Newark DE 19702</span></li></ul>
description_json: <p><strong>Job Title: C++ Developer</strong></p><p><strong>Location: Chicago, IL (Hybrid from Day 1)</strong></p><p><strong>Duration:&nbsp;12 + Months </strong></p><p><strong>&nbsp;</strong></p><p><strong>Interview:-Phone + skype</strong></p><p><strong>&nbsp;</strong></p><p><strong>Description:-</strong></p><p>1.Associate should have expertise in C++ Develpment projects and should be able to perform Analyze, Design, Development and Unit Testing functions.</p><p>2.Should be able to lead technical design and development activities.</p><p>3.3+ Years’ Experience in Java, Oracle, Linux Development.</p><p>4.Experience in Agile model projects.</p><p>5.Knowledge in Microfocus Voltage Data Encryption software a plus.</p><p>6.C++, Solaris.</p><p><span>Thanks &amp; Regards</span></p><p><span>&nbsp;</span></p><p><span>Sunita Gautam</span></p><p><span>Technical Recruiter </span></p><p>sunita@skill-bird.com</p><p><span>Direct:#1-302-343-1350, Ext-333</span></p><p><span>SKILL-BIRD LLC.</span></p><ul><li><span>4 Peddlers Row, Unit#5, Newark DE 19702</span></li></ul>

title: Infrastructure Engineer
description: <strong>ABOUT US</strong>:<br><br>Braintrust is a user-owned talent network that connects you with great jobs with no fees or membership costs—so you keep 100% of what you earn.<br><br><strong>ABOUT THE HIRING PROCESS:<br><br></strong>When you join Braintrust, you will be invited to a screening process for Braintrust to learn more about your previous work experiences. Once completed, you will have access to the employer for this role and other top companies that seek high-quality talent. Apply to this job to kick off the process.<br><ul><li>JOB TYPE: Freelance, Contract Position (no agencies/C2C - see notes below)</li><li>LOCATION: Remote-United States only (TimeZone: EST | Partial overlap)</li><li>HOURLY RANGE: Our client is looking to pay $100 – $112/hr</li><li>ESTIMATED DURATION: 40h/week - Long term<br><br></li></ul><strong>THE OPPORTUNITY<br><br></strong><strong>Requirements<br><br></strong><strong>Qualities that will help you thrive in this role are:<br></strong><ul><li>You have familiarity with some of the following: Google Cloud Platform (GCP) services, such as Cloud Storage, BigQuery, Cloud Dataflow, Cloud Pub/Sub, and Data Loss Prevention (DLP), creating dashboards in tools such as Looker or Tableau for monitoring and insights, building and monitoring cloud services, infrastructure as code technologies such as Terraform, AWS Cloud Formation, Ansible, etc, Big Data experience with tools such as Spark.</li><li>You understand that being an effective software engineer is about communicating with people as much as it is about writing code</li><li>You are generous with your time and experience, and can mentor and learn from other engineers</li><li>You can tackle unconstrained problems and know when to seek help</li><li>You are flexible with languages and tools and willing to learn whatever is necessary to complete the job.</li></ul> <strong><strong>What you’ll be working on<br><br></strong></strong><strong>What’s the role?<br><br></strong>Our client's Data Enablement organization's mission is to enable the use of data at scale and to unlock learning through experimentation. As part of the Data Governance &amp; Privacy team, you will join a highly visible team with a top priority of protecting sensitive information of our client's buyers and sellers. The team is responsible for building services and processes to protect Personally Identifiable Information (PII) in their data warehouses. You'll be part of our client's journey to modernize how they protect personal data<br><br>They work with Google Cloud Platform (GCP) services, such as Cloud Storage, BigQuery, Cloud Dataflow, Cloud Pub/Sub, and Data Loss Prevention (DLP). Languages include Java, Python, PHP and SQL, and they work with technologies like Terraform, Spark, Airflow, and BigQuery. Experience with any of these is helpful but not required; above all, they value curiosity, responsibility, and eagerness to solve complex engineering problems. They're looking for a flexible engineer, who can work with the internal customers, and embraces pivoting to the appropriate tool for the job rather than having deep expertise in single systems<br><br>The technical staff believes that code is craft, and that the work they do is part of a larger creative culture that includes the hundreds of thousands of inspired artists and designers who make the Company such a unique marketplace. They believe that small, empowered, self-motivated teams can do big things. They believe in measuring everything, taking advantage of their continuous deployment system to ship code early and often, and keeping up a blameless culture based on trust and a commitment to learning.<br><br>This is a position reporting to the Engineering Manager, Data Governance &amp; Privacy. For this role, they are considering candidates who are either remote, flex, or office-based. The team is geographically dispersed, but works in North America Time Zones<br><br><strong>What does the day-to-day look like?<br></strong><ul><li>You will build and maintain internal tools for tracking and inventorying GCS file sets using Google Storage Insight</li><li>You will work with your team to develop methods to programmatically apply column tags and Policy Tags on BigQuery data sets to identify and protect Personally Identifiable Information</li><li>You will help measure the team’s progress in our work by creating dashboards and monitoring in tools such as Looker or Tableau<br><br></li></ul><strong>Apply Now!<br><br></strong>Braintrust Job ID: 6589<br><br>C2C Candidates: This role is not available to C2C candidates working with an agency. If you are a professional contractor who has created an LLC/corp around their consulting practice, this is well aligned with Braintrust and we’d welcome your application.<br><br>Braintrust values the multitude of talents and perspectives that a diverse workforce brings. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status.

title: Redis Developer
description: <strong>Address: </strong>USA-IL-Chicago-300 South Riverside Plaza<p><br></p><strong>Store Code: </strong>Infrastructure-Network (5118693)<p><br></p>Retail Business Services, ranked No. 25 on Fast Company's 2022 100 Best Workplaces for Innovators, is the services company of leading grocery retail group Ahold Delhaize USA, which includes Food Lion, Giant Food, The GIANT Company, Hannaford and Stop &amp; Shop.<p><br></p><strong>Primary Purpose:</strong><p><br></p>A Platform Engineer will provide expertise and leadership in the design, configuration, and management of all corporate, distribution center and retail digital media devices and associated supporting services. They are expected to work in a fast-paced and challenging environment leveraging forward-thinking technical engineering expertise in the media device and services area of the enterprise.<p><br></p><strong>Duties and Responsibilities:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Provide subject matter expertise in the analysis, design and preparation of technology solutions to meet business needs</li><li> Recommends components for solutions that will work well together across business domains, partner with domain architect or act as the domain architect to ensure adherence to the architectural roadmap</li><li> Accountable for projects/applications/infrastructure meeting business needs are delivered in a timely, cost-effective manner considering all budget aspects including total cost of ownership.</li><li> Ensures project artifacts are developed as required, this includes working with support organizations and suppliers to ensure proper documentation is created and stored in the procedure's manual or document repository.</li><li> Facilitates/completes the creation of communication plans, ensuring that appropriate information is exchanged among key stakeholders.</li><li> Develops complete and robust test plans, cases, and scripts, ensures defects are properly resolved and user acceptance is obtained. Ensures the test scripts and defects are entered and tracked in our department tools.</li><li> Acts as communication point keeping the supplier and business partners informed of infrastructure changes, application changes, data changes or upcoming implementations and ensures business specific impacts are addressed.</li><li> Ensures integration and consideration of assigned business areas against critical business processing, freeze periods, schedule changes, weather events and significant refresh activities.</li><li> Thorough understanding of the business strategy, operations, markets, and key stakeholders.</li><li> Review's business processes to understand capability gaps and opportunities</li><li> Recommends Innovations and business processes /systems simplifications</li><li> Builds close relationships with the function heads and their teams. Advise these teams on how technology can be used to match or outpace competitor performance.</li><li> Works as 3rd level support to help resolve issues within area of responsibility</li><li> Maintains a high level of individual contribution, professional growth, and ability to function effectively and independently, challenges others to do the same</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or Technical field and master's degree in Technology and/or Business-related field</li><li> equivalent trainings/certifications/experience equivalency will be considered</li><li> 5 or more years of equivalent experience in relevant job or field of technology.</li><li> 2 or more years of equivalent experience in an advanced role or technical capacity, leading teams directly or indirectly.</li><li> 2 or more years' experience directly responsible for guiding, training or onboarding team members in relevant technologies, capabilities or skills</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Post graduate degree advanced training and or certifications in relevant field/s of study preferred.</li><li> 3 or more years experience in Agile teams and Product/Platform based operating model.</li><li> 3 or more years of experience in leading teams or advancing technical capability in teams.</li><li> Experience in retail or grocery preferred.</li></ul><p><br></p>#DICEJobs<p><br></p>Retail Business Services currently provides services to five omnichannel grocery brands, including Food Lion, Giant Food, The GIANT Company, Hannaford and Stop &amp; Shop. Retail Business Services leverages the scale of the local brands to drive synergies and provide industry-leading expertise, insights and analytics to local brands to support their strategies. We are committed to diversity, equity and inclusion and we foster a community of belonging where everyone is valued.<p><br></p>Retail Business Services is an equal opportunity employer. We comply with all applicable federal, state and local laws. Qualified applicants are considered without regard to sex, race, color, ancestry, national origin, citizenship status, religion, age, marital status (including civil unions), military service, veteran status, pregnancy (including childbirth and related medical conditions), genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, legally recognized disability, domestic violence victim status or any other characteristic protected by law. We provide reasonable accommodations to applicants and employees with disabilities. As important as what we do is how we do it. Our team embodies our values of Courage, Care, Teamwork, Integrity and Humor in everything that they do. We have a culture of care that values and celebrates the qualities and perspectives that make us all unique.<p><br></p>If you have a disability and require assistance in the application process, please contact our Talent Acquisition Department at tad@retailbusinessservices.com .<p><br></p>For more information, visit https://www.retailbusinessservices.com .<p><br></p>Job Requisition: 317759_external_USA-IL-Chicago_5242023 IT Engineer Platform<p><br></p>

title: System Engineer
description: <strong><u>Job Description<br><br></u></strong><strong>JOB SUMMARY<br><br></strong>The Technology &amp; Breakthrough Innovation (TBI) team located in Chicago, IL, Alameda, CA, and Franklin, WI creates some of the world's most cutting-edge products. TBI is looking for an experienced Project Engineer who can span the software and electronics hardware domains to tackle complex signal processing challenges. .<br><br><strong>The responsibilities of this position include, but are not limited to, the following:<br></strong><ul><li>Working closely with system architects, software and electrical engineers to develop prototype hardware, software and system simulations</li><li>Developing new software, using C/C++ and python, to operate in an embedded Linux platform to execute signal processing tasks</li><li>Developing, or contributing to the development of, project schedules, time estimates, detailed software specifications and test plans.</li><li>Responsible for all aspects of the software design cycle including, architecture design, specifications, analysis, implementation, reviewing code, testing and related documentation.</li><li>Working with product owners to assure product designs meet the requirements of the market.<br></li></ul><strong>To select this job as one of interest to you, at a minimum, you must have the following:<br></strong><ul><li>BS degree in Electrical or Computer Engineering, with advanced degree in software and digital systems.</li><li>Experience with microprocessors and digital data acquisition and processing.</li><li>Demonstrated ability to adapt to new technologies, multi-task and set priorities </li><li>Excellent problem-solving skills, and evidence of original thinking to do so</li><li>Strong analytical skills and familiarity with modelling environments such as Matlab and Simulink</li><li>Excellent written and verbal communication skills, and demonstrated ability to communicate across disciplines.</li><li>Ability to read and interpret technical specifications. </li><li>Ability to travel less than 10% of the time with some periods lasting more than a week. <br></li></ul><strong><u>About Us<br><br></u></strong>In 1909, S&amp;C Electric Company transformed the delivery of safe, reliable electricity with the invention of the Liquid Power Fuse. Today, as the world faces extreme weather events and the demand for electricity grows, S&amp;C continues to innovate and advance the electrical grid, ensuring reliable and resilient power for homes, communities, and critical infrastructure around the world.<br><br>With a diverse, global workforce and core values around integrity, safety, and quality, S&amp;C is a trusted industry leader and top workplace that offers meaningful careers to more than 3,500 team members. As a people-first organization, S&amp;C is committed to fostering an inclusive and collaborative workplace where team members advance their careers through robust talent-development programs and involved leadership.<br><br>S&amp;C’s deeply rooted belief diversity fosters greater creativity, innovation, and success guides the company to advance and sustain a diverse, equitable, and inclusive workplace culture.<br><br><strong>Organization<br><br></strong>In the (Engineering, Design) department, we are responsible for creatively addressing customers' needs, pioneering industry changes, and understanding each step, from R&amp;D to production. We strive to not only solve the unique challenges our customers face today, but to create breakthrough technologies enabling them to effectively navigate the demands of the grid of tomorrow. As S&amp;C innovates for reliability, progress, and longevity, our work continues S&amp;C's legacy of creating game-changing technology and advancing the energy industry.
industry: Appliances, Electrical, and Electronics Manufacturing, Renewable Energy Semiconductor Manufacturing, and Utilities

title: Software Design Engineer
description: HIR ING<p><br></p>Job Skills<p><br></p>Web API, Restfull Service, Microsoft<p><br></p><strong>Description</strong><p><br></p><strong>Dev Lead JD</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>10+years of experience designing and developing applications</li><li>Hands on experience on C#, .NET, Web API services, SQL Server 12, Angular 12+preferred is Angular 14.</li><li>Knowledge on various design patterns and able to provide low level design for modules</li><li>Ability to understand UX wireframes, visual design and develop UI</li><li>Experience working on smaller database design</li><li>Ability to write complex stored procedures, optimizing the same</li><li>Ability to integrate with other applications using APIs</li><li>Experience in work in Agile process model</li><li>Ability to mentor the team and help juniors in issue resolution and code review</li><li>Good Analytical and problem solving skills.</li><li>Good Communication skills</li><li>Should have got prior work experience with onsite / offshore model and be able to collaborate well as a team member + lead + individual contributor communicating with customer stakeholder and Hexaware stakeholders</li><li>Should work in customer location in IL, Chicago as per their hybrid policy</li></ul>

title: Ab Initio Developer with Snowflake ( Hybrid)
description: WorldQuant develops and deploys systematic financial strategies across a broad range of asset classes and global markets. We seek to produce high-quality predictive signals (alphas) through our proprietary research platform to employ financial strategies focused on market inefficiencies. Our teams work collaboratively to drive the production of alphas and financial strategies – the foundation of a balanced, global investment platform.<p><br></p>WorldQuant is built on a culture that pairs academic sensibility with accountability for results. Employees are encouraged to think openly about problems, balancing intellectualism and practicality. Excellent ideas come from anyone, anywhere. Employees are encouraged to challenge conventional thinking and possess an attitude of continuous improvement.<p><br></p>Our goal is to hire the best and the brightest. We value intellectual horsepower first and foremost, and people who demonstrate an outstanding talent. There is no roadmap to future success, so we need people who can help us build it.<p><br></p>Technologists at WorldQuant research, design, code, test and deploy firmwide platforms and tooling while working collaboratively with researchers and portfolio managers. Our environment is relaxed yet intellectually driven. We seek people who think in code and are motivated by being around like-minded people.<p><br></p><strong>The Role:</strong> WorldQuant is seeking exceptional C++ developers to join our front office development team to further enhance and build our next generation trading platforms.<p><br></p><strong><u>What You'll Do</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Write low latency, high throughput C++ code</li><li>Implement mission critical trading infrastructure</li><li>Work with portfolio managers to implement new trading systems</li><li>Adapt existing systems to our next generation trading platform</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>What You'll Bring</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>A minimum of 4 years of writing high performance C++</li><li>Modern C++ knowledge (C++17/20, etc)</li><li>C++ template meta programming knowledge</li><li>Possess in-depth knowledge of network programming and distributed computing</li><li>Strong knowledge of Unix/Linux fundamentals</li><li>Strong understanding of data structures and algorithms</li><li>Finance experience is preferred but not required</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Locations:</strong> Chicago, NYC, CT, or Austin<p><br></p>WorldQuant is a total compensation organization where you will be eligible for a base salary, discretionary performance bonus, and benefits. The estimated salary range for this position is $125,000 to $250,000 which is specific to New York and may change in the future. When finalizing an offer we will take into consideration an individual’s experience level and the qualifications they bring to the role to formulate a competitive total compensation package.<p><br></p>By submitting this application, you acknowledge and consent to terms of the WorldQuant Privacy Policy. The privacy policy offers an explanation of how and why your data will be collected, how it will be used and disclosed, how it will be retained and secured, and what legal rights are associated with that data (including the rights of access, correction, and deletion). The policy also describes legal and contractual limitations on these rights. The specific rights and obligations of individuals living and working in different areas may vary by jurisdiction.<p><br></p>Copyright © 2023 WorldQuant, LLC. title: Systems Engineer onsite Chicago
description: <strong>Address: </strong>USA-IL-Chicago-300 South Riverside Plaza<p><br></p><strong>Store Code: </strong>Infrastructure-Network (5118702)<p><br></p>Retail Business Services, ranked No. 25 on Fast Company's 2022 100 Best Workplaces for Innovators, is the services company of leading grocery retail group Ahold Delhaize USA, which includes Food Lion, Giant Food, The GIANT Company, Hannaford and Stop &amp; Shop.<p><br></p><strong>Primary Purpose:</strong><p><br></p>A Platform Engineer will provide expertise and leadership in the design, configuration, and management of all corporate, distribution center and retail digital media devices and associated supporting services. They are expected to work in a fast-paced and challenging environment leveraging forward-thinking technical engineering expertise in the media device and services area of the enterprise.<p><br></p><strong>Duties and Responsibilities:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Provide subject matter expertise in the analysis, design and preparation of technology solutions to meet business needs</li><li> Recommends components for solutions that will work well together across business domains, partner with domain architect or act as the domain architect to ensure adherence to the architectural roadmap</li><li> Accountable for projects/applications/infrastructure meeting business needs are delivered in a timely, cost-effective manner considering all budget aspects including total cost of ownership.</li><li> Ensures project artifacts are developed as required, this includes working with support organizations and suppliers to ensure proper documentation is created and stored in the procedure's manual or document repository.</li><li> Facilitates/completes the creation of communication plans, ensuring that appropriate information is exchanged among key stakeholders.</li><li> Develops complete and robust test plans, cases, and scripts, ensures defects are properly resolved and user acceptance is obtained. Ensures the test scripts and defects are entered and tracked in our department tools.</li><li> Acts as communication point keeping the supplier and business partners informed of infrastructure changes, application changes, data changes or upcoming implementations and ensures business specific impacts are addressed.</li><li> Ensures integration and consideration of assigned business areas against critical business processing, freeze periods, schedule changes, weather events and significant refresh activities.</li><li> Thorough understanding of the business strategy, operations, markets, and key stakeholders.</li><li> Review's business processes to understand capability gaps and opportunities</li><li> Recommends Innovations and business processes /systems simplifications</li><li> Builds close relationships with the function heads and their teams. Advise these teams on how technology can be used to match or outpace competitor performance.</li><li> Works as 3rd level support to help resolve issues within area of responsibility</li><li> Maintains a high level of individual contribution, professional growth, and ability to function effectively and independently, challenges others to do the same</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or Technical field and master's degree in Technology and/or Business-related field</li><li> equivalent trainings/certifications/experience equivalency will be considered</li><li> 5 or more years of equivalent experience in relevant job or field of technology.</li><li> 2 or more years of equivalent experience in an advanced role or technical capacity, leading teams directly or indirectly.</li><li> 2 or more years' experience directly responsible for guiding, training or onboarding team members in relevant technologies, capabilities or skills</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Post graduate degree advanced training and or certifications in relevant field/s of study preferred.</li><li> 3 or more years experience in Agile teams and Product/Platform based operating model.</li><li> 3 or more years of experience in leading teams or advancing technical capability in teams.</li><li> Experience in retail or grocery preferred.</li></ul><p><br></p>#DICEJobs<p><br></p>Retail Business Services currently provides services to five omnichannel grocery brands, including Food Lion, Giant Food, The GIANT Company, Hannaford and Stop &amp; Shop. Retail Business Services leverages the scale of the local brands to drive synergies and provide industry-leading expertise, insights and analytics to local brands to support their strategies. We are committed to diversity, equity and inclusion and we foster a community of belonging where everyone is valued.<p><br></p>Retail Business Services is an equal opportunity employer. We comply with all applicable federal, state and local laws. Qualified applicants are considered without regard to sex, race, color, ancestry, national origin, citizenship status, religion, age, marital status (including civil unions), military service, veteran status, pregnancy (including childbirth and related medical conditions), genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, legally recognized disability, domestic violence victim status or any other characteristic protected by law. We provide reasonable accommodations to applicants and employees with disabilities. As important as what we do is how we do it. Our team embodies our values of Courage, Care, Teamwork, Integrity and Humor in everything that they do. We have a culture of care that values and celebrates the qualities and perspectives that make us all unique.<p><br></p>If you have a disability and require assistance in the application process, please contact our Talent Acquisition Department at tad@retailbusinessservices.com .<p><br></p>For more information, visit https://www.retailbusinessservices.com .<p><br></p>Job Requisition: 293648_external_USA-IL-Chicago_5242023 IT Engineer Platform<p><br></p>

description_json: <strong>Address: </strong>USA-IL-Chicago-300 South Riverside Plaza<p><br></p><strong>Store Code: </strong>Infrastructure-Network (5118718)<p><br></p>Retail Business Services, ranked No. 25 on Fast Company's 2022 100 Best Workplaces for Innovators, is the services company of leading grocery retail group Ahold Delhaize USA, which includes Food Lion, Giant Food, The GIANT Company, Hannaford and Stop &amp; Shop.<p><br></p><strong>Primary Purpose:</strong><p><br></p>A Platform Engineer will provide expertise and leadership in the design, configuration, and management of all corporate, distribution center and retail digital media devices and associated supporting services. They are expected to work in a fast-paced and challenging environment leveraging forward-thinking technical engineering expertise in the media device and services area of the enterprise.<p><br></p><strong>Duties and Responsibilities:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Provide subject matter expertise in the analysis, design and preparation of technology solutions to meet business needs</li><li> Recommends components for solutions that will work well together across business domains, partner with domain architect or act as the domain architect to ensure adherence to the architectural roadmap</li><li> Accountable for projects/applications/infrastructure meeting business needs are delivered in a timely, cost-effective manner considering all budget aspects including total cost of ownership.</li><li> Ensures project artifacts are developed as required, this includes working with support organizations and suppliers to ensure proper documentation is created and stored in the procedure's manual or document repository.</li><li> Facilitates/completes the creation of communication plans, ensuring that appropriate information is exchanged among key stakeholders.</li><li> Develops complete and robust test plans, cases, and scripts, ensures defects are properly resolved and user acceptance is obtained. Ensures the test scripts and defects are entered and tracked in our department tools.</li><li> Acts as communication point keeping the supplier and business partners informed of infrastructure changes, application changes, data changes or upcoming implementations and ensures business specific impacts are addressed.</li><li> Ensures integration and consideration of assigned business areas against critical business processing, freeze periods, schedule changes, weather events and significant refresh activities.</li><li> Thorough understanding of the business strategy, operations, markets, and key stakeholders.</li><li> Review's business processes to understand capability gaps and opportunities</li><li> Recommends Innovations and business processes /systems simplifications</li><li> Builds close relationships with the function heads and their teams. Advise these teams on how technology can be used to match or outpace competitor performance.</li><li> Works as 3rd level support to help resolve issues within area of responsibility</li><li> Maintains a high level of individual contribution, professional growth, and ability to function effectively and independently, challenges others to do the same</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications: </strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or Technical field and master's degree in Technology and/or Business-related field</li><li> equivalent trainings/certifications/experience equivalency will be considered</li><li> 5 or more years of equivalent experience in relevant job or field of technology.</li><li> 2 or more years of equivalent experience in an advanced role or technical capacity, leading teams directly or indirectly.</li><li> 2 or more years' experience directly responsible for guiding, training or onboarding team members in relevant technologies, capabilities or skills</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred Qualifications:</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Post graduate degree advanced training and or certifications in relevant field/s of study preferred.</li><li> 3 or more years experience in Agile teams and Product/Platform based operating model.</li><li> 3 or more years of experience in leading teams or advancing technical capability in teams.</li><li> Experience in retail or grocery preferred.</li></ul><p><br></p>#DICEJobs<p><br></p>Retail Business Services currently provides services to five omnichannel grocery brands, including Food Lion, Giant Food, The GIANT Company, Hannaford and Stop &amp; Shop. Retail Business Services leverages the scale of the local brands to drive synergies and provide industry-leading expertise, insights and analytics to local brands to support their strategies. We are committed to diversity, equity and inclusion and we foster a community of belonging where everyone is valued.<p><br></p>Retail Business Services is an equal opportunity employer. title: Full Stack Developer
description: We are Gelber Group -- Passion for Trading. Powered by Technology.<br><br>For 40 years, we have set the bar as one of the industry's most innovative and enduring proprietary trading firms. We are headquartered in Chicago with offices and team members across the United States and Europe. Our success derives from a relentless pursuit of new trading ideas and careful attention to technology. Our culture of entrepreneurship, innovation and collaboration empowers each member of our team to have a meaningful impact from the day they join Gelber. We believe our talented staff are our greatest asset and we are committed to providing them the resources they need to succeed. With 16 distinct trading groups, we trade a little bit of everything here – with diverse styles and approaches across all major global marketplaces – and we are always looking to expand into new opportunities. Our flat organizational structure ensures a true meritocracy and attracts individuals with an edge to contribute to our consistent success.<br><br>We are Gelber Group -- Passion for Trading. Powered by Technology.<br><br>Headquartered in Chicago with offices across the United States and Europe, for more than 40 years, we have set the bar as one of the industry's most innovative and enduring proprietary trading firms. Our success derives from a relentless pursuit of new trading ideas and careful attention to technology. We believe in a culture of entrepreneurship, innovation, and collaboration and we empower each member of our team to have a meaningful impact from the very start of their career with Gelber. We invest in our future through our technology and talented staff, strategically committing resources to move our firm forward and help our people succeed. We trade a little bit of everything here and are always looking to expand into new opportunities. Our flat organizational structure and focus on a true meritocracy, attracts individuals with an edge which contributes to our consistent success.<br><br>As a Software Engineer on our Executions Team at Gelber, you will have a real opportunity to have a long-term career in Engineering at a successful trading firm. You will work side by side with other talented Engineers. This role is for someone who flourishes in a fast-paced environment, has a strong work ethic, is a clear communicator, and has a strong interest in the financial markets. This position will report directly into the Director of our Executions engineering team who reports directly into the Chief Technology Officer.<br><br><em>What you'll do:<br></em><ul><li>Participate in all phases of software process – design, development, testing, integration, deployment, and support</li><li>As part of a highly skilled development team, you will design and develop applications that enable proprietary trading at Gelber Group</li><li>Convert legacy components into state-of-the-art applications</li><li>Work in an agile environment</li><li>Apply and improve your C++ and Java skills<br><br></li></ul><em>What you'll need:<br></em><ul><li>Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or related field</li><li>2-4 years of experience coding in C++</li><li>Familiarity with Linux</li><li>Experience with Java is not required, but strongly preferred</li><li>Strong communication skills specifically when it comes to understanding requirements or issues, so you can successfully translate them into code</li><li>Familiarity or experience working in an agile environment</li><li>Understanding of the financial market domain, preferably from working in trading, banking, exchanges, or clearing is a bonus<br><br></li></ul><em>Benefits Highlights<br><br></em>Gelber offers a wide range of benefits to full-time employees in order to meet you and your covered dependents needs. Our comprehensive benefits offering includes:<br><ul><li>Traditional and Roth 401(k) retirement program with discretionary employer match</li><li>Comprehensive health benefits including medical coverage provided by Blue Cross and Blue Shield (PPO and HDHP/HSA) and dental coverage; generous employer cost-sharing</li><li>Tuition reimbursement for Undergraduate and Graduate courses</li><li>Flexible Spending Accounts for health care and dependent care; pre-tax commuter benefits for parking and transit expenses</li><li>Life insurance and long-term disability coverage</li><li>Health club membership with on-site facilities (and reciprocal memberships)</li><li>Generous vacation time (15-day accrual in first full calendar year of employment; prorated accrual in initial year), paid holidays, and paid maternity/paternity leave</li><li>Weekly catered lunches and monthly continental breakfasts</li><li>Social events including sponsored 5k races and annual holiday party</li><li>Enjoyable work environment including a game room (foosball, ping pong, Golden Tee)</li><li>Employee referral bonus program</li><li>Charitable giving and company matching opportunities</li><li>Casual, relaxed dress code<br><br></li></ul><em>If you are based in California, we encourage you to read the Gelber Privacy Notice for California Employees and Applicants, linked</em> <em>here</em><em>.</em>

description: <p><strong>Title:</strong> SI Cloud Automation Developer </p><p> <strong>Location:</strong> Remote, USA</p><p> <strong>Job Type:</strong> 12 months (with possible extension)</p><p> <strong>Visa Type:&nbsp;</strong>USC OR GC (<strong>W2 Only</strong>)</p><p><br></p><p><strong>Job Responsibilities:</strong></p><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience designing and implementing solutions in Oracle Service Bus and/or IBM Datapower </li><li>Able to perform deployments into dev, test, and production environment with appropriate test and post-change validation plans</li><li>Able to work with automation, build, and code management tools (Ansible, WLST/Python, Jenkins, GitHub)</li><li>Experience diagnosing and troubleshooting OSB and Weblogic deployments and connections to other common application stack services (Kafka, ODBC, WebServices) over both 1-way and 2-way SSL connections</li><li>Familiar with team documentation and task management tool (Wiki’s, Jira)</li></ul><p><br></p>

title: QA Engineer-Manual
description: <strong><u><span>Senior Lease Admin Analyst</span> </u> <br></strong>  <br> <span> Location: Deerfield, IL/ Hybrid</span> <br> <span> Duration: 6 months with possible contract to hire</span> <br>  <br> <strong> <span> Description:</span> <br></strong> <span> Summary:</span> <br> <span> The main function of a legal secretary paralegal is to assist lawyers by researching legal precedent, investigating facts, or preparing legal documents. A typical paralegal is responsible for conducting research to support a legal proceeding, formulate a defense or to initiate legal action. </span> <br>  <br> <strong> <span> Job Responsibilities: </span> <br></strong> <span> - Prepare legal documents, including briefs, pleading, appeals, wills, contracts, and real estate closing statements. </span> <br> <span> - Prepare affidavits or other documents, maintain document file, and file pleadings with court clerk. </span> <br> <span> - Gather and analyze research data, such as statutes, decisions, and legal articles, codes, and documents. </span> <br> <span> - Investigate facts and law of cases to determine causes of action and to prepare cases. </span> <br> <span> - Direct and coordinate law office activity, including delivery of subpoenas. </span> <br>  <br> <strong> <span> Skills: </span> <br></strong> <span> - Verbal and written communication skills, attention to detail, customer service and interpersonal skills. </span> <br> <span> - Ability to work independently and manage ones time. </span> <br> <span> - Basic mentoring skills necessary to provide support and constructive performance feedback. </span> <br> <span> - Knowledge of laws, legal codes, court procedures, precedents, government regulations, and the democratic political process. </span> <br> <span> - Previous experience with computer applications, such as Microsoft Word, PowerPoint and Excel.</span> <br>  <br> <strong> <span> Education/Experience: </span> <br></strong> <span> - Bachelor's degree in legal studies or equivalent training required. </span> <br> <span> - 5-7 years experience required.</span> <br>  <br> <span> Responsible for auditing and approving lease-related expenses according to WAG procedures and policies. Ensures compliance with WAG policies and procedures and SOX-related compliance policies. Supports internal/external audits. Completes thorough and detailed audits and reviews of lease related invoices and expenses to evaluate landlord compliance to applicable leases, the accuracy of financial information, and the effectiveness and efficiency of management controls. Responsible for special project analysis, landlord default resolution, and providing direction, guidance, and training of Service Provider staff.</span> <br> <span> - Verifies obligation and approves disbursements for lease-related expenses processed by Service Provider, such as rent, common area maintenance, insurance, utilities. </span> <br> <span> - Interprets lease language, abstracts leases, and translates information to summarize payment obligations within lease database. Works with multiple departments to ensure the proper handling of Client legal obligations under the terms of the lease contracts. </span> <br> <span> - Ensure accurate monthly lease payments. </span> <br> <span> - Review and approve Service Provider updates to lease dates and general terms, including lease modifications, extensions, and terminations. </span> <br> <span> - Provides accurate and timely response to internal and external partners, including Landlords, Property Managers, Real Estate Law, Real Estate, Store Operations, Tax, Accounting, etc. </span> <br> <span> - Works on special projects and plays an integral part in improving systems, processes, and creating efficiencies to enhance the Real Estate management process for Company and Service Provider. </span> <br>  <br> <strong> <span> Education &amp; Experience Type of Experience:</span> <br></strong> <span> - A2 - BA/BS + at least 1 years OR High School/ GED + at least 4 years </span> <br> <span> - Bachelors Degree and at least 1 year of experience as a paralegal or in accounting, finance, business management or auditing, or </span> <br> <span> - High School Diploma/GED and at least 4 years of experience as a paralegal or in accounting, finance, business management or auditing.</span>

title: Hybrid C++Developer
description: <ul><li>Flex Time - OT pay on top of competitive base salary|401K, profit sharing, and continuous growth opportunities<br><br><br></li></ul><strong>About Our Client<br><br></strong>My client is one the tech sector of a conglomeration of companies (other sects include accountancy and equipment leasing) and needs a strong candidate to help in a wide variety of forward-facing projects. The tech team works in 3 different businesses: 1) Enterprise development, 2) contracting out developers to clients depending on needs, and 3) implementations and integration. Most projects they have are in React and .NET with SQL servers. Due to the consultancy work, having a more diverse tech stack is a plus. The compensation for this role given the experience is a little on the lower end, but they make up for it in Flex Hours which pays OT for all time worked over the standard 8 hours/day. 8 hours/day on a $100k salary comes out to $100k/year, but 9 hours/day is 112,500 annually and so on. If you're ambitious to grow your career by working more than 40 hours a week, this job is for you.<br><br><strong>This role requires coming into the office 2 days a week.<br><br></strong><strong>The candidate for this role must be a US citizen or Green Card holder. Since this is an urgent hire, the client will not be able to provide visa sponsorship.<br><br></strong><strong>Job Description<br><br></strong>The successful Software Engineer will:<br><ul><li>Architect and develop custom enterprise applications using the Microsoft technology stack and the Angular (or React) framework.</li><li>Lead architecture discussions and documentation around application design and development.</li><li>Manage development teams and support of applications.</li><li>Deploy systems to various production and pre-production environments and troubleshoot issues.</li><li>Create technical documentation such as design documents, specifications, software architecture documents, and instructions.</li><li>Regularly communicate with product owners and interpret requirements.</li><li>Work in a team environment using agile development processes and deliver work on time and within budget.</li><li>Follow up with issues in an efficient manner, including working hand-in-hand with Quality Assurance, Project Management, and/or senior developers.</li><li>Regularly communicate project progress, issues, and risks to team and managers.</li><li>Handle code reviews and quality checks.</li><li>Continue to learn and adapt to new languages and technologies.<br><br></li></ul><strong>This role requires coming into the office 2 days a week.<br><br></strong><strong>The candidate for this role must be a US citizen or Green Card holder. Since this is an urgent hire, the client will not be able to provide visa sponsorship.<br><br></strong><em>MPI does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, or based on an individual's status in any group or class protected by applicable federal, state or local law. MPI encourages applications from minorities, women, the disabled, protected veterans and all other qualified applicants.<br><br></em><strong>The Successful Applicant<br><br></strong>The successful Software Engineer has:<br><ul><li>Bachelor's degree or higher in a related field.</li><li>Minimum of 5 years' working experience and strong understanding and exposure to Microsoft .NET. and React</li><li>Minimum of 5 years' working experience and strong understanding and exposure to MS SQL Server and SQL coding.</li><li>Experience in WPF would be a plus</li><li>Strong working experience in responsive website design.</li><li>Working experience in agile development and Microsoft DevOps (or other tools such as JIRA).</li><li>Microsoft Certifications in related areas is a plus.</li><li>Master's degree in technology-related areas is a plus.<br><br></li></ul><strong>This role requires coming into the office 2 days a week.<br><br></strong><strong>The candidate for this role must be a US citizen or Green Card holder. Since this is an urgent hire, the client will not be able to provide visa sponsorship.<br><br></strong><strong>What's On Offer<br><br></strong>What's on offer for a successful Software Engineer?<br><ul><li>Competitive salary ranging from $120K - $145K on the base (not including yearly bonus &amp; flex-time OT pay)</li><li>Flex Time - OT pay after the 40-hour workweek</li><li>Performance Bonus</li><li>Comprehensive Medical, Dental, Vision &amp; Basic Life Insurance.</li><li>401K and Profit Sharing (starting at 3%)</li><li>Continuing Education</li><li>Fitness Program</li><li>Emerging Tech</li><li>Short-term/Long-term disability coverage.</li><li>Flexible Time Off Program.<br><br></li></ul><strong>This role requires coming into the office 2 days a week.<br><br></strong><strong>The candidate for this role must be a US citizen or Green Card holder. Since this is an urgent hire, the client will not be able to provide visa sponsorship.<br><br></strong><strong>Contact: Emily Bodett<br><br></strong><strong>Quote job ref: JN-052023-6063665</strong>
