The compensation for this role given the experience is a little on the lower end, but they make up for it in Flex Hours which pays OT for all time worked over the standard 8 hours/day. 8 hours/day on a $100k salary comes out to $100k/year, but 9 hours/day is 112,500 annually and so on. If you're ambitious to grow your career by working more than 40 hours a week, this job is for you.<br><br><strong>This role requires coming into the office 2 days a week.<br><br></strong><strong>The candidate for this role must be a US citizen or Green Card holder. Since this is an urgent hire, the client will not be able to provide visa sponsorship.<br><br></strong><strong>Job Description<br><br></strong>The successful Software Engineer will:<br><ul><li>Architect and develop custom enterprise applications using the Microsoft technology stack and the Angular (or React) framework.</li><li>Lead architecture discussions and documentation around application design and development.</li><li>Manage development teams and support of applications.</li><li>Deploy systems to various production and pre-production environments and troubleshoot issues.</li><li>Create technical documentation such as design documents, specifications, software architecture documents, and instructions.</li><li>Regularly communicate with product owners and interpret requirements.</li><li>Work in a team environment using agile development processes and deliver work on time and within budget.</li><li>Follow up with issues in an efficient manner, including working hand-in-hand with Quality Assurance, Project Management, and/or senior developers.</li><li>Regularly communicate project progress, issues, and risks to team and managers.</li><li>Handle code reviews and quality checks.</li><li>Continue to learn and adapt to new languages and technologies.<br><br></li></ul><strong>This role requires coming into the office 2 days a week.<br><br></strong><strong>The candidate for this role must be a US citizen or Green Card holder. Since this is an urgent hire, the client will not be able to provide visa sponsorship.<br><br></strong><em>MPI does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, marital status, or based on an individual's status in any group or class protected by applicable federal, state or local law. MPI encourages applications from minorities, women, the disabled, protected veterans and all other qualified applicants.<br><br></em><strong>The Successful Applicant<br><br></strong>The successful Software Engineer has:<br><ul><li>Bachelor's degree or higher in a related field.</li><li>Minimum of 5 years' working experience and strong understanding and exposure to Microsoft .NET. and React</li><li>Minimum of 5 years' working experience and strong understanding and exposure to MS SQL Server and SQL coding.</li><li>Experience in WPF would be a plus</li><li>Strong working experience in responsive website design.</li><li>Working experience in agile development and Microsoft DevOps (or other tools such as JIRA).</li><li>Microsoft Certifications in related areas is a plus.</li><li>Master's degree in technology-related areas is a plus.<br><br></li></ul><strong>This role requires coming into the office 2 days a week.<br><br></strong><strong>The candidate for this role must be a US citizen or Green Card holder. Since this is an urgent hire, the client will not be able to provide visa sponsorship.<br><br></strong><strong>What's On Offer<br><br></strong>What's on offer for a successful Software Engineer?<br><ul><li>Competitive salary ranging from $120K - $145K on the base (not including yearly bonus &amp; flex-time OT pay)</li><li>Flex Time - OT pay after the 40-hour workweek</li><li>Performance Bonus</li><li>Comprehensive Medical, Dental, Vision &amp; Basic Life Insurance.</li><li>401K and Profit Sharing (starting at 3%)</li><li>Continuing Education</li><li>Fitness Program</li><li>Emerging Tech</li><li>Short-term/Long-term disability coverage.</li><li>Flexible Time Off Program.<br><br></li></ul><strong>This role requires coming into the office 2 days a week.<br><br></strong><strong>The candidate for this role must be a US citizen or Green Card holder. Since this is an urgent hire, the client will not be able to provide visa sponsorship.<br><br></strong><strong>Contact: Emily Bodett<br><br></strong><strong>Quote job ref: JN-052023-6063665</strong>

title: Software Engineer - Freelance [Remote]
description: <strong>Requisition ID: R10112919<br></strong><ul><li> Category: Business Management </li><li> Location: Rolling Meadows, IL, USA </li><li> Citizenship Required: United States Citizenship </li><li> Clearance Type: None </li><li> Telecommute: No- Teleworking not available for this position </li><li> Shift: 1st Shift (United States of America) </li><li> Travel Required: No </li></ul> At Northrop Grumman, our employees have incredible opportunities to work on revolutionary systems that impact people's lives around the world today, and for generations to come. Our pioneering and inventive spirit has enabled us to be at the forefront of many technological advancements in our nation's history - from the first flight across the Atlantic Ocean, to stealth bombers, to landing on the moon. We look for people who have bold new ideas, courage and a pioneering spirit to join forces to invent the future, and have fun along the way. Our culture thrives on intellectual curiosity, cognitive diversity and bringing your whole self to work - and we have an insatiable drive to do what others think is impossible. Our employees are not only part of history, they're making history.<br><br>At the heart of Defining Possible is our commitment to missions. In rapidly changing global security environments, Northrop Grumman brings informed insights and software-secure technology to enable strategic planning. We're looking for innovators who can help us keep building on our wide portfolio of secure, affordable, integrated, and multi-domain systems and technologies that fuel those missions. By joining in our shared mission, we'll support yours of expanding your personal network and developing skills, whether you are new to the field or an industry thought-leader. At Northrop Grumman, you'll have the resources, support, and team to do some of the best work of your career.<br><br><strong> Northrop Grumman is seeking a Business Management Analyst </strong>. This position will be located at our Mission Systems Sector in <strong>Rolling Meadows, IL</strong><strong> . </strong>This position will be in the Pathways rotational program where there will be three rotation opportunities within Business Management.<br><br>The qualified candidate will become part of Northrop Grumman's Business Management organization.<br><br>Responsibilities are in more than one of the following business management areas: Contracts, Investments, Payroll, Tax, Finance and Accounting or Auditing.<br><br><strong><u>Basic Qualifications<br><br></u></strong>This requisition may be filled at either a level 1 or a level 2. Basic qualifications for a Business Analyst 1 are a Bachelor's Degree. Basic qualifications for a Business Analyst 2 are a Master's Degree.<br><br>A candidate must meet ALL of the below criteria. The candidate must:<br><ul><li>Be completing or has completed their degree (Bachelor's, Master's, or PhD) from an accredited institution</li><li>Be majoring in or having majored in a Business Degree (Finance, Accounting, Business Administration, Management, etc).</li><li>Have an overall cumulative GPA of 3.0/4.0 or higher (unofficial academic transcripts must be provided at time of application by uploading the documents to your application or profile)</li><li>Be able to obtain a U.S. Government security clearance (U.S. citizenship is a pre-requisite)</li></ul><strong> Preferred Qualifications: <br></strong><ul><li>Have an overall cumulative GPA of 3.70/4.0 or higher</li></ul> <strong>Salary Range: </strong> $63,800 USD - $67,200 USD<br><br><strong>Salary Range 2: </strong> $75,600 USD - $81,300 USD<br><br>Employees may be eligible for a discretionary bonus in addition to base pay. Annual bonuses are designed to reward individual contributions as well as allow employees to share in company results. Employees in Vice President or Director positions may be eligible for Long Term Incentives. In addition, Northrop Grumman provides a variety of benefits including health insurance coverage, life and disability insurance, savings plan, Company paid holidays and paid time off (PTO) for vacation and/or personal business.<br><br><strong>The health and safety of our employees and their families is a top priority</strong>. The company encourages employees to remain up-to-date on their COVID-19 vaccinations. U.S. Northrop Grumman employees may be required, in the future, to be vaccinated or have an approved disability/medical or religious accommodation, pursuant to future court decisions and/or government action on the currently stayed federal contractor vaccine mandate under Executive Order 14042 https://www.saferfederalworkforce.gov/contractors/ .<br><br>Northrop Grumman is committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We are proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer, making decisions without regard to race, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, national origin, age, veteran status, disability, or any other protected class. For our complete EEO/AA and Pay Transparency statement, please visit http://www.northropgrumman.com/EEO . U.S. Citizenship is required for most positions.

title: IT Engineer Platform
description: We are building a new team to focus on the Golang programming language and its ecosystem on Ubuntu. They will deliver the best possible Golang runtime, developer experience and supporting tooling in Ubuntu. We are keen to ensure that the cutting edge of modern programming languages innovation is available to Ubuntu users, to lay the foundation for future inventions and open source communities.<br><br>This is an exciting opportunity for a software engineer passionate about open source software, Linux systems, software architectures and Go programming language. Come build a rewarding, meaningful career working with the best and brightest people in technology at Canonical, a growing international software company and make Ubuntu the best operating system to develop and run Go applications in the cloud, in datacenters, in containers, directly on the operating system, and anywhere Ubuntu can run.<br><br>The Ubuntu Foundations Team delivers the core Ubuntu system, the base for the entire Ubuntu family of products and services. Ubuntu strives to deliver the latest-best free software components, in an easy to use and highly reliable form. We build on the technical excellence of Debian and bring additional focus and shape to the solutions we offer the industry.<br><br>Part of the Ubuntu Foundations team, you will work on some of the most critical toolchains involved in the making of Ubuntu but also pillars of the modern software ecosystem. You will leverage your experience and passion in Go to make Ubuntu the best platform to develop, distribute and consume software built with Go. Applicants will be passionate about the future of Go, of Ubuntu, mindful of the dynamics of the open-source ecosystem, and equally aware of the needs of large but innovative organizations. Applicants will drive best in class integration in Ubuntu from desktop to cloud in a secure, reliable, performing, efficient and future-proof fashion.<br><br>You will be discussing design with other team members and mentor less senior engineers and participate in code reviews and design reviews. You will also be working with other teams to ensure architecture decisions improve the overall performance and experience of Ubuntu. Your role as part of the Ubuntu Foundations team will have an impact on every aspect of Ubuntu from Desktop, Server, Ubuntu Core and also cloud images.<br><br>What you will do<br><ul><li>Collaborate proactively with a distributed team</li><li>Select, integrate and package best-of-breed tooling with Ubuntu to improve developer and operator experience with Go</li><li>Write high-quality code to create new features</li><li>Debug issues and produce high-quality code to fix them</li><li>Review code produced by other engineers</li><li>Discuss ideas and collaborate on finding good solutions</li><li>Work from home with global travel 2 to 4 weeks a year for internal and external events<br><br></li></ul>Who you are<br><ul><li>You love technology and working with brilliant people</li><li>You are passionate, curious, flexible, articulate, and accountable</li><li>You are a long-time Linux user</li><li>You have experience or are interested in learning how to package software for Debian and Ubuntu</li><li>You have relevant Go experience, ideally in the world of cloud-native software and Linux</li><li>You have a Bachelors or equivalent in Computer Science, STEM or similar degree</li><li>You value soft skills and are passionate, enterprising, thoughtful, and self-motivated<br><br></li></ul>Canonical is a growing international software company that works with the open-source community to deliver Ubuntu, the world's best free software platform. Our services help businesses worldwide reduce costs, improve efficiency and enhance security with Ubuntu.<br><br><em>We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity we will give your application fair consideration.<br><br></em>

title: Software Project Engineer
description: Job TitleContainer Developer<p><br></p>Relevant Experience<p><br></p>(in Yrs)4+<p><br></p>Technical/Functional Skills<p><br></p><ul><li>Linux/Unix experience</li><li>Knowledge of hosting docker images on any container orchestration tool, e.g K8S, Openshift, etc</li><li>Strong knowledge of Maven, Gradle and Native docker commands</li><li>Strong analytical and problem solving skills</li><li>Excellent communication and interpersonal skills</li><li>Languages like Go, Python or Scala</li><li>Excellent knowledge of Cloud Technology and Microservices</li><li>Knowledge of Linux software packaging, distribution, and configuration</li><li>Ability to work independently and as part of a team</li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Experience RequiredMinimum 5-8 Years</u></strong><p><br></p>Roles &amp; Responsibilities<p><br></p><ul><li>Package management of application using docker builds using maven/gradle.</li><li>Externalizing dependencies on docker using persistent volume claims.</li><li>Management of trust store and keystores using docker.</li><li>Expose services hosted on K8S using ISTIO ingress.</li><li>Versioning of docker images and storing them in repository ( ACR).</li><li>Housekeeping of SNAPSHOTs and Release docker image</li></ul><p><br></p>EducationBachelors or Masters with Majors in Science, EE, IT, CS, ECE etc<p><br></p>Start date (dd-mmm-yy)01-Apr-2023<p><br></p>Duration of assignment (in Months)12+ Months<p><br></p>Work Location (State, City and Zip)Deerfield IL<p><br></p>Key words to search in resumeContainer, Kubernetes, AKS

title: Embedded Software Engineer
description: <strong>Your opportunity<br></strong>If you believe product security should be a collaboration with developers instead of conflict and enjoy establishing trusted partnerships with software developers to ensure security is a frictionless part of DevOps... joining the New Relic Product Security Assurance team may be for you. Our Product Assurance team is responsible for executing our Secure Developer Experience roadmap. This program is designed to build frictionless AppSec processes for our 100+ software engineering teams. We believe that by working closely with developers, we can create a more secure development environment that does not add unnecessary overhead.<br><br>New Relic is dedicated to supporting new members. We have a broad mix of experience levels, tenures, and prior experience, and we’re building an environment that celebrates collaboration, and mentorship. Our team also puts a high value on work-life balance. Striking a healthy balance between your personal and professional life is crucial to your happiness and success, which is why we’re happy to offer a flexible schedule so you can have a more productive and well-balanced life—both in and outside of work.<br><br>In the future, some travel will be required (up to 10%).<br><br>We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.<br><br><strong>What you'll do<br></strong><ul><li> Perform threat modeling, design and security reviews for complex and high value applications and services, identifying and preventing security and privacy errors early in development.</li><li>Build trusted relationships with product engineering teams, developers, and architects, establishing yourself as a security authority with deep understanding of their roadmap and priorities.</li><li>Collaborate with our architecture and standards teams to ensure that we are meeting the common needs of our engineering teams and that we are able to scale our support for them.</li><li>Address software security risks in novel ways by applying technology, automation, relationships, and culture. We work in a continuous deployment, cloud-based environment and adapt our security efforts to the processes and technologies New Relic uses to deliver innovative and best-in-class products.</li><li>Monitor our static and dynamic application security testing efforts and custom monitoring tools for suspicious activity and run incident response when required.</li><li>Work with software engineers to identify and analyze security vulnerabilities and follow through with issues until resolution.<br><br></li></ul><strong>This role requires<br></strong><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or equivalent practical education and experience.</li><li>6+ years application security engineering experience<br><br></li></ul><strong>Bonus points if you have<br><br></strong>Our team focuses on diversity of all types, and strives to hire people with different experiences and perspectives. To that end, we know that no individual has every desired skill and experience, but it is all of us together which make the team strong.<br><ul><li>Ability to explain and advise on security design and implementation of complex security problems, including the ability to dive into code reviews with developers.</li><li>Highly proficient with SDLC frameworks and delivering security reviews including code review, threat modeling, static and dynamic analysis (SAST, DAST), and attack surface analysis.</li><li>Demonstrated experience with cloud and web application security assessment. Penetration testing or red team experience is helpful but not required.</li><li>Inclusive communication skills that effectively align and create clarity; you will collaborate with technical and nontechnical audiences at all levels of the business from individual contributors to executive leaders.</li><li>Confidence in navigating ambiguity and identifying innovative solutions with minimal direction.</li><li>Demonstrated ability to work autonomously with a bias for action, critical and creative thinking, while also being an effective member of a team.</li><li>Experience securing applications built in Azure, AWS, or Google Cloud</li><li>Programming and/or vulnerability research experience in one or more languages (such as: Ruby, Java, Go, Python)<br><br></li></ul>We're looking for bold and passionate people to be a part of our mission to help every engineer do their best work, every day, using data, not opinions, at every stage of the software lifecycle. We'd love to have you apply, even if you don't feel you meet every single requirement. What's most important to us is finding authentic and accountable people who feel connected to our mission and values, not just candidates who check off all the boxes.<br><br>We believe in empowering all Relics to achieve professional and business success through a workforce model called <em>Flex First. Flex First</em> allows us to work in a variety of workplaces that best support our success, including fully office-based, fully remote, or hybrid.<br><br>Read more about <em>Flex First.<br><br></em><strong>Our hiring process<br><br></strong>Please note that visa sponsorship is not available for this position.<br><br>In compliance with applicable law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work and to complete employment eligibility verification. Note: Our stewardship of the data of thousands of customers’ means that a criminal background check is required to join New Relic.<br><br>We will consider qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records based on individual circumstances and in accordance with applicable law including, but not limited to, the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.<br><br>Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this website or directly to managers. New Relic does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes, and will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with New Relic.<br><br>New Relic is an equal opportunity employer. We eagerly seek applicants of diverse background and hire without regard to race, color, gender identity, religion, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, physical abilities (or disability), age, sexual orientation, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.<br><br>Interested in the details of our privacy policy? Read more here.<br><br>Estimated Base Pay Range: $ 150,000 - $ 188,000<br><br>Consistent with New Relic's values and applicable law, we provide the following information to promote pay transparency and equity. The base pay range above represents a good faith estimate of the low and high end base pay range for the listed position. This role may be eligible for the corporate bonus plan (or, if a sales role, a commission plan as defined in the sales incentive plan document), participation in our stock equity plan, short- and long-term incentives, and other department-specific awards that may be applicable. In addition, New Relic provides a variety of benefits to employees. The range provided may also represent candidate ranges and may not reflect the full range or geographic differential for an individual tenured employee.<br><br>

Please contact us to request accommodation.<br><br><strong>What you'll do<br></strong><ul><li> Perform threat modeling, design and security reviews for complex and high value applications and services, identifying and preventing security and privacy errors early in development.</li><li>Build trusted relationships with product engineering teams, developers, and architects, establishing yourself as a security authority with deep understanding of their roadmap and priorities.</li><li>Collaborate with our architecture and standards teams to ensure that we are meeting the common needs of our engineering teams and that we are able to scale our support for them.</li><li>Address software security risks in novel ways by applying technology, automation, relationships, and culture. We work in a continuous deployment, cloud-based environment and adapt our security efforts to the processes and technologies New Relic uses to deliver innovative and best-in-class products.</li><li>Monitor our static and dynamic application security testing efforts and custom monitoring tools for suspicious activity and run incident response when required.</li><li>Work with software engineers to identify and analyze security vulnerabilities and follow through with issues until resolution.<br><br></li></ul><strong>This role requires<br></strong><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or equivalent practical education and experience.</li><li>6+ years application security engineering experience<br><br></li></ul><strong>Bonus points if you have<br><br></strong>Our team focuses on diversity of all types, and strives to hire people with different experiences and perspectives. To that end, we know that no individual has every desired skill and experience, but it is all of us together which make the team strong.<br><ul><li>Ability to explain and advise on security design and implementation of complex security problems, including the ability to dive into code reviews with developers.</li><li>Highly proficient with SDLC frameworks and delivering security reviews including code review, threat modeling, static and dynamic analysis (SAST, DAST), and attack surface analysis.</li><li>Demonstrated experience with cloud and web application security assessment. Penetration testing or red team experience is helpful but not required.</li><li>Inclusive communication skills that effectively align and create clarity; you will collaborate with technical and nontechnical audiences at all levels of the business from individual contributors to executive leaders.</li><li>Confidence in navigating ambiguity and identifying innovative solutions with minimal direction.</li><li>Demonstrated ability to work autonomously with a bias for action, critical and creative thinking, while also being an effective member of a team.</li><li>Experience securing applications built in Azure, AWS, or Google Cloud</li><li>Programming and/or vulnerability research experience in one or more languages (such as: Ruby, Java, Go, Python)<br><br></li></ul>We're looking for bold and passionate people to be a part of our mission to help every engineer do their best work, every day, using data, not opinions, at every stage of the software lifecycle. We'd love to have you apply, even if you don't feel you meet every single requirement. What's most important to us is finding authentic and accountable people who feel connected to our mission and values, not just candidates who check off all the boxes.<br><br>We believe in empowering all Relics to achieve professional and business success through a workforce model called <em>Flex First. Flex First</em> allows us to work in a variety of workplaces that best support our success, including fully office-based, fully remote, or hybrid.<br><br>Read more about <em>Flex First.<br><br></em><strong>Our hiring process<br><br></strong>Please note that visa sponsorship is not available for this position.<br><br>In compliance with applicable law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work and to complete employment eligibility verification. Note: Our stewardship of the data of thousands of customers’ means that a criminal background check is required to join New Relic.<br><br>We will consider qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records based on individual circumstances and in accordance with applicable law including, but not limited to, the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.<br><br>Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this website or directly to managers. New Relic does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes, and will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with New Relic.<br><br>New Relic is an equal opportunity employer. We eagerly seek applicants of diverse background and hire without regard to race, color, gender identity, religion, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, physical abilities (or disability), age, sexual orientation, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.<br><br>Interested in the details of our privacy policy? Read more here.<br><br>Estimated Base Pay Range: $ 150,000 - $ 188,000<br><br>Consistent with New Relic's values and applicable law, we provide the following information to promote pay transparency and equity. The base pay range above represents a good faith estimate of the low and high end base pay range for the listed position. This role may be eligible for the corporate bonus plan (or, if a sales role, a commission plan as defined in the sales incentive plan document), participation in our stock equity plan, short- and long-term incentives, and other department-specific awards that may be applicable. In addition, New Relic provides a variety of benefits to employees. The range provided may also represent candidate ranges and may not reflect the full range or geographic differential for an individual tenured employee.<br><br>

title: Microsoft Full Stack Engineer - Professional
description: <strong>ABOUT US</strong>:<br><br>Braintrust is a user-owned talent network that connects you with great jobs with no fees or membership costs—so you keep 100% of what you earn.<br><br><strong>ABOUT THE HIRING PROCESS:<br><br></strong>When you join Braintrust, you will be invited to a screening process for Braintrust to learn more about your previous work experiences. Once completed, you will have access to the employer for this role and other top companies that seek high-quality talent. Apply to this job to kick off the process.<br><ul><li>JOB TYPE: Direct Hire Position (no agencies/C2C - see notes below)</li><li>LOCATION: Remote - United States</li><li>SALARY: $125,000 – $160,000/yr</li><li>ESTIMATED DURATION: 40hr/week - Long term<br><br></li></ul><strong>THE OPPORTUNITY<br><br></strong><strong>Requirements<br><br></strong><strong>Required Qualifications <br></strong><ul><li>5+ years technical software experience </li><li>Proficiency with fundamental front-end languages such as HTML, CSS, and JavaScript</li><li>Proficiency with server-side languages such as PHP</li><li>Proficiency with database technology such as SQL Server and MySQL</li><li>Database design and management, including being up on the latest practices and associated versions</li><li>Strong understanding of software architecture, data structures, and computer science fundamentals </li><li>Strong security background (comfortable working with PII/sensitive data)</li><li>Experience with agile and fast-paced software development methodologies </li><li>Strong organizational, project management, and communication skills</li><li>Good problem-solving skills</li><li>Attention to detail<br><br></li></ul><strong>Preferred Qualifications<br></strong><ul><li>Prior experience working and communicating directly with clients</li><li>Laravel and Node.js experience helpful</li><li>Familiarity with CSS preprocessors, bundlers, and associated languages/syntaxes/libraries (e.g., Sass, Less, and webpack)</li><li>An eye for design and user experience</li><li>Technical literacy and hands-on experience across the software stack, infrastructure, and dev-ops</li><li>Knowledge of Enterprise HR systems (WorkDay, SuccessFactors, Oracle, SAP)</li><li>Proficiency with Git</li><li>Appreciation for clean and well documented code</li></ul> <strong><strong>What you’ll be working on<br><br></strong></strong>Full Stack Software Engineer, you will be working on the design, architecture, development, and innovation of customized HR software for some of the world’s most sophisticated companies. You will use PHP, SQL, JavaScript, and CSS to deploy software quickly to meet their needs. Our work is fast-paced, creative, and flexible–your days will be too! You will spend time problem solving with clients live, helping them see the range of what’s possible, building what they need, and working directly with HR experts. You will work alongside client team-members and thrive on the responsibility to own large projects from conceptualization to sunset.<br><br><strong>Responsibilities<br></strong><ul><li>Build the software development process from conception to deployment </li><li>Maintaining and upgrading the software following deployment </li><li>Managing the end-to-end life cycle for the production of software and applications </li><li>Modifying and testing changes to previously developed applications </li><li>Deliver high quality code in a fast and efficient manner </li><li>Must be fluent in all things PHP, MySQL, and Javascript </li><li>Develop front-end and back-end software using PHP/MySQL and HTML/Javascript/CSS with Vue.js or React.js </li><li>Identify and mitigate end-to-end security concerns </li><li>Ensuring the entire stack is designed and built for speed and scalability </li><li>Mentoring other engineers </li><li>Work across the organization to foster a culture of architecture that allows for iterative, autonomous development and future scaling. <br><br></li></ul><strong>Apply Now!<br><br></strong>Braintrust Job ID: 6496<br><br>C2C Candidates: This role is not available to C2C candidates working with an agency. If you are a professional contractor who has created an LLC/corp around their consulting practice, this is well aligned with Braintrust and we’d welcome your application.<br><br>Braintrust values the multitude of talents and perspectives that a diverse workforce brings. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or protected veteran status.

title: Software Engineer - Trading Systems
description: <strong>Object Technology Solutions, Inc</strong> <strong>(OTSI)</strong> has an immediate opening for a SI Cloud Automation Developer<br><br>SI CLOUD AUTOMATION DEVELOPER – (ONSITE – COOK-CHICAGO, IL)<br><br><strong>Major Responsibilites<br></strong><ul><li>Familiar with team documentation and task management tool (Wiki’s, Jira) <br><br></li></ul><strong>Skills And Abilities Required<br></strong><ul><li>Able to perform deployments into dev, test, and production environment with appropriate test and post-change validation plans </li><li>Able to work with automation, build, and code management tools (Ansible, WLST/Python, Jenkins, GitHub) <br><br></li></ul><strong>Qualifications And Experience<br></strong><ul><li>Experience diagnosing and troubleshooting OSB and Weblogic deployments and connections to other common application stack services (Kafka, ODBC, WebServices) over both 1-way and 2-way SSL connections </li><li>Experience designing and implementing solutions in Oracle Service Bus and/or IBM Datapower <br><br></li></ul><strong>About Us<br><br></strong>OTSI is a leading global technology company offering solutions, consulting, and managed services for businesses worldwide since 1999. OTSI serves clients from its 15 offices across 6 countries around the globe with a “Follow-the-Sun” model. Headquartered in Overland Park, Kansas, we have a strong presence in North America, Central America, and Asia-Pacific with a Global Delivery Center based in India. These strategic locations offer our customers the competitive advantages of onshore, nearshore, and offshore engagement and delivery options, with 24/7 support. OTSI works with 100+ enterprise customers, of which many are Fortune ranked, OTSI focuses on industry segments such as Banking, Financial Services &amp; Insurance, Healthcare &amp; Life Sciences, Energy &amp; Utilities, Communications &amp; Media Entertainment, Engineering &amp; Telecom, Retail &amp; Consumer Services, Hi-tech, Manufacturing, Engineering, transport logistics, Government, Defense &amp; PSUs.<br><br><strong>Our Center Of Excellence<br></strong><ul><li> Data &amp; Analytics</li><li> Digital Transformation</li><li> QA &amp; Automation</li><li> Enterprise Applications</li><li> Disruptive Technologies</li></ul>

title: IT Engineer Platform
description: <strong>Top Trading Software Shop - Hiring Software Engineers</strong><p><br></p>This Jobot Job is hosted by: Ryan Kilroy<p><br></p>Are you a fit? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply Now" button and sending us your resume.<p><br></p>Salary: $120,000 - $200,000 per year<p><br></p><strong>A bit about us:</strong><p><br></p>We are a dynamic FinTech company in the growth stage, backed by investors, and dedicated to providing exceptional software and brokerage services to hundreds of thousands of traders worldwide. We are passionate about empowering active traders to analyze and respond to data from the world's leading financial markets. Headquartered in Chicago, we foster a unique and employee-centric company culture that is inviting, comfortable, and enjoyable.<p><br></p>We are currently seeking a talented and motivated individual to join our development team. In this role, you will collaborate closely with our skilled developers to design, build, and deploy robust back-end server solutions capable of handling and distributing large volumes of data. Your responsibilities will include writing code, creating automated unit tests, and ensuring the smooth deployment of your software onto production systems. We expect you to be proactive, self-driven, and well-versed in current programming languages and technologies. Furthermore, you will be accountable for the quality, uptime, and resilience of the applications you develop. Effective communication with team members and stakeholders will be crucial to your success.<p><br></p><strong>Why join us?</strong><p><br></p>Job Responsibilities:<p><br></p>Develop real-time applications capable of managing and processing substantial data volumes.<p><br></p>Oversee the entire software lifecycle, including development, testing, reviewing, deployment, and maintenance.<p><br></p>Work within an agile environment to deliver solutions efficiently.<p><br></p>Maintain direct contact with project managers to facilitate successful project delivery<p><br></p><strong>Job Details</strong><p><br></p>Key Position Requirements:<p><br></p>Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science.<p><br></p>At least 3 years of experience in software development, including designing, implementing, testing, and maintaining real-time applications.<p><br></p>Proficiency in Java (knowledge of Scala is a plus).<p><br></p>Professional experience with Kubernetes and cloud services like Google Cloud Platform.<p><br></p>Reliable team player with a strong work ethic, exceptional accuracy, and excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.<p><br></p>Comfortable dealing with uncertainty and effectively communicating for issue resolution.<p><br></p>Ability to take full ownership of projects, from design and implementation to testing, deployment, maintenance, and iteration.<p><br></p>If you are a highly motivated individual who thrives in a fast-paced environment and is passionate about creating innovative solutions for active traders, we would love to hear from you.<p><br></p>Interested in hearing more? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply Now" button. Back-End Developer

Effective communication with team members and stakeholders will be crucial to your success.<p><br></p><strong>Why join us?</strong><p><br></p>Job Responsibilities:<p><br></p>Develop real-time applications capable of managing and processing substantial data volumes.<p><br></p>Oversee the entire software lifecycle, including development, testing, reviewing, deployment, and maintenance.<p><br></p>Work within an agile environment to deliver solutions efficiently.<p><br></p>Maintain direct contact with project managers to facilitate successful project delivery<p><br></p><strong>Job Details</strong><p><br></p>Key Position Requirements:<p><br></p>Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science.<p><br></p>At least 3 years of experience in software development, including designing, implementing, testing, and maintaining real-time applications.<p><br></p>Proficiency in Java (knowledge of Scala is a plus).<p><br></p>Professional experience with Kubernetes and cloud services like Google Cloud Platform.<p><br></p>Reliable team player with a strong work ethic, exceptional accuracy, and excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.<p><br></p>Comfortable dealing with uncertainty and effectively communicating for issue resolution.<p><br></p>Ability to take full ownership of projects, from design and implementation to testing, deployment, maintenance, and iteration.<p><br></p>If you are a highly motivated individual who thrives in a fast-paced environment and is passionate about creating innovative solutions for active traders, we would love to hear from you.<p><br></p>Interested in hearing more? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply Now" button. Back-End Developer

title: Microsoft Full Stack Engineer - Professional
description: <strong><u>About Us<br><br></u></strong>Cognizant is one of the world's leading professional services companies, transforming clients' business, operating, and technology models for the digital era. Our unique industry-based, consultative approach helps clients envision, build, and run more innovative and efficient businesses. Headquartered in the U.S., Cognizant, a member of the NASDAQ-100, is ranked 195 on the Fortune 500 and is consistently listed among the most admired companies in the world. Learn how Cognizant helps clients lead with digital at www.cognizant.com.<br><br><strong><u>About Cognizant’s QEA Practice<br><br></u></strong>We are the most extensive Quality Assurance Practice Globally servicing 800+ Clients including 50+ clients in Fortune 100. We bring industry-leading vision and expertise to help with the Quality Engineering transformation journey for our reputed clients. We provide Next Gen QA offerings like System Modernization assurance, Business Process Assurance, Quality Engineering, Cloud Platform Assurance, Customer Experience Assurance and Robotic Test Automation. We have been ranked #1 for Market Impact by Everest Group four times in a row and #1 for completeness of vision, test advisory and Digital Business Assurance in Gartner Magic Quadrant.<br><br>Automation Tester<br><br>Roles and Responsibilities<br><ul><li> Implementation of automation framework using most effective design principles</li><li> Orchestrate automation solutions to support business objectives provided by Business leads or liaisons</li><li> Single point contact for all automation related solution frameworks</li><li> Standardize automation within a single supported framework/ methodology<br></li></ul><strong><u>Skill Set<br><br></u></strong><strong>Must have <br><br></strong><strong><u>Technical Skills<br></u></strong><ul><li>Strong in Java, Cucumber BDD, Selenium, Rest Assured, API Test Automation development,</li><li>Junit, TestNG frameworks, Test Data integration, Jira integration, Gherkins</li><li>CI CD using Jenkins, Linux commands, IntelliJ IDE, Gradle, Maven</li><li>Kafka topics data interactions, Json and Protocol Buffers</li><li>Ability to Design Test Automation Frameworks from Scratch<br></li></ul><strong>Good to have<br></strong><ul><li>Java Spring Boot Full Stack Development, Apache Camel, Kubernetes, AWS Certifications</li><li>Docker Containers, Kubernetes<br></li></ul><strong><u>Soft Skills<br></u></strong><ul><li>Excellent Analytical skills, Troubleshooting skills, Design thinking, Framework Concepts, Industry Standards tools and frameworks, methodology exposure, Trading Equity Derivatives domain experience <br></li></ul>Work Authorization<br><ul><li> Cognizant will only consider applicants for this position who are legally authorized to work in the United States without company sponsorship (H-1B, L-1B, L-1A, etc.)<br></li></ul><strong><u>Salary And Other Compensation<br><br></u></strong>The annual salary for this position is between $[XX, XXX.XX – XX, XXX.XX] depending on the experience and other qualifications of the successful candidate.<br><br>This position is also eligible for Cognizant’s discretionary annual incentive program, based on performance and subject to the terms of Cognizant’s applicable plans.<br><br>#LI- GS1<br><br><strong><u>Benefits<br><br></u></strong>Cognizant offers the following benefits for this position, subject to applicable eligibility requirements:<br><ul><li> Medical/Dental/Vision/Life Insurance</li><li> Paid holidays plus Paid Time Off</li><li> 401(k) plan and contributions</li><li> Long-term/Short-term Disability</li><li> Paid Parental Leave</li><li> Employee Stock Purchase Plan<br></li></ul>Disclaimer: The salary, other compensation, and benefits information are accurate as of the date of this posting. Cognizant reserves the right to modify this information at any time, subject to applicable law.<br><br>Employee Status : Full Time Employee<br><br>Shift : Day Job<br><br>Travel : No<br><br>Job Posting : May 25 2023<br><br><strong><u>About Cognizant<br><br></u></strong>Cognizant (Nasdaq-100: CTSH) is one of the world's leading professional services companies, transforming clients' business, operating and technology models for the digital era. title: Automation Developer
description: <strong>Job Overview And Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p>The Mobile Developer plays a Critical role in creating and maintaining the strategic partnership between business needs and technology delivery. The Mobile Developer's role is to lead the efforts to plan, design, develop and launch efficient systems and solutions in support of core organizational functions. This individual will apply proven communication, analytical and problem-solving skills to help identify, communicate and resolve issues, opportunities or problems in order to maximize the benefit of IT and Business investments. The Mobile Developer has extensive knowledge/experience across multiple technologies and business areas.<p><br></p><ul><li>Work collaboratively with cross-functional teams and business stakeholders to understand their requirements and design solutions that align with their needs.</li><li>Leads the design, development, and planning for solutions and technology standards to solve complex business problems</li><li>Hands-on development, support and troubleshoot software systems as required, optimizing performance, resolving problems, and providing follow-up on all issues and solutions</li><li>Ensures that systems are properly integrated</li><li>Works with business, support, or development teams recommending system enhancements</li><li>Consults across multiple United Information Technology projects and technology areas to perform troubleshooting, problem management, root-cause analysis, and solution implementation</li><li>Serves as a resource for technology/project development review and technical assessments</li><li>Ensures that the technical solutions meet the customers' business goals</li><li>Provide consultation and technical leadership in project life cycle planning</li><li>Ensures consistency and coherence to the enterprise standards and guiding principles throughout the application lifecycle</li><li>Identifies opportunities to leverage/influence the direction for existing infrastructure and application components</li><li>Keeps abreast of industry trends through benchmarking, participation in professional associations etc. in order to advise others of strategic technology direction</li><li>Provides feedback to the enterprise technology owners and Architects regarding future solution needs</li><li>Understands and applies the enterprise vision and strategy to the project solution while balancing tactical needs to deliver</li><li>Partner with various business and IT stakeholders in defining domain architecture strategy</li><li>Demonstrate exceptional knowledge of application architecture and architecture constructs as it connects to the enterprise architecture</li><li>Demonstrate mastery of the application of development domain areas and multiple technologies and tool set</li><li>Demonstrate mastery of software engineer</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications - External</strong><p><br></p><strong>Required </strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor's degree in Computer Science/Information Technology, related field or related experience</li><li>5+ years of professional development experience and knowledge in Android (Kotlin preferred)</li><li>5+ years of experience in design patterns and enterprise standards in application design</li><li>Effective Communication (verbal + written)</li><li>Effectively and efficiently work with team leadership and direct team </li><li>Understands Technology systems &amp; applications</li><li>Exceptional at coding and on time delivery of quality components and or applications</li><li>Exceptional at component and unit testing of following standard practices and methodologies</li><li>Exceptional utilizing the technologies and domain knowledge with the delivery of developed components or integrated components</li><li>Exceptional at working problems of moderate scope where analysis of situations or data requires review of a variety of factors</li><li>Excel with on time delivery with minimal supervision</li><li>Effective verbal and written communicator</li><li>Effective participant of requirements gathering, requirements analysis</li><li>Ability to work in Central Time Zone (CST) or Eastern Time Zone (EST)</li><li>Must be fluent in English (written and spoken)</li><li>Successful completion of interview required to meet job qualification</li><li>Reliable, punctual attendance is an essential function of the position</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>5+ years of experience and knowledge in iOS development (Swift/SwiftUI/UIKit). </li><li>Familiarity of full stack development</li><li>Familiarity of networking concepts and </li><li>Familiarity with code repositories like TFS, GitHub</li><li>Experience in the Airline Industry is a PLUS</li></ul> Android Developer

title: Senior Lease Admin Analyst
description: <strong>Top Investment Software Company - Hiring SRE / DevOps Engineers (Chicago)</strong><p><br></p>This Jobot Job is hosted by: Ryan Kilroy<p><br></p>Are you a fit? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply Now" button and sending us your resume.<p><br></p>Salary: $120,000 - $200,000 per year<p><br></p><strong>A bit about us:</strong><p><br></p>We are a dynamic and investor-backed FinTech company that's revolutionizing the trading industry! With our cutting-edge software and brokerage services, we empower active traders worldwide to analyze and react to data from the world's leading financial markets. As we continue to grow, we're seeking talented individuals to join our team and make a significant impact.<p><br></p>Based in the vibrant city of Chicago, our company culture is unlike any other. We foster an employee-centric environment that's inviting, comfortable, and fun. You will have the opportunity to work alongside passionate professionals who are dedicated to our mission and enjoy the journey together.<p><br></p>As a Site Reliability Engineer, you'll play a pivotal role within our expanding IT team. Reporting to the VP of Engineering, you'll collaborate across the organization to architect, advise, and develop scalable and secure solutions for our platform. Your expertise in cloud systems development and security controls will be invaluable as you drive a culture of observability and enhance our engineering pipeline.<p><br></p>To excel in this role, you'll bring a strong technical background and hands-on experience in building cloud systems at scale. You'll be skilled in designing distributed systems and possess a knack for constructing reliable and scalable infrastructure. Collaboration will be key, as you'll work with others to drive initiatives forward, balancing technical risks with business risks to achieve optimal results.<p><br></p><strong>Why join us?</strong><p><br></p>In this exciting position, your responsibilities will include:<p><br></p>Designing, developing, testing, deploying, maintaining, and enhancing container and Kubernetes based infrastructure to empower applications within our cloud environment.<p><br></p>Leading the migration of on-premise infrastructure to our cloud-based environment, ensuring a seamless transition.<p><br></p>Gathering functional requirements, developing technical specifications, and effectively planning and executing projects and tests.<p><br></p>Producing high-quality infrastructure-as-code with a results-oriented mindset.<p><br></p>Providing guidance to fellow engineers on running distributed applications in containerized environments.<p><br></p>Defining, implementing, and automating the continuous deployment of highly available, production workloads with zero downtime, while establishing operational metrics for monitoring.<p><br></p>Building well-tested, high-quality tools to boost developer productivity and create an exceptional developer experience.<p><br></p>Acting as the technical subject matter expert, mentoring colleagues, demonstrating expertise, and leading a small team to solve complex programming and design challenges.<p><br></p><strong>Job Details</strong><p><br></p>To thrive in this role, you'll need:<p><br></p>A Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.<p><br></p>5+ years of hands-on experience supporting cloud infrastructure operations in a large, complex, cloud-based environment.<p><br></p>Deep expertise working with Kubernetes and distributed systems.<p><br></p>A demonstrated understanding of SDLC, CI/CD pipelines, application observability, automation tools, and DevOps processes and philosophies.<p><br></p>Proven success in building infrastructure in the public cloud and deploying through CI/CD pipelines, utilizing technologies such as Istio, YAML, Python, Terraform, Docker, and Kubernetes.<p><br></p>Experience in defining risks and analyzing systems for threats and security vulnerabilities.<p><br></p>Production experience scaling and managing distributed Linux systems.<p><br></p>Strong troubleshooting skills and the ability to work effectively across multiple teams.<p><br></p>A passion for meticulous documentation, along with excellent oral and written communication skills.<p><br></p>Interested in hearing more? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply Now" button.

transition.<p><br></p>Gathering functional requirements, developing technical specifications, and effectively planning and executing projects and tests.<p><br></p>Producing high-quality infrastructure-as-code with a results-oriented mindset.<p><br></p>Providing guidance to fellow engineers on running distributed applications in containerized environments.<p><br></p>Defining, implementing, and automating the continuous deployment of highly available, production workloads with zero downtime, while establishing operational metrics for monitoring.<p><br></p>Building well-tested, high-quality tools to boost developer productivity and create an exceptional developer experience.<p><br></p>Acting as the technical subject matter expert, mentoring colleagues, demonstrating expertise, and leading a small team to solve complex programming and design challenges.<p><br></p><strong>Job Details</strong><p><br></p>To thrive in this role, you'll need:<p><br></p>A Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience.<p><br></p>5+ years of hands-on experience supporting cloud infrastructure operations in a large, complex, cloud-based environment.<p><br></p>Deep expertise working with Kubernetes and distributed systems.<p><br></p>A demonstrated understanding of SDLC, CI/CD pipelines, application observability, automation tools, and DevOps processes and philosophies.<p><br></p>Proven success in building infrastructure in the public cloud and deploying through CI/CD pipelines, utilizing technologies such as Istio, YAML, Python, Terraform, Docker, and Kubernetes.<p><br></p>Experience in defining risks and analyzing systems for threats and security vulnerabilities.<p><br></p>Production experience scaling and managing distributed Linux systems.<p><br></p>Strong troubleshooting skills and the ability to work effectively across multiple teams.<p><br></p>A passion for meticulous documentation, along with excellent oral and written communication skills.<p><br></p>Interested in hearing more? Easy Apply now by clicking the "Apply Now" button.

title: Mid-Level Software Engineer - C#/.NET
description: <strong>Helping careers take flight. Reshaping an industry. Enable your career to be Made on Duck Creek.  </strong> <p><br></p><strong>WHO WE ARE: </strong> <p><br></p>Duck Creek Technologies is the intelligent solutions provider defining the future of the property and casualty (P&amp;C) and general insurance industry. We are the platform upon which modern insurance systems are built, enabling the industry to capitalize on the power of the cloud to run agile, intelligent, and evergreen operations. Our modern SaaS solutions help insurers set a new standard and revolutionize how consumers interact with insurance companies.   <p><br></p>Authenticity, purpose, and transparency are core to Duck Creek, and we believe insurance should be there for individuals and businesses when, where, and how they need it most. Our market-leading solutions are available on a standalone basis or as a full suite, and all are available via Duck Creek OnDemand. With more than 1,000 successful implementations to date, Duck Creek removes the IT burden for insurers so they can focus on the business of insurance.  <p><br></p>We have a flock of more than 1,800 employees across the globe and are proud to be a Flexible-First employer. We empower our employees with the choice to work from an office, from home<u>,</u> or on a hybrid schedule. Our flexible-first environment fosters productivity, inclusion, collaboration, and ensures a consistent employee experience regardless of location.  <p><br></p>If working in a fast-paced, rapidly evolving company that is transforming one of the world’s oldest and largest industries sounds exciting, let us know. We are excited you are considering Duck Creek as a future employer and hope you decide to join “The Flock”!  <p><br></p>To learn more about us, visit www.duckcreek.com and follow us on our social channels for the latest information – LinkedIn and Twitter. <p><br></p><strong>TITLE</strong>: Software Engineer II - Automation Microservices<p><br></p><strong>WHAT YOU’LL DO: </strong><p><br></p>The Software Engineer II will Implement technical vision for multiple projects, as well as be expected to contribute to key platform, IaC, or framework components. Additional responsibilities include code review of projects, coding and/or configuring solutions for complex Agile stories across multiple domains or platform areas, and the creation of conceptual design/architecture diagrams. This role should excel at building high quality software that can be leverage across multiple domains or platform areas focusing on capabilities to be leveraged in automation and platform services.<p><br></p><strong><u>Responsibilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Regular interactions with technical leads to ensure proper strategy/execution. </li><li>Inform technical leaders of any impediments or technical limitations encountered. </li><li>Designs, codes, and delivers solutions to production for complexity Agile stories, independently across multiple domain or platform areas. </li><li>Helps to create a conceptual design/architecture for large scale software solutions in collaboration with architects. </li><li>Provides guidance and mentoring to software engineers to help them grow. </li><li>Debugs and resolves complex software bugs or issues, working independently, and finds the real root cause and provide a fix without collateral damage. Writes automated unit and integration-level tests under own direction. </li><li>Follows development standards and effectively demonstrate technical solutions to other developers in code reviews. Perform other related duties and activities as required. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>WHAT YOU’VE DONE: </strong> <p><br></p><ul><li>Bachelor’s degree, or higher education level, or its foreign equivalent, in Computer Science, Computer Information Sciences, and/or related field </li><li>Total Work Experience: 10+ years (software development), 7 years minimum. SaaS Product Experience: 3 years minimum; 5 years preferred. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong><u>Specialized Knowledge, Skills, And/or Abilities</u></strong><p><br></p><ul><li>Experience of scalable, resilient, modern, cloud-native microservice development with Java, .NET, Python, or Typescript </li><li>Experience in distributed software patterns, such as DDD, microservices, serverless, and event-driven architecture </li><li>Experience in Object-oriented design, Java or .NET development. Experience with CI/CD to deliver software enhancements to customers with full automation. </li><li>Experience in Cloud platforms and cloud-native architectures, including Serverless. </li><li>Experience with Terraform/Ansible or other IaC platforms. </li><li>Knowledge of CQRS, Kubernetes systems like GKE or AKS, event-driven architecture, and Kafka </li><li>Knowledge of building monitoring, alerting, and observability for maintaining high customer SLAs for SaaS delivered products. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>WHAT ADDITIONAL INFORMATION YOU MAY WANT TO KNOW: </strong> <p><br></p>Travel: Up to 10%<p><br></p>Location: Remote<p><br></p>Work Authorization: Legally authorized to work in the country of the job location<p><br></p><strong>WHAT WE STAND FOR:</strong>  <p><br></p>Our global company celebrates &amp; leverages the differences each employee brings to the table. Our success is a direct result of an inclusive culture where opportunities to learn from one another occur regardless of title, seniority, or background. This collaborative and team-oriented approach is at the core of how we operate and continuously improve our products, services, and systems.  As such, Duck Creek is committed to providing equal opportunity to all employees and applicants – to recruit, hire, train, and reward employees for their individual abilities, achievements, and experience without regard to race, color, gender, religion, sexual orientation, age, national origin, disability, marital, military, or any other protected status.  <p><br></p>We strive to be an example to the world of inclusion, diversity, and equity in all things – where employees are free to be their authentic selves in the workplace and in the communities in which we live. We believe in leading by example and are proud of the diversity of our team and our shared commitment to our Core Values: We Prioritize Respect; We Listen; We Care; We Add Value; and We Lead.<p><br></p>To learn more about our inclusive company culture, values, DE&amp;I initiatives, and people, please visit: https://www.duckcreek.com/life-at-duck-creek/. <p><br></p>Please let us know if you encounter accessibility barriers with our web content by sending an email to accessibility@duckcreek.com. <p><br></p><strong>Duck Creek Technologies does not accept, nor will we pay a fee for any hires resulting from unsolicited headhunter or agency resumes. </strong> <p><br></p>

title: Associate Business Managment Analyst - Pathways/Business Management Analyst - Pathways
description: At Crestron Electronics, Inc we build the technology that integrates technology.<p><br></p>We are proud to be the largest and most recognized brand in automation and control solutions, and the premier technology partner for fortune 500 businesses globally. Our products’ are integrated into new high-tech commercial buildings’ to include some of the most exciting real estate throughout the world. Our clients include Google, Microsoft, Amazon , Linked In and many others. We are the leaders in the most exciting industry in the world!<p><br></p>Our automation and control solutions for homes and buildings allow our clients to control entire environments with the push of a button, integrating systems such as Audio Visual, Lighting, Shading, Security, Building Management Systems and HVAC to provide greater comfort, convenience and security.<p><br></p><strong>Overview</strong><p><br></p>Crestron’s web team is looking for a talented and self-motivated U.S. based backend web full stack developer to be responsible for the coding of both the backend and front-end of multiple websites (using supplied UI templates). You will build the website from concept all the way to completion. This is a remote position reporting into our Rockleigh, NJ location where our core Marketing Department is located.<p><br></p><strong>Responsibilities</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Conceptualize and create an intuitive, engaging, and brand-consistent web experience using the latest web design best practices. </li><li> Working with user interaction and code maintainability </li><li> Develop and optimize features, as well as prototype and implement new features. </li><li> Provide guidance and direction to other </li><li> Work closely with other developers to solve design issues. </li><li> Responsible for performance analysis and design improvements, troubleshooting, root cause analysis. </li><li> Provide technical documentation, including test procedures, design specification, etc. </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Qualifications</strong><p><br></p>Ideal candidate is a well-rounded full-stack web developer, based in the United States with prior big company portal experience, who thrives on solving problems with a passion for programming, working in a team environment :<p><br></p><ul><li> Required: Minimum 3 - 5 years of professional experience as a C# .NET developer. </li><li> Required: Proficiency with ASP.NET Core or later </li><li> Required: Ability to architect applications using frameworks and APIs </li><li> Required: Proficiency in software engineering principles, life cycle, and best practices. </li><li> Required: Ability to work both independently and in teams. </li><li> Required: Experience writing client/server applications </li><li> Required: Experience with cross-browser development (including mobile) </li><li>Mandatory Technical Skills</li><ul><li> NET Core </li><li> C# </li><li> Web API (REST and SOAP) </li><li> SQL, LINQ </li><li> JavaScript / HTML / CSS </li><li> JQuery </li><li> At least one of: Angular, React, or Vue </li></ul><li> Preferred skills: </li><ul><li>Experience with user interface design principles, and standards</li><li> Experience or familiarity with Agile methodology </li><li> College degree preferred, but not required </li></ul></ul><p><br></p>Candidates must be able to travel to our New Jersey HQ for training and team onboarding periodically<p><br></p>We cannot accept resume's from Agencies, or any third party submittals.<p><br></p>This is a remote position - ideally for an East Coast based person who can work on W2 basis who would be able to be onsite in Rockleigh NJ 5-6 times/year.<p><br></p>We are not able to provide sponsorship for this position now or in the future<p><br></p>Crestron Electronics offers a competitive total compensation package including Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, Short Term Disability, 401K with company match, Paid Time Off, Holidays, On-site Amenities at NJ Headquarters &amp; TX Facilities, Crestron Market Cafes, Fitness Centers, and Wellness Centers.<p><br></p>At Crestron Electronics, Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion drive innovation. Crestron’s success hinges on continuing to build a workforce of unique individuals whose passion inspires us to create and revolutionize industry-leading products and services. There will always be more to accomplish, and at Crestron, we believe the best way forward is together.<p><br></p><strong>EOE/M/F/D/V</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>No Solicitation* Any agency submittal to any employee of Crestron Electronics, Inc by any method of communication will be deemed the sole property of Crestron Electronics Inc.</li></ul><p><br></p>Apply Now

There will always be more to accomplish, and at Crestron, we believe the best way forward is together.<p><br></p><strong>EOE/M/F/D/V</strong><p><br></p><ul><li>No Solicitation* Any agency submittal to any employee of Crestron Electronics, Inc by any method of communication will be deemed the sole property of Crestron Electronics Inc.</li></ul><p><br></p>Apply Now

title: System Software Engineer - Golang compiler, tooling, and ecosystem
description: Hello,<p><br></p>My name is Meenakshi Pandey,Staffing Specialist at Vbridge global LLC .We are a national recruiting company which partners with many of the leading employers across the United States.<p><br></p>I am reaching out to you on an exciting job opportunity with one of our direct clients.<p><br></p>Job Title React Developer III<p><br></p>Rate: $40/hr on W2<p><br></p>LocationChicago, IL<p><br></p>Remote WorkPartial<p><br></p>Job Description:<p><br></p>As a React Developer, you will help lead the modernization of client.com.<p><br></p>You will be responsible for writing efficient, testable, and reusable code using React and Redux.<p><br></p>We are looking for a developer who is passionate about writing the best quality code and has knowledge/experience across multiple technologies. A successful developer in this role will be one who can accurately comprehend business requirements and code creative solutions to satisfy those requirements to deliver on the best experience for our customers.<p><br></p>This role will be working within an agile team environment building and updating design system components for client.com and leading the way in enhancing the performance and quality of the codebase.<p><br></p>HERE’S WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING:<p><br></p><ul><li> Lead the design, development, and planning for solutions that maintain client’s technology standards</li><li> Solve complex performance problems and architectural challenges</li><li> Perform code reviews and mentor your peers</li><li> Help to troubleshoot, test, and maintain the product</li><li> Work in an Agile environment</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Required</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> 5+ years of experience in software development</li><li> 3+ years of expert level Javascript experience with React, Redux, Webpack and ES6 or equivalent experience</li><li> A deep understanding of accessibility fundamentals and its application in creating robust user interfaces</li><li> Experience in Source code repositories like Github</li><li> Experience with end to end CI/CD solutions using platforms like TeamCity</li><li> Experience with web application testing frameworks like Jest or Enzyme</li><li> Understanding of complex large-scale application architecture</li><li> Demonstrated technical leadership in a web application development team</li><li> Excellent communication and people skills</li><li> BS/BA, preferably in a technical or scientific field or equivalent experience, education or training</li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Knowledge of Object-Oriented Programming</li><li> Ability to create high level application architecture</li></ul><p><br></p>Thanks &amp; Regards,<p><br></p>Meenakshi Pandey |Sr.Technical Recruiter<p><br></p>VBridge Global LLC | An E-Verify Employer<p><br></p>Women-Owned Minority Certified Business<p><br></p>Direct ::<p><br></p>;/p&gt;

A successful developer in this role will be one who can accurately comprehend business requirements and code creative solutions to satisfy those requirements to deliver on the best experience for our customers.<p><br></p>This role will be working within an agile team environment building and updating design system components for United.com and leading the way in enhancing the performance and quality of the codebase.<p><br></p>HERE’S WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING:<p><br></p><ul><li> Lead the design, development, and planning for solutions that maintain United’s technology standards </li><li> Solve complex performance problems and architectural challenges </li><li> Perform code reviews and mentor your peers </li><li> Help to troubleshoot, test, and maintain the product </li><li> Work in an Agile environment </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Required</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> 5+ years of experience in software development </li><li> 3+ years of expert level Javascript experience with React, Redux, Webpack and ES6 or equivalent experience </li><li> A deep understanding of accessibility fundamentals and its application in creating robust user interfaces </li><li> Experience in Source code repositories like Github </li><li> Experience with end to end CI/CD solutions using platforms like TeamCity </li><li> Experience with web application testing frameworks like Jest or Enzyme </li><li> Understanding of complex large-scale application architecture </li><li> Demonstrated technical leadership in a web application development team </li><li> Excellent communication and people skills </li><li> BS/BA, preferably in a technical or scientific field or equivalent experience, education or training </li></ul><p><br></p><strong>Preferred</strong><p><br></p><ul><li> Knowledge of Object-Oriented Programming </li><li> Ability to create high level application architecture</li></ul>
